In the first three years of its existence, FACTS acquired over 100 partners in most European countries. Job purpose As we are a football company, we have to be aware of all trends and developments that happen in the world of football. First and foremost in terms of data. It will be your responsibility to use the huge data pool that we have and extract interesting and useful insights from it. You will create structure in all data that we have, make internal and external dashboards and add value to our credibility as a forerunner in the use of data in football. Tasks and Responsibilities: Give structure to the huge data pool we have Extract insightful points of interest from this data pool Create graphs and plots for our reports Create dashboards for internal and external use Qualifications: We are looking for someone that wants to get more experience in the football industry and wants to learn a lot along the way. So, are you studying and have some time free? Do you have a gap year and looking for a kickstart of your career? Do you have time available in your curriculum for an internship? Then this would be the perfect opportunity for you. Experienced in Python (pandas, matplotlib), SQL, and Power BI (is a pro) Write efficient and well-documented code Fluent in English Neat and structured work ethic Creative and curious Solution oriented, critical thinking What we offer Fun, dedicated and young team Flexible working hours Room for your ideas and contributions A football environment to develop your personal skills and ambitions Get in touch with us: gijs@factsconsultancy.nl

title: Junior Data Analist
description: (Almost) finished with your degree? And would you like to continue developing your knowledge and skills in Data & IT? Kickstart your career as a data analyst with one of our partners, and develop yourself with our traineeship! This is what you'll do As a data analyst, you’ll immediately join one of our partners as a data analyst, becoming an integral part of a team within companies such as Volksbank, Tikkie, Van Lanschot Kempen or ING. As a data analyst within the financial domain, you’ll collect, process and maintain big data sets. This means that you will primarily be analysing large amounts of data, and processing them into dashboards. That’s why you must have a knack for recognising trends and be skilled at preparing reports. The job varies per partner, depending on the company type, task, and department. Together, we’ll determine which company suits you best. This is you You’ve (almost) finished a university degree in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, Business Analytics, Business Informatics, Mathematics, or Physics. You’re familiar with the principles of programming languages, such as Python. You have strong social skills. You have strong analytical skills. You currently live in the Netherlands. Dit betekent een traineeship voor jou Jouw ontwikkeling in een stroomversnelling Maak je op voor een groeispurt. Dankzij een boordevol programma maak jij een razendsnelle ontwikkeling door in kennis en vaardigheden. Ook krijg je een persoonlijk budget om te besteden aan opleidingen en trainingen die jij belangrijk vindt. Een persoonlijke talentmanager Tijdens het traineeship word je begeleid door jouw eigen talentmanager. Dankzij deze persoonlijke aandacht leer je veel over je kwaliteiten en hoe je jouw talent het best kunt benutten. Maar ook wat jouw blinde vlekken zijn en hoe je omgaat met valkuilen. Onderdeel van een diverse groep young professionals Je doet het niet alleen. Je deelt ervaringen en kennis met young professionals uit verschillende richtingen. Zowel bij inhoudelijke, als bij sociale gelegenheden. Vaak bouw je met deze groep een sterke band op, zowel op persoonlijk, als professioneel vlak. The benefits A gross salary of €3,629.53 per month based on 40 hours (including vacation allowance and a 13th month pay). The opportunity to develop yourself in a fast-growing environment. 25 annual leave days (based on 40 hours). Travel reimbursement. A wide selection of courses, such as: Java, Python, R, and SQL. Personal training budget of €2,000 annually. Free to be spent however you see fit. The freedom to (partially) work from home. "Vanuit de universiteit is het best wennen om opeens fulltime te werken. De waarde van het traineeship zit met name in de begeleiding die je krijgt." Bregje Klomp - Young Professional “Door het traineeship is mijn zelfvertrouwen gegroeid. Ik kom meer voor mezelf op en ik heb meer vertrouwen in mijn eigen kunnen.” Matthijs Lip - Young Professional The traineeship To grow from a starting data analyst into a specialist, it’s crucial to develop yourself in various areas. During your studies, you’ve already gained a lot of knowledge about Data & IT, but now it’s time to put that knowledge into practice at one of our client companies. In addition to your job at the company, you’ll also receive coaching from a talent manager at Solid Professionals. With your talent manager, you’ll discuss your progress and any issues you might encounter on your client assignment. Niet zomaar een werkgever Tijdens jouw traineeship ben je in dienst bij Solid Professionals. Wij zijn niet zomaar een werkgever. We zijn ervan overtuigd dat mensen de organisatie maken en willen daarom dat jij het beste uit jezelf haalt. Jouw ontwikkeling en werkgeluk zijn onze prioriteit. We zijn de vraagbaak en achterban waar je op kunt vertrouwen. We organiseren lunches, borrels, bbq’s, sportactiviteiten en nodigen regelmatig interessante gastsprekers uit. Zo leer je veel medetrainees kennen en alumni die hetzelfde traject als jij hebben doorlopen. Solliciteren, en dan? Ben je enthousiast? Solliciteer dan meteen. We nemen zo snel mogelijk contact met je op om te kijken of er een match is. Is er een match, dan stellen we je graag voor aan jouw team of manager. Nog steeds iedereen enthousiast? Dan kan je aan de slag!

title: Data Analist
description: Data Analyst Intelligence Led Financial Crime In het kort Als Intelligence Led Financial Crime (ILFC) Data Analist speur je naar criminele financiële geldstromen en onbekende patronen. Je prepareert en analyseert data, werkt met een team van experts, en brengt je bevindingen helder in kaart. Je bent betrokken bij zowel thematische als urgente financiële misdaadonderzoeken. Als onmisbare schakel waarborg je de kwaliteit en deel je je kennis. Benieuwd naar deze boeiende rol? Werkomgeving Onze rol als gatekeeper verandert in een snel veranderende wereld. We streven naar een duurzaam financieel systeem en zetten ons in voor het opsporen van financiële criminaliteit. Nieuwe technologie biedt zowel kansen als bedreigingen, dit is een voortdurend proces dat dagelijkse expertise en alertheid vereist. Binnen Detecting Financial Crime (DFC) hebben we zes units die samenwerken om financiële criminaliteit te detecteren. Bij het ILFC-team in Amersfoort, onderdeel van DFC Oversight, werken 30 gedreven investigators, data scientists en analisten. We richten ons op thematische onderzoeken, netwerkanalyses en het opvolgen van urgente signalen, zoals negatieve media, om financiële risico’s zoals witwassen en terrorismefinanciering aan te pakken. Ons jonge, enthousiaste team is vastbesloten om onontdekte financiële criminaliteit bloot te leggen en verbeteringen door te voeren. In een multidisciplinaire omgeving leer je van diverse collega’s, heb je zichtbare maatschappelijke impact en krijg je een brede inkijk in onze bank. Je werkt zelfstandig maar niet alleen waarbij je rapporteert aan de team lead Thematic Investigations. Wij werken 2 dagen per week vanaf kantoor en de overige dagen vanaf thuis. Klaar om bij te dragen aan onze boeiende missie? Je werk Jouw rol richt zich op: Verwerken van ruwe big data tot bruikbare informatie en rapportages; Het vinden van nieuwe en onbekende patronen van financiële criminaliteit, stromen van crimineel geld; Het vaststellen van de feiten en voorstellen doen voor aanvullende onderzoeken op basis van je bevindingen; Onderzoeken hoe meer informatie uit beschikbare data te halen is en voorstellen doen om deze data verder te verrijken; Als teamplayer mee helpen de verschillende projecten op te zetten en te bewaken; Het waarborgen van de kwaliteit van de verschillende projecten, samen met een ILFC investigator. Je profiel Ben je klaar voor deze uitdaging? Check je profiel: Je hebt minimaal 2 jaar ervaring op WO/HBO niveau met data analytics, bijvoorbeeld met R, SQL, Python of SAS; Je hebt een kwantitatief georiënteerde opleiding afgerond (HBO/WO), zoals informatie technologie, (bedrijfs)wiskunde, econometrie, natuurkunde, data science of een kwantitatieve specialisatie binnen de sociale wetenschappen; Je bent ondernemend, pionierend en creatief; je durft de stap aan in een omgeving waar nog niets vast staat en waar je je kennis en ervaring kunt laten gelden; Je bent intrinsiek gemotiveerd om criminele geldstromen te ontdekken, analyseren en rapporteren; Je bent pragmatisch en gestructureerd en bent nieuwsgierig naar inhoudelijke onderwerpen; Je bent nieuwsgierig, gedreven, analytisch, een teamspeler en beschikt over goede communicatieve en schriftelijke vaardigheden. Wij bieden Bij het ILFC kom je terecht in een gedreven en dynamische werkomgeving, waarin hard gewerkt wordt vanuit een gezamenlijke visie en doelstelling. Er is sprake van een platte structuur, korte communicatielijnen, resultaatgerichtheid en intensieve samenwerking met andere afdelingen. We stellen hoge eisen aan ons werk maar verliezen hierbij nooit de menselijke touch uit het oog, omdat we ervan overtuigd zijn dat juist dat essentieel is voor het slagen van onze missie. Vanuit deze werkcontext bieden we je de ruimte je zowel professioneel als persoonlijk te ontwikkelen. Interesse? Solliciteer direct online. Neem voor meer informatie contact op met Jorick Berckmans, Team lead Thematic Investigations ILFC (06-1397 4579). Wij zijn erg benieuwd naar jouw verhaal! Gelijke kansen voor iedereen Het succes van onze organisatie staat of valt met de kwaliteit van onze mensen en de ideeen die zij hebben. Echt verrassende inzichten en innovatieve oplossingen voor onze klanten ontstaan door een samenspel van culturen, kennis en ervaring. Daarom is diversiteit voor onze organisatie ontzettend belangrijk. Om ervoor te zorgen dat alle collega's binnen ABN AMRO hun kwaliteiten kunnen ontplooien, stimuleren we een inclusieve cultuur waarin iedereen zich betrokken en gewaardeerd voelt. Disclaimer externe recruitmentbureaus Externe recruitmentbureaus dienen een overeenkomst met ABN AMRO BANK N.V. te hebben getekend, uitgegeven door een Talent Acquisition Specialist, om CV's te mogen indienen. Acquisitie wordt daarom niet op prijs gesteld Wij vragen Een creatief brein Wij bieden Analytische skills

title: Financial Analyst
description: At Johnson & Johnson, we look for people who will show up as their whole self because we value diversity, equity, and inclusion, as well as people who enjoy fun and interacting with others. Janssen Business Services (JBS) is an integral part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, a global healthcare leader with a legacy spanning over a century. Our mission at JBS is to safeguard and enhance the intellectual property (IP) structures that underpin the Janssen business model. We do this through close collaboration with Janssen Commercial, R&D, Supply Chain, Tax, and Treasury teams, fostering an environment of innovation and excellence. Financial Analyst Location: The Netherlands (Leiden) Our mission is to be diligent stewards of Janssen's business model, ensuring the protection and optimization of our product intellectual property. We uphold the following values: 1.Excellence: We are dedicated to delivering high-quality financial services,information, and project support. 2.Collaboration: We work closely with key stakeholders across the globe,fostering effective partnerships and efficient operations. 3.Innovation: We continuously seek opportunities for processstandardization, automation, and digitalization to drive efficiency andexcellence. 4.Ownership: We take ownership of our processes, aiming for continuousimprovement and identifying opportunities for growth. The responsibilities & the impact YOU will have: Are you ready to take your financial career to the global stage and make a meaningful impact in the pharmaceutical industry? Janssen Business Services (JBS) is seeking a Financial Analyst to join our diverse and dynamic team in one of our strategic locations. You will play a pivotal role in delivering financial excellence and innovation as part of our virtual JBS Shared Competency Center. Financial Operations: Perform a wide range of financial operations,including Intercompany, Procure-to-Pay, Master Data, General Ledger &Reporting, Systems administration, and more, ensuring compliance withfinance accounting policies and internal controls. Stakeholder Collaboration: Collaborate closely with key stakeholders,both locally and globally, to ensure smooth operations and adherence toestablished service models. Process Optimization and continuous improvements: Identifyopportunities for standardization and automation within your scope ofresponsibility. Contribute to the design and deployment of new andimproved processes, leveraging specialized resources and JBS PMO &Digital teams. Subject Matter Expertise: Engage in key JBS and Global Financeprojects, such as ERP and digitalization tools deployment, bringing astrategic and operational perspective within the Shared CompetencyCenter's scope. Subject Matter Expertise: Act as a Subject Matter Expert (SME) forassigned processes, ensuring alignment with stakeholders, robust processdocumentation, and efficient end-to-end activities. Continuous Improvement: Demonstrate ownership and a mindset forcontinuous improvement, proactively identifying and pursuingopportunities for business enhancement, efficiency, and processautomation. Qualifications We would love to hear from YOU, if you have/are: Bachelor's degree in finance/economics (or equivalent) Experience in a similar position for at least 2 years A team player and have a global mindset. Accurate and have strong analytical skills and can effectively collaborate in a complex environment within a specified timeframe. The capacity to efficiently process a substantial amount of operational data. You are flexible, eager to learn, highly motivated, hands-on and stress resistant. Passionate about taking ownership and advancing issues towards resolution. You can express yourself fluently in English. Being proficient in MS Office and eager to learn new software tools and processes. SAP knowledge is a plus. Why Choose Johnson & Johnson? At Johnson & Johnsons, you'll be part of a global network committed to financial excellence, innovation, and collaboration. We offer a work environment that values your individuality, fosters professional growth, and promotes a culture of inclusion and equity. In addition to competitive compensation and benefits, we are open to discussing flexible work arrangements that suit your needs. Your well-being and work-life balance matter to us. Join us in our mission to safeguard Janssen's intellectual property and contribute to a healthier world. Apply today and become a key player in the Johnson & Johnson family. Johnson & Johnson is an equal opportunity employer. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds and experiences.

title: Data Analyst
description: Powering our sustainable future, together We live in an era where electric mobility is "the new normal." Whereas over the past decade, electric vehicles were only for the few, today they are for everyone. Welcome to the electric era. Enter EVBox. Founded in 2010, EVBox empowers forward-thinking businesses to build a sustainable future by providing flexible and scalable electric vehicle charging solutions. With its offering of residential, commercial, and fast charging stations, as well as scalable charging management software, EVBox ensures that electric mobility is accessible to everyone. We believe in a future where daily transportation is emission-free and sustained by smart charging infrastructure. That's why we've made it our goal to accelerate the adoption of electric mobility by bringing the most accessible and scalable charging solutions to the world. However, the transition from gas to electric cars will change a great deal of what we know about transportation. The growth and success of EVBox is driven by the passion and dedication of everyone in the company. Today, EVBox has grown into an international team across multiple offices in Europe and the United States, with hundreds of driven professionals from different wals of life working for us. About Us: At the Everon Platform Organization within EVBox, we empower forward-thinking businesses to build a sustainable future by providing top-notch EV Charging management solutions. Our engineers build new products, enhance existing solutions and resolve many interesting challenges on a daily basis. This work is delivered in a culture that emphasizes ownership and excellence. Everyone is empowered to make bold decisions and take responsibility for the solutions they build. About the Role: As a Data Analyst, you will join our Data team to expand the data capabilities of the Everon platform. We leverage the vast amounts of data from our global network of customers and charging stations to build high-quality data sets, generate valuable insights, and create innovative data products. We build and run data services and pipelines that validate and enrich incoming data, and provide convenient and secure access to teams across the organization. Our aim is to empower our customers and deliver a delightful user experience by responsibly leveraging data, learning from insights, growing our knowledge, and paving the way towards a sustainable future. In this role you will: Analyze transactional and operational data, leveraging data analysis and models to unlock actionable insights, identify business improvement opportunities, and provide recommendations to enhance performance and efficiency Design, execute, and interpret experiments to validate hypotheses, drawing detailed and impactful conclusions to drive innovation and optimize delivery processes Collaborate closely with various teams, aligning on data strategy and KPIs. Engage with stakeholders to collect requirements, deliver insights, and ensure clear communication of findings, recommendations, and progress Provide and support tools and data visualizations to stakeholders to empower their data-based decision-making process Develop data-driven business insights to find opportunities and recommend the prioritization of product, growth, and optimization initiatives Being able to define and design business value from raw data and implement data models with an abstraction level close to the business domains Enhance the data landscape by collaborating with peers to ensure data logging and data pipelines' availability, integrity, accuracy, and reliability About you: You hold a Bachelor's degree or higher in Math, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or other related quantitative fields 4+ years of experience in roles such as Product Analyst, Data Analyst, or in other data analysis-focused functions Advanced SQL expertise and strong Python proficiency for data analysis and modelling. Experience working with dbt is a plus Experienced with dashboarding/data visualization platforms such as Grafana, Tableau, Looker, or similar Ability to deliver on tight deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks while maintaining quality and detail Proven track record of handling large datasets, extracting insights, and summarizing key learnings and takeaways Proven aptitude toward Data Storytelling and Root Cause Analysis using data At EVBox, we believe that when people feel valued and rewarded their potential is unlimited. We offer competitive salaries and review remuneration packages regularly to ensure that our pay always positively reflects performance. We promote within, offering learning and development opportunities, and we also provide the following benefits, as standard: A very diverse workforce and an open culture Private pension contribution 25 vacation days Holiday Swap (2 days) - ability to swap out a public holiday for a paid vacation day Commuting allowance Up to 3 days remote working, including working from home allowance of EUR 2 net per day (in consultation with your manager) Budget of 600 Euro to set up your home office Ability to work remotely from anywhere outside of the Netherlands for 4 weeks Access to learning platforms and personal development budget Across our 8 locations, more than 700 EVBoxers work together to provide electric vehicle charging solutions that help businesses move forward. Are you ready to join them? Hit apply. We at EVBox aim to take down historical and structural barriers that stand in the way of our employees. The chargers we manufacture are built for the sustainable future we believe in. We commit to sustained action in tackling processes and practices that systematically penalize our employees. Our DEI efforts are designed not just for the present, but create long-lasting change in the future of our industry. We continue to learn and dismantle the roadblocks that our people face in order to create positive outcomes for all. We believe in an equitable, diverse and inclusive environment where everyone, no matter their gender, race, ethnicity, national origin, age, sexual orientation, identity, religious belief, education or ability, feel valued and respected. We embrace diverse life experiences and heritages and ensure that all voices are valued and heard. Do you want to get to know us even better? Then pay a visit to our Career page, blog or check out our social media channels: LinkedIn, YouTube, Instagram, Facebook or Twitter. EVBox will retain your personal data collected through the application process for 1 year after the position is filled in case of rejection. You can request your data to be deleted at any time. Please read about how EVBox processes your personal data here. EVBox will retain your personal data collected through the application process for 1 year after the position is filled in case of rejection. You can request your data to be deleted at any time. Please read here how EVBox processes your personal data.

title: Data Analist
description: Hoe maak jij onze klanten blij? Bol.com verandert retail om het dagelijks leven van 13 miljoen klanten makkelijker te maken. Dat doen we samen met 52.000 partners die ons retail tech platform verrijken met proposities die klantharten sneller laten kloppen. Uiteraard willen we dat de hele customer journey hartveroverend verloopt. Uitdagend, want ons platform groeit snel en we willen klanten een bol.com waardig service bieden, ongeacht of ze een artikel bij ons of bij een partner kopen. In deze rol lever je daar een impactvolle bijdrage aan door klantfeedback naar actiewaardige adviezen te vertalen, die waardevol zijn voor al onze partners en het platform zelf. De grootste uitdaging Voor bol.com is customer happiness geen bonus, maar een KPI. En dus staat dit hoog op ieders prioriteitenlijstje. Maar hoe maak je customer happiness tastbaar en datagedreven? En hoe geven we actiegerichte informatie aan de business en onze partners? Dit zijn vraagstukken die beginnen bij het Customer Happiness team. Oftewel: wij willen begrijpen waarom klanten (on)tevreden zijn, door patronen in klantvragen en Net Promotor Score (NPS) te spotten en door die inzichten naar adviezen voor interne collega’s en externe partners te vertalen. Uitdagend, want we wroeten in een enorme bak data: soms volstaat aggregatie & data visualisatie, maar andere keren moeten (machine learned) tekst-mining modellen uitkomst bieden. Aan jou om, op basis van data-analyses, kansen te spotten hoe we de gehele klantervaring kunnen verbeteren. Wat je doet als Data Analyst Customer Happiness Datalab? Je bent de expert op het gebied van onze KPI’s die gaan over de gehele klantervaring en je ziet verbanden met andere belangrijke metrics. Je weet de data goed te structureren, te documenteren en te innoveren en gebruikt hierbij tools als Gitlab, BigQuery en Python (dbt) Je prioriteert & visualiseert verbeterkansen die je samen met je collega’s vertaalt naar concreet acties en gebruikt hierbij tools als Tableau, LookerStudio en PowerPoint Je ondersteunt en inspireert teamleden, zodat ze zelf ook (beter) met data gaan werken Waarom jij het verschil kunt maken Omdat je een conceptueel sterke Data Analyst bent die graag concrete projecten oppakt; analyses & data visualisatie om verklaringen boven water te krijgen, is je passie. We verwachten dat je thuis bent in SQL en dashboarding tools (denk LookerStudio of Tableau). Verder is het belangrijk dat je grote stromen data wilt analyseren, interpreteren én modelleren. Zo kom je tot inzichten die niet alleen keurig het verleden beschrijven, maar vooral wegwijzers zijn naar een betere toekomst. 3 redenen waarom dit (n)iets voor jou is Laat zien waarom niet Laat zien waarom wel - Held op sokken Je wordt graag aan de hand meegenomen en vindt autonoom pionieren griezelig - Geen interesse Je beschouwt klantgedrag en klantfeedback als onbelangrijk - Analyzing Only Je hebt weinig interesse in het bouwen van (voorspellende) modellen + Je hebt de papieren Je hebt een relevante Master en 3+ jaar relevante (!) werkervaring + Je hebt de skills Je bent thuis in data gedreven business processoptimalisatie en/of hebt vergelijkbare (onderzoeks)rollen ingevuld + Je overtuigt Je draagt inzichten overtuigend over, inclusief mogelijke acties en resultaten Hier kom je terecht Bij hét online retail tech platform van Nederland en België. Een platform waar 13 miljoen Nederlandse en Belgische klanten kiezen uit meer dan 25 miljoen artikelen. En een platform dat zo’n 52.000 zakelijke partners helpt succesvol te ondernemen. Maar vooral een platform dat nooit ‘af’ is, want bol.com verandert retail al sinds 1999. En dat blijven we doen. Als het beter kan, maken we het beter! Samen met klanten, partners en zo’n 2.700 collega’s. Als Data Analyst werk je binnen het Customer Happiness team, een mix van data analysten, business analysten en (ML) engineers. Als team hebben wij veel stakeholders en veel verschillende projecten. De sfeer is open, innovatief en samenwerkingsgericht: solo ga je hard, maar samen kom je verder. De voordelen van een blauw hart Wat je nog meer krijgt Aan en uit Eerst voor jezelf zorgen, dan voor je omgeving en dan voor bol – dat is onze gouden regel. Daarom krijgt iedere bol’er 29 vakantiedagen om op te laden en bij te tanken. Jouw tweede huis Een omgeving waar je je thuis kunt voelen. Ons kantoor in Utrecht noemen we de ‘campus’, volledig uitgerust om het beste uit je dag te halen. Flexibele werkcultuur Een omgeving die zo flexibel is als je favoriete yoga houding. Dat vind je bij bol. Meestal werk je 50% op kantoor en 50% vanuit huis,. Sollicitatieproces Alles dat je moet weten over je sollicitatieproces bij bol.com Je solliciteert Wij bekijken je sollicitatie zorgvuldig en binnen twee weken weet je of we je uitnodigen voor een gesprek. Het eerste contact Wij nemen telefonisch contact met je op om het eerste gesprek in te plannen. En als we elkaar toch al spreken, pak vooral de kans om alvast prangende vragen te stellen. Elkaar in het echt (digitaal) ontmoeten Tijdens het eerste gesprek maken we kennis met elkaar. We zullen ingaan op jouw competenties en je eerdere werkervaring. En natuurlijk ook de inhoud van de functie. Het tweede gesprek Voor het tweede gesprek vragen we je om van te voren een online assessment te maken. Bij sommige functies kunnen we je vragen om iets extra's, zoals een business case. Wederzijdse liefde Is er een wederzijdse match? Dan doen wij je graag een aanbod bestaande uit een passend salaris en onze arbeidsvoorwaarden. We doen nog een laatste dubbelcheck op het papierwerk in de vorm van een screening. Daarna start jouw avontuur bij bol.com! Nog vragen? Marvin Ensing, Recruiter Werkervaring marvinensing@bol.com

title: Data Analyst
description: About Apeiron Insight Apeiron Insight is a data-driven research & analytics company, providing data products and insights to investment companies. We use predictive modelling to deliver actionable intelligence to the biggest sharks in the tank. Apeiron Insight is growing fast. We are hiring for several roles in multiple disciplines to scale up our operation. Your role with us As a Data Analyst you are responsible for analyzing Apeiron’s various data streams. You will help the Data Engineering team to spot anomalies in the data processing & provide the Business team with data analyses and actionable insights. You collect and combine data sets from various sources and build and maintain dashboards and reports to provide insights into the processes in our warehouse. Main responsibilities will include: Collecting, analyzing and interpreting large amounts of data. Identifying patterns, trends and deviations in the data and translating them into understandable reports and actionable insights. Maintaining existing data processes and engineering new (automation) solutions to achieve better and faster reporting and analysis of our various datasets. Collaborating with the Engineering team to optimize data collection and analysis processes. Presenting findings and recommendations to internal stakeholders in a clear and concise manner and become the intermediary between the business needs and data solutions. What are we looking for? Bachelor’s or master’s degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science or a related field. Demonstrable experience in analyzing large datasets and using statistical analysis methods. Extensive knowledge of programming languages such as Python and SQL. Experience with data visualization and the use of tools such as Excel (including writing macros) and Power BI and data analysis libraries, such as Matplotlib, Pandas, NumPy and SciPy. You are a self-starter who works well in a fast-paced environment. You are currently living in the Netherlands and are able to fluently communicate in English (verbally and in writing). Command of the Dutch language is a plus. You are legally allowed to work in the Netherlands. You are able to come to our lovely office in Rijswijk twice a week, or more. What we offer? This is your chance to join a dynamic data company where you’ll be part of a very ambitious and smart team on a mission. You’ll get all the benefits of working for an agile scale-up such as a relaxed work environment, the possibility to work from home part of the time, easy-going colleagues and freedom in your work. Additionally, we offer you: Competitive salary tailored to your skills & experience. 25 vacation days based on a 40 hour working week. 8% holiday payment. Profit Sharing Bonus scheme. Pension & Mobility Allowance. An annual budget of €3.000 to spend on professional or personal development. Hybrid work model: a mix of working from home and in the office. Healthy and delicious buffet breakfast, lunch and a filled refrigerator in the office. Everything you need to work from home: a screen, keyboard and mouse. Fun events with colleagues. A referral reward program: refer a friend for one of our jobs. If you think this position fits you well, we sincerely hope to hear from you. If so, please submit your resume and motivation letter.

title: Data Analyst
description: Do you want to be part of the grocery revolution? At Picnic you get the chance to join a young and forward-thinking startup culture, where everything you do matters. With a data-driven approach and an incredible service, Picnic strives to make grocery shopping simple, fun, and affordable for everyone. Known for our just-in-time supply-chain and a unique last-mile delivery strategy, we have become one of the fastest-growing companies of the Netherlands. Where you fit in Picnic is data-driven and complex – from pricing strategies, forecasting, warehouse automation, to the ever-expanding growth of our company, we are constantly faced with new challenges and opportunities…that's where you come in! We are on the hunt for graduates who are looking for their next full-time opportunity and can present their understanding of what drives consumer behavior and operational efficiency. As a Graduate Data Analyst, you'll glean actionable insights from large data sets - but your eyes won't be glued to data all day! You also offer entrepreneurial, realistic, and practical business opportunities. Have a forward-thinking idea? Tell your team, modify it, evaluate, experiment, and then make a real impact in our company! What challenges await you Drive implementation and improvement of projects from kick-off until the final whistle Design, implement and evaluate numerous experiments Optimize tools, systems and business processes for greater business impact Relentless focus on creating habit-forming product ideas. Who you are You combine first-class analytical skills with a creative and problem-solving mindset. You don't only see numbers in data sets, but you see opportunities. As an innovative thinker you constantly generate your own ideas. You're also ambitious – you come up with smart solutions, not easy ones. Superior presentation and communication skills allow you to convert complexity into digestible information for your team. You are confident and take ownership of your projects, but also collaborate with and motivate your colleagues! Requirements You have a Master's degree in Engineering, Econometrics, Mathematics, Physics or an equivalent quantitative study You have 0-3 years of internships or work experience in fast paced environments, start-up, scale up or business consulting You have excellent Excel and data analysis skills; Ideally knowledge of SQL, Tableau, and Python Your communication skills allow you to convert abstract plans into digestible information in English Picnic perks In our modern Amsterdam office, you will have the freedom to experiment and evolve your own projects as well as the chance to test them on real customers. You will be part of an international team of ground-breaking entrepreneurs, brilliant engineers, and data wizards that work with desire and dedication each day. We offer you training in both professional basics, such as 'presenting with confidence' and 'impactful feedback', and hard skill workshops, such as a SQL and Python training. We also offer Dutch language classes for our international colleagues. Are you looking for an experience abroad? We also offer you the opportunity to join our office in Düsseldorf. -Please submit your application in English-

title: Data Analyst
description: Are you looking for a role in Consulting that combines Data Analytics, a deep-dive into an area of expertise and international travel? Then a role as a Data Analyst might be just the one for you. Continue reading if you want to know more! Your Job As a Consulting Data Analyst in Accenture’s Amsterdam-based Cargo (travel) team, you will dive into the complex, dynamic and – most importantly – international world of Cargo transport. Our team’s unique approach combines strategic thinking with data-driven analytics and blends consulting professionals with seasoned Cargo experts. Team Accenture Cargo is a practice area within the Travel unit in Accenture Strategy & Consulting and a leading advisor to the global air freight and broader transportation industry. A dedicated Data Analytics and Business Intelligence team is responsible for providing leading industry databases and analytical tools to our clients, including comprehensive air and express cargo demand & supply databases, forecasts and optimization tools. Daily tasks You will be part of a team committed to expand our product portfolio and to further improve our already high level of data quality and customer service. You will closely cooperate with a Product Lead to facilitate the continued development of a specific product roadmap. You will be working with multiple and complex sources of information including immense databases. You will drive the adoption of new and exciting analytical techniques and explore applications to further develop our products and tools. Your day-to-day activities include conducting analysis, developing databases and analytical models, evaluating, and improving the methodology of our tools and products. As well as defining requirements for BI tools and liaising with clients on market trends and product usage. Our objective is to deliver exceptional customer service while constantly enhancing and innovating both existing and new products to continue our growth trajectory. You will assist top-tier clients (e.g. leading airlines and major airports) across the globe on a broad range of topics, including understanding market trends, defining a strategic direction, making network and fleet decisions or developing a sustainability roadmap. As a Data Analyst you will develop new and further refine established state-of-the art data products and analytical tools that help our clients in their commercial decision-making related to network, fleet, revenue management and procurement. You will be developing your technical, analytical and communication skill set as well as your understanding of global aviation and transportation. The learning curve will be exciting and will enable you to build a foundation of skills and experience which will prepare you for more senior roles. Who we are In today’s world, business leaders want to rapidly and confidently reinvent to increase resilience, mitigate risk, and grow with sustainable value. That’s where Accenture Strategy & Consulting comes in. We bring together strategic visionaries, industry experts, practitioners from across every enterprise function, business intelligence professionals, change specialists, data and AI authorities, and many other specialized skills to co-create each client’s unique path to reinvention. You will be a trusted partner to business leaders, working with a diverse team of experts to deliver successful tech-enabled transformation and new kinds of value for your clients. Join our global network of people using the latest assets, platforms and partnerships to help bring ideas to life. Strategy & Consulting is one of five services that make up one Accenture – the others are Operations, Technology, Song and Industry X. Here's what you'll need Master’s University degree with a strong academic record from a top tier institution in a quantitative field (e.g. Information Systems, Computer Sciences, Econometrics or other data related field) 2 – 3 years of relevant experience in Data Management or Data Analysis Proven proficiency in SQL and Database management Exceptional analytical, quantitative and conceptual skills Demonstrated ability to apply advanced analytical techniques and design analytical models Accurate, attention to detail oriented, and able to work in a structured and proactive way Willing to travel internationally What's in it for you Accenture is a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Our people are Change Makers, and to support them as an employer, we make five promises: Work with flexibility, in a culture based on trust Embrace a sustainable growth mindset Live a human-led culture of Inclusion & Diversity by caring deeply for all our people. Lead and transform our clients with technology Connect with our global network of 700.000 colleagues. These promises are reflected through our excellent employee benefits, including: Unlimited learning: access to thousands of free courses, classes and workshops. Flexible working hours (4x9) & work location. Paid transport (budget for electric bicycle or car, NS-Business card). Pension scheme, discount on Accenture shares, annual bonus, collective health insurance scheme. Social activities like Friday Drinks, sport events and parties What we believe Accenture is an equal opportunity employer. Our leaders are committed to building a better, stronger and more equitable company for future generations to create positive, long-lasting change. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Our position as partner to many of the world’s leading businesses, organizations and governments affords us both an extraordinary opportunity and a tremendous responsibility to make a difference. Sustainability is one of our greatest responsibilities, which we embed it into everything we do and for everyone we work with. Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all. Please let us know if you require reasonable accommodation to enable your participation in the recruitment process by emailing lisette.werkman@accenture.com. We will be happy to assist you.

title: Data Scientist
description: Brief info about Vinted Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with a growing member base of over 80 million registered members spanning 19 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life. Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year. The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Czech Republic, Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 1,800 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital. Information about the position You'll become part of the Trust domain, Safety track, with a mission to protect the Vinted community from harmful activities and content. The Safety track of the Trust domain is engaged in detecting, understanding, and stopping fraud and other malicious activities within the Vinted Marketplace. As a product team Decision Scientist, you will become part of a cross-functional team and drive quality of decisions by bringing actionable insights from data. Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA), we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways, and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department: Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines. Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision-making. Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms. In this position, you'll Be your team's primary point of contact to provide answers to data-related questions Ensure these questions are answered in optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad hoc deep-dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis) Collaborate with your team and stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions Analyse identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact (i.e. size opportunities) Own the key performance indicators for a team, including selection, tracking, forecasting, and proactively flagging issues Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker) Define the requirements for (A/B) testing and analyze the results of (A/B) tests Help to create a backlog with prioritised hypotheses and analyses About you Strong proven experience in Data Analytics (typically 4+ years of working experience or similar activities resulting in a similar level of proficiency) A good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences Strong analytical, strategic, and business skills A degree in statistics, physics, econometrics, economics, business or a similar field Statistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis) Knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.) Proficient in SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.) Advantage: experience with Machine Learning techniques (especially NLP) Advantage: experience working in the Trust & Safety or Fraud-related area Work perks The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme 25 working days of holiday Newest MacBook models Free access to an office gym Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture Private health insurance On-site canteen serving delicious homemade food at discount prices Frequent team-building events A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation A dog-friendly office Working at Vinted Individual Learning Budget Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You'll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role. Hybrid Work We've adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in office are recommended but not enforced. It's up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you'll spend working together in person. Equal Opportunity The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic. The salary range for this position is € 56,400 - € 79,925 gross per year.

title: Data Analyst
description: Grasp the opportunity As a Data Analyst (Power BI) at Northpool, you will be working together with different departments -in particular IT and Finance-, to use as much data as possible and making analyses, (financial) reports and presentations related to the performance of the various departments. With these reports, our goal is to provide insight into the costs and performance of our trading desks to make recommendations about business decisions and -goals. Your goal? To translate the business needs and results into user-friendly reports. There is no need to reinvent the wheel: the BI environment is there and the departments themselves provide input about what information they want to get from the trading databases. It is important that you know how to work with Power BI and that you have basic knowledge of finance; you must be able to communicate well with both IT as well as the business and you need to interpret the data and reports properly. It is not necessary to be fully aware of the world of Energy Trading, but you must be able to understand the background of the formation of the prices. We will help you gain the knowledge you need. During your work at Northpool you will: Be responsible for the reporting environment; Prepare overall monthly reports and analysis on business results; Give the individual departments insight into their results; Provide the Finance department with the mandatory monthly, quarterly and annual reports; Report errors/ inaccuracies; Convert the raw data (like the trade database) into clear reports, including using Power BI Maintain existing dashboards, but also expanding reports and analyzes in the long run; Your challenge is to give each department insight into how they are performing and to show where there is room for improvement, by giving them user-friendly and clear reports. We ask: Demonstrable experience with developing reports (Power BI) and a strong foundation in SQL Master’s degree in a data- or finance-related study (f.e. Economics, Mathematics, Finance, Business Administration, Information Systems) Strong data analytics skills Knowledge of the basics of accounting and finance A self-motivated individual who will take ownership of their work Someone who is eager to learn and not afraid to ask questions Good social and communication skills 2 years of work experience Good knowledge of Excel Attention to detail and commitment to accuracy Ability to communicate fluently in English We like: Interest in trading and energy markets. Willingness to learn and continuously develop yourself A problem-solving attitude Experience with financial markets, especially energy markets We offer: Appropriate training will be provided Continuous learning and development opportunities Competitive compensation package Annual performance-based bonus A non-hierarchical workplace Young and highly motivated teammates Ownership in your work A fun workplace, where no two days are ever the same Plenty of social events! Location: for this vacancy we need you to live in The Netherlands. Also, the application procedure will take place at our office in Leiden. Acquisition based on this vacancy is not appreciated.

title: Data Analist
description: CEVA Logistics biedt wereldwijde supply chain oplossingen om mensen, producten en leveranciers over de hele wereld met elkaar te verbinden. Aanwezig in 170 landen en met meer dan 110.000 werknemers verspreid over 1.300 vestigingen, zijn we goed op weg om onze visie te verwezenlijken: een wereldwijde top 5 3PL zijn. Wij geloven dat onze medewerkers de sleutel zijn tot ons succes. We stellen ons diverse, wereldwijde team in staat om samen met onze klanten waarde te creëren door middel van onze oplossingen in contract logistics en air, ocean, ground, en finished vehicle transport. Daarom biedt CEVA Logistics een dynamische en uitzonderlijke werkomgeving die persoonlijke groei, innovatie en voortdurende verbetering stimuleert. DARE TO GROW! Kom werken bij CEVA Logistics, en je maakt deel uit van een team dat creativiteit waardeert, moed en ondernemerschap aanmoedigt, en toegewijd is aan excellentie in alles wat we doen. Sluit je aan bij onze missie om de toekomst van de wereldwijde logistiek vorm te geven terwijl we een wereldleider in de logistieke sector worden. Wij blijven in hoog tempo groeien. Durf jij met ons mee te groeien? JOUW ROL Het team van Data & Analytics blijft groeien binnen CEVA Logistics in Tilburg. Jij hebt de kans om samen met het team impact te maken bij onze klant de Bijenkorf. Data speelt een belangrijke rol in de huidige strategie. We verleggen de focus steeds meer op voorspellen in plaats van verklaren, zo creëren we nieuwe inzichten. Als Data Analyst ben je constant op zoek naar oplossingen en verbeteringen voor onze processen. Jouw oplossingen toets je vervolgens om tot de gewenste inzichten en principes te komen. Jouw werk begint meestal met een vraag om informatie vanuit onze klant, een directe collega, MT-lid of is al beschreven door onze Business Analyst. Deze vragen kunnen heel divers zijn, zoals vragen over verwerkte aantallen, productiviteit per lijn, trendanalyses en het optimale formaat van verpakkingsmiddelen. Belangrijk is dat je hierbij de 'vraag achter de vraag' naar boven weet te halen in een persoonlijk gesprek met de verschillende stakeholders. De benodigde data kan reeds beschikbaar zijn binnen onze BI-datasources. Zo niet, dan ga je op zoek naar de juiste data in één van de (WMS-)databases en schrijf je hier een passend SQL-script voor. Soms moet de data gevalideerd worden om te kijken of het overeenkomt met de werkelijkheid. Hierin schakel je met de juiste stakeholders. Je durft van de huidige paden af te wijken om tot de beste oplossing te komen. Je hebt de vrijheid om de rol op jouw eigen manier in te vullen door jouw eerder opgedane werkervaring en de technieken die jij graag gebruikt. Jij voelt goed aan wanneer er een beroep wordt gedaan op enerzijds jouw analytische vermogen en anderzijds de communicatieve vaardigheden. Het is belangrijk dat je affiniteit hebt met logistiek, Ecommerce, Data en IT. Elke dag ben je met jouw directe collega’s bezig om alle processen in kaart te brengen en om aandachtspunten kenbaar te maken. Buiten de dagelijkse bezigheden zul je bijdragen in projecten met een directe impact op de business. Binnen het team maken wij gebruik van een hybride werkomgeving en kun je jouw uren flexibel over de werkdag inplannen. Buiten het kantoor in Tilburg heb je ook de mogelijkheid om vanuit huis te werken. Op dit moment bestaat het team uit 2 directe collega’s, die ook intensief samenwerken met andere afdelingen binnen de organisatie. WAT GA JE DOEN? Je beoordeelt de ontwikkeling van de huidige werkprocessen door middel van jouw gemaakte (trend)analyses; Indien nodig schoon je de data op of normaliseer je data. Soms kan dit wat puzzelen zijn, uiteraard helpen jouw collega’s jou graag; Het bijdragen aan het verbeteren van onze processen; De benodigde rapporten publiceer je op de Tableau-server, rekening houdend met de eindgebruiker; Ophalen van de juiste data bij de verschillende interne en externe stakeholders; Je zorgt voor Visualisatie in Tableau, of maakt een mock-up zodat je collega dit kan verzorgen, afhankelijk van je interesses; Tot slot zorg je dat het eindproduct wordt overgedragen aan de gebruiker en ben je er zeker van dat de data juist geïnterpreteerd wordt; Je brengt adviezen uit aan stakeholders doormiddel van gemaakte analyses en domeinkennis. WAAR ZIJN WE NAAR OP ZOEK? Een afgeronde WO- of hbo opleiding; Minimaal 2 jaar ervaring in een vergelijkbare rol; Ruime ervaring met SQL of PostgreSQL, Tableau ervaring is een pre; Kennis van Datamodellen en Databases. Predictive moddeling of optimalisatie is een pré Uitstekende kennis van de Engelse taal in woord en geschrift; Kennis van statistiek; WAT BIEDEN WE JOU? We bieden je een uitdagende en afwisselende baan binnen een succesvolle multinational met tal van (doorgroei)mogelijkheden. Laat zien wat je in huis hebt en de kansen vliegen je om de oren. Je krijgt veel verantwoordelijkheid en volop ruimte voor eigen initiatief met de kans om een belangrijke bijdrage te leveren aan onze verdere groei en ambities. Daarnaast bieden we: Prima primaire en secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden; Een jaarcontract met daarna uitzicht op een vast contract; 25 vakantiedagen en vier extra dagen als je niet verzuimt; Een voordelige pensioenregeling en op verschillende verzekeringen. JOUW TOEKOMST Bij CEVA eCommerce Logistics zijn onze mensen de hartslag van de organisatie, onze kracht. Binnen onze internationale organisatie werken wij voor onze favoriete merken als bol.com, Zalando en de Bijenkorf. Wij innoveren continu en geven jou de ruimte om alles uit jezelf te halen. Samen groeien we! Wij bieden een werkomgeving om integer te werken en vertrouwen erop dat jij vindingrijk bent, werkt met een ondernemersgeest en pioniert met creatieve ideeën. Samenwerken en respect voor elkaar zijn belangrijk in onze organisatie, een goede sfeer is hierbij het uitgangspunt. Word onderdeel van The Heartbeat Of Logistic Services. Daag jezelf uit en bepaal jouw toekomst bij CEVA eCommerce Logistics! SOLLICITEER DIRECT! Ben je enthousiast geworden over de functie Data Analyst? Solliciteer dan via de ‘Solliciteer’ button. Toch nog vragen? Stel ze gerust! Neem contact op met Ruud Roelen, Corporate Recruiter, via 06-21280770. Een VOG aanvraag en persoonlijkheidsvragenlijst maken deel uit van het sollicitatieproces. Werving en selectiebureau’s; wij zoeken onze mensen graag zelf. Mochten we jullie hulp nodig hebben dan weten we jullie te vinden. Binnen CEVA waarderen en stimuleren we professionele en persoonlijke groei. Middels ons aanbod van verschillende ontwikkelmogelijkheden, zorgen we samen dat jij succesvol kunt zijn! Deze rol is de eerste stap naar een breed carrièrepad binnen bij CEVA. De mogelijkheden om je eigen pad te bewandelen zijn eindeloos. We verwelkomen je graag bij CEVA voor een uitdagende carrière. DARE TO GROW!

title: Data Analyst
description: Working as a Data Analyst As our Data Analyst, you are responsible for preparing and providing actionable management information to all OCD NL stakeholders and to provide accurate, complete and an up-to-date status regarding the planning and utilization of our resources. As our Data Analyst, you must support the OCD management team to execute our business strategy, by providing them with business information and insights needed. You advice stakeholders on possibilities with data analysis and are able to build and maintain Power BI and other management dashboards and reports. You understand our existing IT systems and resources that carry various sorts of data and are able to validate and use these data to provide information and advice. Key Responsibilities You and your team ensure that the MD, the department heads and the different teams have access to the accurate and complete management information needed for their roles. You also provide with new and surprising insights leveraging data analysis capabilities. You maintain our Power BI environment, including all dashboards and reports for OCD NL. You work together with our Global business intelligence teams, Global IT teams, the Global Business Analyst and bring best practices to the Dutch organization. You keep up to date with the latest developments, best practices and certification requirements on business intelligence. You understand the interests and responsibilities of various stakeholders and proactively bring new ideas, advice and insights to them. What we expect of you You have at least a university or HBO degree. You have at least 3 years of experience in the field of Data Analytics. You are an ambitious person with an innovative mindset. You have strong Power BI skills. You are able to translate business needs & requirements into KPI’s, graphs and other management dashboards. You are fluent in Dutch and English. You have an entrepreneurial spirit. You are a team builder and have a strong drive to grow our business. You do not a have a 9 to 5 mentality and take pride in coaching and growing your teams. What you can expect from us Be taken care of - We offer you an attractive Salary & Bonus, 28 vacation days plus two business closing days; in addition, you have the option to purchase additional vacation days. a quality pension, company smartphone & laptop, group insurances plans, and a travel allowance. So, you do not have to worry about a thing! Never stop learning - We want to be the best in what we do and therefore we provide training, certifications and learning opportunities for every employee so you continuously enrich your skills. Transparency - Communication is key! So, we organize company and team meetings on a regular base, so everyone is informed properly. Do what you love - Enjoy flexibility with 2 days a week working from home and 3 days a week working with your team in our state of the art, brand new offices with parking, a variety of events, sport at work and lots of activities. We spend more time at work then we do at home, that is why it is important that everyone feels at home. And we make sure you do! Snack to your heart's desire - At Orange Cyberdefense we keep it healthy. So, you can enjoy an assortment of fresh fruit and healthy snacks. For those with an occasionally sugar dip, there are sweet snacks available. Reputable brand - You will join an internationally, growing company with over 25 years’ experience in the industry. This makes us experts in what we do. We have an international presence and yet local teams to assist our customers. The good life ... An assessment and screening are part of our process. Are you interested? Then jump in! Orange Cyberdefense are equal opportunities employer, welcoming applications from all people, regardless of their race, sex, disability, age, religion, or sexual orientation.

title: Data Analyst
description: Job Description: What is “VIE”? The VIE is an international program for young professionals between the age of 18 and 28 who are European Union nationals who can work in another country rather than their Hometown. So, the candidate cannot come from the country hosting the mission . Where is the VIE Position In our Hong KongSE offices. What is the Position? You will be Sustainability and Data Analyst with the partner program team and the offer data team; along with teams managing ecommerce relationships with distributors (Analytics team, offer data experts, creatives, operations). You will lead the environmental data projects and proposed "Sustainability Chapter" in the offer data team of Factory C, and data analysis of offer experience to improve customer experience and content conversion. Which missions will you lead? Accelerate the implementation of environmental data on our E1, E2, E3 platforms. Track and monitor performance of this data with ambition to increase conversion rate and show growth in Green Premium product selections. Partner with distributors to shape the overall sustainability priorities within our BoPP programs and influence distributors in their own sustainability journeys towards empowering the sustainable customer. Qualifications: What are the qualifications we are looking for? Education: Master’s in business or in Engineering Professional English spoken & written Excel Work experience: 1-2 years’ experience in sustainability and data analysis (internship or apprenticeship) Skills: Autonomous Organized Analytic mind Quick learner Let us learn about you! Apply today. About Our Company: Why us? Schneider Electric is leading the digital transformation of energy management and automation. Our technologies enable the world to use energy in a safe, efficient and sustainable manner. We strive to promote a global economy that is both ecologically viable and highly productive. €25.7bn global revenue 137 000+ employees in 100+ countries 45% of revenue from IoT 5% of revenue devoted for R&D You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled It is the policy of Schneider Electric to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities in the areas of recruiting, hiring, training, transferring, and promoting all qualified individuals regardless of race, religion, color, gender, disability, national origin, ancestry, age, military status, sexual orientation, marital status, or any other legally protected characteristic or conduct. Concerning agencies: Schneider Electric does not accept unsolicited resumes and will not be responsible for fees related to such.

title: Data Analyst
description: As a Web Data Analyst you are responsible for analyzing our website’s overall performance. By closely monitoring our KPIs, and working together with our digital development-, commercial-, SEA- and SEO teams, you will strive every day to improve the quantity and quality of our traffic and conversion rate, while decreasing our bounce and exit rates. You will work with a team of analysts on digital forecasting, querying, automation, dashboarding and reporting. You have a crucial role in making the different teams work aligned and synchronized. Does this sound interesting? Then we might be looking for you to join our team! Tasks And Activities Tracking and forecasting of wide variety of KPIs (special focus on traffic and conversion rate); Digital forecasting and automation of data flows; In charge of automating reports through the use and creation of dashboards; Weekly and monthly reporting of performance; data visualization and data storytelling; Build action plans based on analysis, assess other teams on implementation. Track performance once implementation is done; Providing input to management about the online performance; Supporting the online growth by providing new insights and actively sharing these with internal and external stakeholders; Be part of the AB testing process, providing valuable insights and hypothesis to test but specially defining the correct metrics and analyzing test results; Your Profile Ideally 3-5 years of working experience as a web data analyst (experience with CRO considered a big plus); HBO/WO Degree in the field of Economics, Business Administration, Statistics, Mathematics or equivalent; Experience with SQL is a must (BigQuery is a plus); Knowledge of Google Analytics including custom reporting, complex segmentation, marketing tools connections and their use; Knowledge of dashboarding (PowerBI, Looker Studio, Tableau, etc); Knowledge of Google Tag Manager; Knowledge of Python is a plus; Customer focus and data driven; Pro activeness, ownership, willingness to learn; Stakeholder management and strong communication skills; Prioritization and time management skills; Critical thinker and problem-solving skills; Flexible, ability to adapt and work autonomously; Our Offer A - without exaggerating - fantastic workplace on the 40th floor in 'De Rotterdam' with a view of the Erasmus Bridge; Good working conditions and development and opportunities for growth; Renumerations will be based on experience, skills and competences; Freedom and responsibility to shape your own role and to bring ideas to fruition in an environment where anything is possible; The opportunity to achieve the best results as a team, simply because you are a winner; In addition to a great place to work, we also offer 30 holidays, an attractive employee discount, group health insurance, company fitness and discounts on various insurance products; At MediaMarkt we simply have guts. We are entrepreneurs within a company, giving you the chance to develop yourself quickly and in a variety of ways; This is Us We are the market leader in consumer electronics in the Netherlands. As a team we work together to remain the omnichannel player with 49 branches and an online shop. How do we do that? By putting our customers first. Always. By offering the best customer experience both online and offline. We build a party for and with our customers. We believe that anything is possible if you take action yourself. Working at MediaMarkt means: having fun and wanting to win!

title: Business Analyst
description: What to Expect The Tesla Charging network, the world’s fastest electric vehicle charging network which includes over 80,000 Superchargers and Wall Connectors worldwide, is a critical enabler to Tesla’s mission to accelerate the world’s transition to sustainable energy. Our EMEA network, an integral part of our global offering, operates +10,000 Superchargers serving both Tesla and non-Tesla customers in 35 countries. The Staff Analyst will play a critical role in shaping EMEA business strategy across new business initiatives, pricing and network planning, with the ultimate goal of providing best-in-class customer experience and strong financial performance. The Staff Analyst role will have significant executive exposure: this person should be comfortable with and skilled in performing complex analyses, devising concrete plans from ambiguity, and managing stakeholders across multiple cultures and time zones. What You’ll Do Use strong business intuition to independently identify growth opportunities Manage stakeholders based locally in EMEA and global HQ team based in Palo Alto Present to executives on a regular basis Develop sophisticated business strategy proposals What You’ll Bring 3-7 years of experience in consulting, finance, energy, high-growth technology companies or other relevant industries Proven track record of delivering high-quality business strategy proposals Advanced data analytics and modelling skills using Excel; experience with SQL and/or Python preferred Rigorous, detail-oriented, critical thinker that is able to work independently and in a team

title: Data Analyst
description: Your Impact You bridge the gap between business, information and technology as a one of Ordina’s Data Analysts. Like a true subject matter expert, you hold discussions with stakeholders such as administrators, users and architects. You identify their needs and translate them into information solutions. You also draw up validated requirements and specifications with the right quality and depth and prioritize these with the business. You’re the point of contact for the organization and for the scrum teams when it comes to content. And you’re able to clearly convey what needs to be realized like no other. Where you're going to get started We create sustainable value for our clients through data within our Data area. We help companies stay agile while in transition by making data and technology part of both daily operations and strategic decision-making. We use data to help our clients stay ahead of change. Our ambition is to help organizations excel with data. The area consists of five practices: Data Governance and Data Management, Data Visualization, Data Science and AI, Data Engineering and Data Migrations, and Spatial Intelligence. Each with a distinct focus on content and the right solution. Over 170 professionals work in a content practice that is a logical fit for them. We believe in the power of multidisciplinary teams. Your expertise, personal ambitions and customer requirements are the basis for the composition of our High Performance Teams. You’ll become an indispensable link in a team of professionals so together you can all bring out the best in each other. Everyone contributes from their own expertise and technology so we all keep learning from each other and no one is ever alone. This is you You have a passion for your work and a focus on customer satisfaction and quality. Guts, proactive communication skills and a strong analytical approach are essential for your role as a Data Analyst. Required Expertise: Bachelor’s or master’s degree Two years’ experience in data analysis and data design Affinity with data, data structures and data mapping Knowledge and experience with data modeling and relational algebra Accurate and precise work ethic Analytical thinking skills, strong communication skills and a practical attitude Experience with SQL is a definite advantage Command of the Dutch language Benefits Part of our Data community with passionate and experienced peers; focus on working with one of our High Performance Teams (HPT) at renowned clients; you work in a high-tech environment with a focus on knowledge and innovation, an open no-nonsense corporate culture with room for own initiative; working with less travel time; remote & flexible; an environment where entrepreneurship and own initiative are encouraged; a culture where collegiality, knowledge sharing and collaboration are key; a pension plan, to which you are not required to contribute; 20 statutory days off and 7 additional days off via flex benefits; adapt your terms of employment to your personal wishes with flex benefits choice between a company car or a mobility scheme; Everyone is welcome to apply. Because we believe in the power of diversity and value inclusion. After all, the best ideas and smartest solutions arise in diverse teams. That is exactly why we pay so much attention to the composition of our high performance teams. So that you feel at home and can get the best out of yourself.

title: Business Analyst
description: Let’s talk talent You have talent. Ready to make impact. We know. We also know that making impact starts with that first contact between likeminded people who have the same drive to shape their future. We see you, with your skills, personality and dreams. Now let’s take it to even greater heights by means of one of our talent programs for master’s and PhD graduates. We are Mploy Associates, a talent focused consultancy firm ready to make not only our clients’ teams successful but also you. Your talent, our focus. More specifically? We are a consultancy firm specialized in the areas of data, finance, and analytics and work on a variety of projects like investment analyses, data engineering, quant modelling and much more. Our clients are banks, insurance companies, asset managers and we are still expanding. We help our clients build successful teams by providing the right skills, talents and know-how at the right place and time and develop ourselves continuously to stay successful. We believe that investing in talent through proven methods always pays out. Today we are proud to say that we are an international driven company with more than 100 people and many top-tier clients who share the same vision. How do you fit into this vision? You will work as a Business Analyst for one of our clients with a special focus on your own development through one of our Talent Programs. Our Talent Programs are designed to accelerate your career from entry level to medior+ level within 24 months. By means of certified training courses, coaching and intervision sessions our employees follow an above average steep career curve. Successful graduation in our Talent Programs usually results in a permanent medior+ or senior position at one of our clients or where it becomes your responsibility to keep the team successful. Your activities as a Business Analyst Your responsibilities might range from organizing, storing and analyzing dataflows to translating business requirements into IT solutions. Therefore, stakeholder management and meeting deadlines is written in your DNA. This includes organising stakeholder meetings to discuss and present project results and follow-up actions. As well as preparing management reports and presentations to senior management on progress and issue remediations. Your day-to-day responsibilities include: Explaining the business needs to IT engineers to ensure a correct implementation; Conduct trend analyzes in financial data to ensure the completeness and accuracy of the data; Investigating and documenting dataflows and associated data lineage; Investigating current IT implementations and developing roadmaps for future improvements; Validating implemented solutions before they are released to end-users; Understanding business processes in detail to develop innovative solutions for further improvements. On average you work 36 hours a week on a client project and you spend 4 hours a week on your own personal, professional and technical development in one of our Talent Programs. What are we looking for? We are looking for graduates with different business and IT-related backgrounds, experiences, and passions. It speaks for itself that you are ambitious, self-reflective and dare to be confident in an authentic way. Furthermore, you are energized by stakeholder management and are well adept at gathering reliable information. You use this in combination with a consultive mindset to make our clients more successful. Last but not least, you are eager to develop yourself on personal, professional and technical level with our personalized in-house Talent Programs. To make it more specific: You have 0-3 years of work experience and want to learn everything about business analysis, data and IT implementations; You want to put into practice your skills that you have acquired during your master’s or PhD in Information Sciences, Business Administration, Economics or another related study; You do not hesitate to use your analytical skills to solve complex problems creatively and logically. You enjoy working in changing environments and like to be involved in multiple projects at the same time. What do we offer? We offer the opportunity to become an expert in business analysis in an environment where we train you to excel as a high-end professional. In addition, good working conditions are equally as important to us. By offering free lunch at the office and regular fun team activities like escape rooms and fun dinners, we ensure a connected and social workplace. Also important; we will provide you with a public transport card and/or (electric) bike. All on us of course. Furthermore: A salary of €3,616 for master's graduates and €4,083 for PhD graduates, including holiday allowance and 13th month salary; Challenging work and projects for one of our top 200 clients; 25 days of paid annual leave; Half-day a week in-house professional and technical training combined with personal coaching; Besides in-house training opportunities, an external development budget of €2,000 per year to obtain relevant certifications as FRM or CFA; An international working environment with driven and ambitious colleagues from all over the world; The opportunity to take your next career move as a medior at the client or Mploy Associates after successfully completing your development program; Pro bono technical projects at socially relevant NGOs. Interested? For more information about our different positions and Talent Programs you can visit our website www.mployassociates.com. Want to know more about the vacancy? Use the apply button above or send us an email from the moment you start your master’s so we can help you prepare for your dream career. We will be in touch. Please note that unfortunately there is no point in applying when you do not live in the Netherlands or if you have more than 3 years of work experience. These applications will not be processed. Are you interested in multiple positions at Mploy Associates? Apply for one position and mention the other position(s) in your motivation message. Together we will find the best match for you. Job Type: Full-time Salary: From €3,600.00 per month Application Question(s): Are you willing to undergo a background check, in accordance with local law/regulations? Are you living in the Netherlands? Are you fulltime available? Do you have less than three years of relevant work experience? Education: Master's (Required) Language: English (Required) Work authorization: Netherlands (Required) Work Location: Hybrid remote in 3512 LP Utrecht

title: Data Analyst
description: At Woolsocks we're looking for a Data Analyst to join our team from abroad. Full-time · Remote About us We are a new Fintech Startup created by 2 founders of DEGIRO. Our mission is creating a whole revolution in the world of personal finance management (PFM) through a free Super App ecosystem that enables our members to reach their financial happiness. It aims for rapid growth by acquiring a high volume of members (B2C). Scaling operations across Europe with special focus on Retail and e-commerce Industries (B2B). In addition, Woolsocks builds its own revolutionary omnichannel cashback model through a single gateway (SaaS) platform. What you will accomplish You will be playing a key role in the growth of our app Woolsocks.
