De organisatie Belastingdienst Bij de Belastingdienst werken ongeveer 25.000 mensen verspreid over het hele land aan een financieel gezond Nederland. Dit doen we door eerlijk en zorgvuldig belastingen en premies volksverzekeringen te heffen, te innen en te controleren en fraude op te sporen. De Belastingdienst maakt het burgers en bedrijven zo gemakkelijk mogelijk om verplichtingen na te kunnen komen en gebruik te kunnen maken van rechten. Dat gebeurt met passende dienstverlening, door massale processen juist en tijdig uit te voeren én door adequaat toezicht uit te oefenen. De Belastingdienst is sterk in ontwikkeling en heeft de ambitie om de beste Belastingdienst voor Nederland te zijn met focus op fiscale taken en vakmanschap. Lees meer over de Belastingdienst op: https://over-ons.belastingdienst.nl De afdeling - Corporate Dienst Datafundamenten en Analytics De Corporate Dienst Datafundamenten en Analytics (DF&A) werkt voor directies van de Belastingdienst die belast zijn met de fiscale behandeling van burgers en bedrijven én voor bedrijfsvoering. DF&A levert signaalmodellen en informatiedashboards die zijn gebaseerd op de analyse van ‘big data’ en die de organisatie inzicht geven in de mogelijkheden om werkzaamheden slimmer en beter uit te voeren. Zo kunnen op informatie-gestuurde wijze keuzes worden gemaakt in bijvoorbeeld handhavingsstrategieën, behandeladviezen en procesinrichtingen. De signaalmodellen en dashboards worden gebouwd door gebruik te maken van innovatieve IT-ontwikkelingen en het koppelen van zeer divers aangeleverde data. DF&A maakt hiervoor gebruik van een zelfontwikkelde methodiek om data op te bouwen tot datafundamenten, die de basis zijn voor de producten.

title: Data Scientist
description: Over de functie OLVG heeft in zijn strategische ambities data science opgenomen omdat wij geloven dat met behulp van data zorg kan veranderen, verbeteren of voorkomen kan worden. De afgelopen periode zijn er daarom verschillende initiatieven in OLVG gestart om bijvoorbeeld met behulp van Artificial Intelligence (AI) het aantal heropnames te verlagen en ontstekingen te voorkomen. Als data scientist in OLVG zijn jouw werkzaamheden: waarde toevoegende AI-toepassingen ontwikkelen en implementeren in ons Elektronisch Patiënten Dossier (Epic) samen met onze zorgprofessionals op proactieve wijze kansen signaleren waar AI-toepassingen de zorg kunnen verbeteren de klinische problemen zowel kwalitatief als kwantitatief te doorgronden Werkomgeving Je komt te werken in hét stadsziekenhuis van Amsterdam binnen een team van ambitieuze collega’s. Je werkt vanuit de net opgerichte data & analytics afdeling, een jonge, dynamische afdeling van hoogopgeleide specialisten. Binnen deze afdeling ontsluiten we data en creëren we informatieproducten die gebruikt kunnen worden door zorgverleners en binnen ondersteunende afdeling. Denk hierbij aan (management)informatie in dashboards en rapportages of algoritmes om onze zorg kwalitatief beter en efficiënter te maken. OLVG heeft twee hoofdlocaties, aan het Oosterpark (Oost) en aan de Jan Tooropstraat (West). Je standplaats is locatie West en je werkt voor beide locaties. Thuiswerken is mogelijk en gemiddeld werken we 2 dagen per week op locatie. Functie-eisen We verleggen de bekende weg als het bijdraagt aan het resultaat. En bedenken het liefst hoe het nóg beter kan. Op eigen wijze en met elkaar. Daarom rekenen we op jouw analytisch vermogen en resultaatgerichtheid. Dit neem je ook mee: een afgeronde MSc opleiding op het gebied zorg en/of Data Science, bijvoorbeeld Health Policy & Management, Healthcare Information Management, econometrie of wiskunde je hebt relevante werkervaring met machine learning, waarbij ervaring in de zorg een pré is je hebt aantoonbare kennis van SQL, R en/of Python en Microsoft Azure. Epic reporting certificering is een pré je bent bereid om agile te werken in teamverband het beheersen van de Nederlandse taal in woord en geschrift is een vereiste voor deze functie Wij bieden Werken bij OLVG betekent werken in hét stadsziekenhuis van Amsterdam. Een werkomgeving waar jij je optimaal kunt ontwikkelen. Want jouw wensen en ideeën doen ertoe. Zo doen we dat bij OLVG. Daarom bieden we jou: minimaal €3.736,- en maximaal €5.473,- bruto per maand (fulltime) in FWG-schaal 60 cao ziekenhuizen. Dit salaris wordt in juni 2024 met 5 % verhoogd. dienstverband voor de periode van één jaar voor 36 uur (waarbij 4 x 9 uur werken tot de mogelijkheid behoort), met zicht op verlenging voor onbepaalde tijd bij gebleken geschiktheid en vacatureruimte thuiswerken behoort tot de mogelijkheden kostendekkende OV-reiskostenvergoeding flexibele reiskostenregeling, waarbij jij iedere dag kunt kiezen welk vervoer jou het beste uitkomt eindejaarsuitkering van ruim 8% vakantiegeld van ruim 8% 144 uur vakantieverlof persoonlijk levensfasebudget van 57 uur extra verlof en de ruimte om te werken aan jouw eigen ontwikkelingswensen sterk in je werk programma: met vitaliteitscoaching, gezonde nachtmaaltijden, ontspanningsruimten en meer pensioenregeling bij PFZW voordeel op jouw ziektekostenpremie met onze collectieve ziektekostenverzekering. Kies uit IZZ, Zilveren Kruis Achmea of Zorg en Zekerheid kortingen op verzekeringen en financiële diensten van Centraal Beheer Achmea korting bij diverse lokale ondernemers, zoals eettentjes, cafés en sportcentra onbeperkt toegang tot e-learnings en ons vitaliteitsprogramma de keuze in arbeidsvoorwaarden die bij jou passen. Zoals de mogelijkheid om een nieuwe telefoon, fiets of laptop met belastingvoordeel aan te schaffen Deze arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn op basis van een fulltime dienstverband (36 uur per week).

title: Data Scientist
description: 32 - 40 uur · Zeist Zorg jij voor dataplatforms waarmee verzekeraars de toekomst beter kunnen voorspellen? Ons team groeit. Voor ons hoofdkantoor in Zeist zoeken wij een Data Scientist. Als onze Data Scientist kom je terecht in een compact team met data analisten, engineers en wetenschappers. Samen maken jullie ons platform dé plek waar iedere verzekeraar naar toe gaat om inzicht te krijgen in data en informatieproducten. Als Data Scientist houd je de bestaande modellen kwalitatief op orde en werk je voortdurend aan het verder uitbreiden van het dataplatform. Je bent in staat snel nieuwe kennis op te doen zodat je zelf met nieuwe ideeën en technieken komt en je neemt het team daar graag in mee. Daarnaast ga je aan de slag met: Het ontwerpen en bouwen van machine learning-modellen om op de informatiebehoefte van onze klanten in te spelen. Het zorgdragen dat de in productie genomen modellen voldoen aan het compliance raamwerk Het adviseren van het Data Science-team over eventuele verbeteringen. Jouw specs Je hebt een relevante wo-opleiding in de richting Data Science, Informatica, Wiskunde, Kunstmatige Intelligentie, Econometrie. Minimaal 3+ jaar ervaring als Data Scientist. Ervaring met Python en source control (Git). Ervaring met (My)SQL en/of ruimtelijke data is een pré. Je bent proactief, analytisch, samenwerkingsgericht en communicatief sterk. Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal. Onze specs Wij bieden je een werkomgeving waarin alles goed geregeld is: Goed salaris vanaf €3500 - €4000 per maand. Flexibiliteit, 32-40 uur op kantoor of thuis. 27 betaalde vakantiedagen. Reis- & thuiswerkvergoeding. Ruime kans voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling en doorgroeimogelijkheden. Nog vragen? Marin op 06 - 28 55 62 65 voor meer info.

title: Bioinformatician Pharmacology and Toxicology
description: 18-24 months Many drugs in women and pregnant women are prescribed off-label. Their efficacy and safety have not been adequately studied in these populations. Hence, children and pregnant women, and their fetuses, are at an increased risk of therapy failure or toxicity. Ultimately, we aim to generate dosing guidelines for children and pregnant women. Towards this goal, we aim to use published and real-world data combined with pharmacokinetic modeling and simulation. Are you our new colleague? In this project, funded by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, we aim to explore the combined use of physiology-based pharmacokinetic modeling with real world data from large (existing) electronic health record databases to establish best-evidence doses for children and pregnant women. You are expected to work with our clinical scientists, PK modelers and pharmacists to answer questions related to efficacy and safety of selected drugs, for which personalized dosing are highly needed. Your goal is to extract and analyze real-world-data to support dosing regimens in children and pregnant women. As well as collaborate with our Radboudumc group, the Dutch Pediatric Formulary as well as with scientific teams from the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation and groups in the Netherlands, UK and USA. Tasks and responsibilities Work with large datasets, so you are not afraid of large unstructured datasets. Work with Radboud PBPK scientists, pharmacists and clinicians to define critical questions that can be addressed or informed with real-world data. Work closely with Knowledge Integration team at the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation to design and execute real-world-data analyses. Supervise bachelor, master and advise PhD students (minor task). Work according to FAIR principles. Working at Radboud university medical center means that you are ahead of the curve and working together on the healthcare of the future. And there is more. Our secondary terms of employment are impressive. These are fully tailored to you thanks to our Employment Conditions Selection Model. At Radboud university medical center, you will be given trust, and you will take the responsibility to handle everything together. A gross monthly salary between € 3.359 and € 5.292 (scale 10) based on full-time employment. An annual vacation allowance of 8% and an end-of-year bonus of 8.3%. If you work irregular hours, you will receive an allowance. As a full-time employee (36 hours per week), you are entitled to approximately 168 vacation hours (over 23 days) per year. Radboud university medical center pays 70% of the pension premium. You pay the rest of the premium with your gross salary. Discount on your supplementary health insurance. You can make use of two collective health insurance policies: UMC Health Insurance and CZ Collective. They offer many extras to stay vital and healthy, such as a prevention budget, workshops, and apps. We provide annual courses, both professional and personal. In addition to our terms of employment, we also offer employees various other attractive facilities, such as childcare and sports facilities. Want to learn more? Take a look at the CAO UMC. You will be appointed at the Department of Pharmacy, the Division of Pharmacology and Toxicology. The Department of Pharmacy's research activities focus on the following research areas: special populations: Pediatrics and Obstetrics, pharmacology of antimicrobial agents (antiretrovirals, antifungals, antibiotics, and tuberculosis drugs) and oncology drugs. Furthermore, the department houses a state-of-the-art bioanalytical laboratory, a preclinical laboratory focused on drug transport and toxicity and an excellent pharmacometrics (PBPK and popPK) group. We have strong national and international collaborations to unravel translational pharmacological research questions. You will be working with our Radboudumc group, the Dutch Pediatric Formulary as well as with scientific teams from the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation and groups in the Netherlands, UK and USA . Radboudumc Radboud university medical center is a university medical center for patient care, scientific research, and education in Nijmegen. Radboud university medical center strives to be at the forefront of shaping the healthcare of the future. We do this in a person-centered and innovative way, and in close collaboration with our network. We want to have a significant impact on health and healthcare . We want to improve with each passing day, continuously working towards better healthcare, research, and education. And gaining a better understanding of how diseases arise and how we can prevent, treat, and cure them, day in and day out. This way, every patient always receives the best healthcare, now and in the future. Because that is why we do what we do. Read more about our strategy and what working at Radboud university medical center means. Our colleagues would be happy to tell you about it. #weareradboudumc Our new colleague have a M.Sc. or Ph.D. degree in (Bio)Medical/Pharmaceutical Sciences, Biostatistics/Bioinformatics or Computer Science. You are experienced with analyzing large datasets with meta-data using R and/or Python and with NLP and ML. You have SQL programming and tuning experience and knowledge of clinical pharmacology, pharmacokinetics and/or pediatrics, obstetrics would be advantageous. Furthermore, you are fluent in the English language. Any questions? Please contact prof. dr. Saskia de Wildt, full professor. Use the Apply button to submit your application.

title: Data Scientist
description: Can you solve this puzzle? An ant leaves its anthill in order to forage for food. It moves with the speed of 10cm per second, but it doesn't know where to go, therefore every second it moves randomly 10cm directly north, south, east or west with equal probability. If the food is located on east-west lines 20cm to the north and 20cm to the south, as well as on north-south lines 20cm to the east and 20cm to the west from the anthill, how long will it take the ant to reach it on average? What is the average time the ant will reach food if it is located only on a diagonal line passing through (10cm, 0cm) and (0cm, 10cm) points? Can you write a program that comes up with an estimate of average time to find food for any closed boundary around the anthill? What would be the answer if food is located outside an area defined by ( (x – 2.5cm) / 30cm )2 + ( (y – 2.5cm) / 40cm )2 < 1 in coordinate system where the anthill is located at (x = 0cm, y = 0cm)? Was that easy to solve? If you enjoy mathematical challenges and writing computer programs, you could be instrumental in the success of Optiver's dynamic trading floor as our next Graduate Data Scientist. With your statistics knowledge and top-tier analytical abilities, you'll create the insights, reports and proposals that drive impactful new trading strategies. Get ready to collaborate with world-class Traders and Software Engineers from more than 50 countries to improve financial markets across the globe. This is your chance to demonstrate how valuable research and data are to the future of electronic trading. WHO WE ARE: At Optiver, our mission is to improve the market by injecting liquidity, providing accurate pricing, increasing transparency and acting as a stabilising force no matter the market conditions. With a focus on continuous improvement, we play an active role in the safeguarding of healthy and efficient markets for all participants. We tackle the toughest problems, challenge the status quo and always aim for excellence. As one of the largest market making institutions, we are a trusted partner on 70+ exchanges across the globe. Our Amsterdam office is where it all began. Since our founding in 1986, Optiver's Amsterdam office has developed into one of the most dynamic and exciting trading floors in Europe. Our culture reflects the Dutch capital city's progressive, innovative and inclusive nature. With its unique spirit, Amsterdam is the ideal hub for our teams to trade a wide range of products, from listed derivatives to cash equities, ETFs, bonds and foreign exchange. WHAT YOU'LL DO: How does Optiver accurately price hundreds of thousands of interconnected financial products in real-time? In one word: data. Data science is at the very core of Optiver's pricing strategies. Our Data Science teams tackle fascinating challenges that exist at the intersection of technology and trading - a space with some of the most complex and exciting volumes of financial market data. With world-class skills that can cut through the noise, Optiver's Data Science teams directly impact the precision and scalability of our 35+ year trading business. Optiver's Data Scientists sit on our dynamic trading floor and collaborate with Data Engineers, Quantitative Researchers and Traders to perform in-depth data analysis and share market insights. As a Graduate Data Scientist, your observations and recommendations will be highly valued, and trusted to inform crucial trading decisions, including identifying new trading opportunities. This makes you a key player in our market activities, whose impact can be felt in real time. WHO YOU ARE: The feedback loop for this team is immediate, therefore we look for dynamic and highly ambitious people who seek to constantly innovate, challenge the status quo and want to work alongside some of the most talented and intelligent people in the business. In terms of skills and qualifications, we're looking for: Excellent data analysis, scientific and critical thinking skills, as well as an eye for detail A decent level of Python development ability, experience with scientific Python stack (e.g. Pandas, Numpy and SciPy) is highly desirable Outstanding communication skills to collaborate with multiple stakeholder groups, challenge thinking and obtain buy-in The ability to present complex ideas with data to expedite decision making A focus on pragmatic outcomes, and the ability to prioritise effectively A strong interest in the world of trading, however no experience in the financial industry required WHAT YOU'LL GET: The chance to start your career working alongside best-in-class professionals from over 40 countries. Alongside this you will get great secondary benefits such as 25 days paid vacation days, full paid first-class commuting expenses, training opportunities, discounts on health insurance, breakfast and lunch facilities, sport and leisure activities, Friday afternoon drinks and even weekly in-house chair massages. Being highly international, we are accustomed to guiding expats through their relocation, offering competitive relocation packages and providing visa sponsorship where necessary. HOW TO APPLY: Are you interested in furthering your career on one of the most dynamic and exciting trading floors in Europe? Apply directly via the form below for the position of Graduate Data Scientist. Please provide us with a CV and letter of motivation in English. Unfortunately we cannot accept applications via email for data protection reasons. If your application is selected to proceed to the next round, you will be required to complete online assessments. By submitting your application you are confirming that you will be able to take the assessment within 14 days. Kindly note that we do not require any assistance from third-parties including agencies in the recruitment of this role. If you have any questions feel free to contact our Recruitment team via recruitment@optiver.com. We accept one application per role, per year, across all office locations. If you have applied to this role across any of our offices in the last year and have been unsuccessful, you can reapply once your 12 month cooling period has concluded. Please note: If you reapply before the end of your cooling period, this will be considered your most recent unsuccessful application. For applicants based in India, our entry route is via the placement office internship hiring season (July/August). As an intentionally flat organisation, we believe that great ideas and impact can come from everyone. We are passionate about empowering individuals and creating diverse teams that thrive. Every person at Optiver should feel included, valued and respected, because we believe our best work is done together. Our commitment to diversity and inclusion is hardwired through every stage of our hiring process. We encourage applications from candidates from any and all backgrounds, and we welcome requests for reasonable accommodations during the process to ensure that you can best demonstrate your abilities. Please let us know if you would like to request any reasonable adjustments by contacting the Recruitment team via recruitment@optiver.com. We accept one application per role per year. If you have previously applied to this position during this season and have been unsuccessful, you can reapply once the next recruitment season begins in 2024. More information on how Optiver Europe processes your personal data can be found in our Privacy Policy .

title: Senior Data Scientist
description: As a Senior Data Scientist you analyse, enrich and build machine learning solutions on top of the richest data sources of the bank. Together, the people in our data science area create solutions that are of value to our customers and help to fight financial and economic crime. You and your job Your experience of building data science solutions and working with billions and billions of records of data will be your main guide during your day-to-day job while you provide valuable insights for more than 7 million customers. As a Senior Data Scientist you will work with a state-of-the-art data science toolkit and collaborate closely with a team of experienced data scientists and data engineers in an agile environment. You and your team are working on categorization of transactions. By doing so for all payments in the Rabobank app, you provide spending insights for millions of customers. Facts & Figures You work with ~150 other data scientists, data engineers and ML Ops engineers from various backgrounds and 15+ nationalities Monthly learning sessions to share ideas and exchange knowledge with data scientists, engineers and product managers The department has end-to-end responsibility of 10+ ML solutions Top 3 responsibilities Bring value to the business by designing, developing and deploying models in a responsible way to ensure a smooth validation process and tangible business impact; Make impact with new data science use cases by practicing your communication skills and effectively sharing your observations with stakeholders; Prove the added value of MLOps by identifying flaws at the earliest possible moment and implement the best MLOps practices accordingly. After all, you and your team are end-to-end responsible for the ML solutions you develop together! Together we achieve more than alone Collaboration is at the heart of everything we do. The team brings diverse and talented people together to perform the best they can. As a Data Scientist, I absolutely enjoy working on the challenging business problems that are presented to us. You go from diving into exploratory analyses to developing full products - together with hugely motivated and ambitious colleagues. There is a lot of room for your development, own initiatives and there are many opportunities to contribute to the area and make a difference for Rabobank! Wouter Smit, Data Scientist You will be part of a very dynamic and international team including highly motivated team members. Working together is the way we work as we are one results-driven, data-minded and analytical team at Rabobank. Talking of Rabobank: We are a Dutch bank that operates in 38 countries for over 9,5000,000 customers. Together with these customers, our members and partners we stand side by side to create a better world together, a world in which everyone has access to enough healthy food. In the Netherlands we work to create a country in which people are happy with how they live, work and do business. You and your talent Master or PhD degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Data science, Computer Science or related field >5 years of relevant working experience in data science, with a strong statistical component Experience with leading development of data science products Experience with production models and clear understanding of MLOps is a must Experience with Python, Git, PySpark and Databricks Experience with Azure DevOps and software engineering is a plus Wants to get better every day Hands-on mentality Strong communication skills Be the driver, take initiative and be proactive This is what we offer you € 4.848,64 to € 6.926,62 gross per month based on 36-hour work week (scale 10) and depending on experience An extra budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowance Hybrid working: we work 1 or 2 days a week from the office This is a selection of the terms of employment based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment. You and the job application process Apply to this vacancy Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Lisa Boschma, recruiter via lisa.boschma@rabobank.nl #LI-LB We will conduct the interviews through a video call. You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on Frequently asked questions - Careers at Rabobank A security check is part of the process. We respect your privacy.

title: Data Scientist
description: Your Impact As a Data Scientist at Ordina, you’ll dive into the world of Artificial Intelligence (AI). You’ll apply your skills to real scenarios and in different domains, such as the discovery and investigation of payment flows at governmental entities, fraud detection at banks, the development of recommendation systems in the retail sector, and the optimization of supply chains. We are active in themes such as Natural Language Processing (NLP), Computer Vision, Machine Learning Operations (MLOps), AIOps and Explanable A.I. (XAI). You’ll carry out development and implementation of solutions with Machine Learning & Deep Learning at our clients and assess the quality and performance of existing predictive models through to bringing and keeping them into production. Where you're going to get started We create sustainable value for our clients through data within our Data area. We help companies stay agile while in transition by making data and technology part of both daily operations and strategic decision-making. We use data to help our clients stay ahead of change. Our ambition is to help organizations excel with data. The area consists of five practices: Data Governance and Data Management, Data Visualization, Data Science and AI, Data Engineering and Data Migrations, and Spatial Intelligence. Each with a distinct focus on content and the right solution. Over 170 professionals work in a content practice that is a logical fit for them. We believe in the power of multidisciplinary teams. Your expertise, personal ambitions and customer requirements are the basis for the composition of our High Performance Teams. You’ll become an indispensable link in a team of professionals so together you can all bring out the best in each other. Everyone contributes from their own expertise and technology so we all keep learning from each other and no one is ever alone. This is you Master's degree or the equivalent in experience in a Data Science field as a Data Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps, or Software Engineer Experience in some of the following Data Science techniques: supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms deep learning anomaly detection recommender systems natural language processing computer vision and reinforcement learning autoencoders, transformers, forecasting Experience in one of the following languages: Python R Experience in bringing Data Science solutions/software to production (Azure, AWS, GCP, Kubernetes, Docker, etc.) Experience in building and implementing advanced analytics solutions and you can provide some reference cases In-depth knowledge of open-source software and libraries in Python and/or R for machine and deep learning Experience in big data and platforms such as Azure Machine Learning Services and Amazon SageMaker is an advantage Good command of the Dutch language Benefits Part of our Data community with passionate and experienced peers; focus on working with one of our High Performance Teams (HPT) at renowned clients; you work in a high-tech environment with a focus on knowledge and innovation, an open no-nonsense corporate culture with room for own initiative; working with less travel time; remote & flexible; an environment where entrepreneurship and own initiative are encouraged; a culture where collegiality, knowledge sharing and collaboration are key; a pension plan, to which you are not required to contribute; 20 statutory days off and 7 additional days off via flex benefits; adapt your terms of employment to your personal wishes with flex benefits choice between a company car or a mobility scheme; Everyone is welcome to apply. Because we believe in the power of diversity and value inclusion. After all, the best ideas and smartest solutions arise in diverse teams. That is exactly why we pay so much attention to the composition of our high performance teams. So that you feel at home and can get the best out of yourself.

title: Data Scientist
description: Elopak werd in 1957 opgericht in Noorwegen en is een toonaangevende, wereldwijde leverancier van duurzame verpakkingen en afvulapparatuur. Wij produceren kartonnen verpakkingen voor melk en sap, maar ook non-food vloeistoffen zoals wasmiddel en zeep. De iconische Pure-Pak® verpakking is een natuurlijke keuze en is bedoeld om het product van de klant ongewijzigd en de wereld ongeschonden te laten. Een team van maar liefst 2.600 mensen over de hele wereld laat zich leiden door onze visie: "Chosen by people, packaged by nature." Onze medewerkers dragen de beloften Empower, Unite en Accelerate van ons bedrijf uit. Ze maken duurzame verpakkingen die een tastbare impact hebben op de consumptie door eindgebruikers. Over de grenzen slaan we de handen ineen om een natuurlijk en handig alternatief te leveren voor plastic flessen. Elopak werd in 2021 genoteerd aan de handelsbeurs van Oslo (Oslo Børs). We verkopen meer dan 14 miljard kartonnen verpakkingen per jaar in meer dan 70 landen. Duurzaamheid staat bij ons centraal bij alles wat we doen. We zijn dan ook een trotse deelnemer aan het Global Compact van de VN en sinds 2016 zijn we klimaatneutraal. Ga voor meer informatie naarwww.elopak.com of volg ons @Pure_Pak op Twitter en @Elopak op LinkedIn. Manufacturing Operations Digitalization What motivates you in your work? Is it the opportunities to learn new skills and the space to grow personally and professionally? At Elopak, you are in the right place if you have more to offer, whatever your goals are. Whether you enjoy your work or aspire to advance your career, we support you to make a difference and provide you with the tools to do so. You do this with real influence in collaboration with your team, plus an impact that reaches millions of people and the future of our planet. We are a team of 2,600 people, active in more than 40 countries. We share the ambition to create sustainable packaging solutions that do not harm the world for future generations. Together, we have the power to make this happen. Make it Real. Data Scientist / Engineer Are you interested in developing innovative solutions that make Elopak’s data architecture better, safer, and more accessible every day? Do you want to develop predictive models that make our factories smarter? That is what data science at Elopak is all about! Interested? Keep reading! How you contribute in your role You like to take the lead in developing, implementing, maintaining, supporting and rolling-out the manufacturing data architecture. You are the owner of the architecture and its technical components, like data warehouses, business intelligence applications, cloud components and digital twin applications. With the data architecture as a basis, you work with great enthusiasm to develop innovations to support use cases in line with business requirements. Your analytic and predictive models will be used to further optimize the production process in order to improve quality, delivery and efficiency. In order to continuously improve the capabilities in the area of data analytics and data science, you are an expert in collecting and analyzing business requirements and translating this into functional and technical requirements and effective solutions, as well as managing the change process around it. You will be working closely together with the Production Competence Center, which is developing, maintaining and rolling-out Elopak’s Manufacturing Execution System, as well as with stakeholders in Production, Quality and IT departments. What we appreciate about you In your role as a Data Scientist / Engineer you are forward leaning and analytical. You have a good dose of curiosity and you have the energy to learn a lot at a fast pace. You are ambitious and pro-active when it comes to working with large and complex data streams, and the technologies required for this. You are accurate, organized and able to work under pressure. Manufacturing operations is relying on your solution. You have a hands-on mentality and you enjoy to work within multi-disciplinary teams. You support and challenge your colleagues with data analysis and data science initiatives. Job requirements A completed Bachelor / Master program in a quantitative discipline, preferably in IT technology / Data Science. Excellent knowledge of data management, database technology, business intelligence and data science technologies. Experience with Industry 4.0 / IIoT technology. Ability to build relationships with internal stakeholders. Good English skills, both written and verbal. Ability to travel a few times a year to our other Elopak locations. Our offer Our culture is informal and open, involving intensive collaboration with a lot of personal responsibility. There is room for your own ideas and critical feedback. You work with passionate colleagues who support and coach you where necessary. We understand that you perform at your best when you feel at home. That is why we inspire confidence, celebrate beautiful events together, and support you when things don’t go well. You can also count on us for: Competitive salary based on experience. 25 days of vacation, with the option to buy/sell 5 additional days of vacation (based on 36 hours). Pension scheme. Flexible working hours and the option to work partly from home. The opportunity to follow job-related training and courses. At Elopak, we offer a range of benefits to our employees. These include: Discounted sports membership, a healthy canteen, cycling plan, flexible working hours, laptop and phone, home workplace setup, group health insurance. Did you became curious? Are you excited about the possibilities of data-driven working at Elopak? Don’t hesitate to apply or ask for more information! Send a message to Martin Leegwater Specialist Director Digitalization at martin.leegwater@elopak.com or call +31 115 682 235. Apply Application due 29.12.2023 Workplace Terneuzen, Nederland Contact Tessa Verschuren Recruitment & Communication Officer E-mail: TESSA.VERSCHUREN@ELOPAK.COM

title: Data Scientist
description: Job Description: Mars Veterinary Health (MVH) is part of Mars Petcare, a global, family-owned business. At Mars Veterinary Health, our 70,000+ Associates are dedicated to creating A BETTER WORLD FOR PETS™. Mars Veterinary Health is a leading veterinary health provider with an international network of over 2,500 pet hospitals including BANFIELD™, BLUEPEARL™, VCA™, Linnaeus, AniCura, VSH, VES, Mount Pleasant and others across 20+ countries. We are committed to offering compassionate high-quality veterinary care, from wellness and prevention, through primary, emergency and specialty care. To learn more, visit our website or follow us on LinkedIn. AniCura is Europe’s leading provider of high-quality veterinary care for companion animals. AniCura offers a wide range of high-quality medical services covering preventive and basic health care as well as advanced diagnostics, internal medicine, intensive care, surgery, and orthopedics. Since 2018, AniCura is part of MARS Veterinary Health, a division of MARS Inc. Job Purpose/Overview At Mars Veterinary Health International, we are on a mission to redefine the future of veterinary care by leveraging data in unprecedented ways. We are seeking a dynamic, forward-thinking Data Analyst/Data Scientist (DA/DS) to join our vibrant team in AniCura. You will be at the forefront of all things data related, working with a team that is not just analyzing data but revolutionizing the way we operate and eventually change the lives of pets for the better. If you are passionate about data and eager to drive change, we want you on our team! The DA/DS will work to advance the data & analytics capabilities of MVHI and will be part of the D&A team at AniCura. This role will report into the Head of Data & Analytics, AniCura. This role is based in AniCura headquarters in Amsterdam, Netherlands. Key Responsibilities Unlock Insights and Drive Innovation: Utilize your analytical prowess to dissect complex data sets and unveil insights that will propel our business forward. Collaborate and Influence: Work closely with cross-functional teams to develop data-driven strategies that will add value. Visual Storytelling: Develop compelling data visualizations and dashboards that narrate the story behind the numbers, influencing key stakeholder decisions. Champion Data Quality: Be the guardian of data quality, ensuring accuracy and consistency, while identifying opportunities for process improvements. Continuous Learning: Stay abreast of the latest trends and technologies in data analytics/data science, bringing fresh perspectives and innovative solutions to our team. Job Specifications/Qualifications 2-4 years of experience in data analytics, data science, business intelligence, or consulting B.Sc. or M.Sc. degree in data analytics, statistics, economics, computer science or a similar field Experience with large and complex datasets Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a knack for translating data into actionable insights Intermediate/advanced proficiency in Power BI/Query, Python and Excel Proficiency in data analysis and querying data through Python and SQL, data modelling and machine learning Fluent verbal and written communication skills in English Excellent communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information in a clear and concise manner Experience working with applications like Azure Suite, Power Automate, Databricks, Alteryx, PySpark as well as a good knowledge of ETL, dataflows of data warehouses would be a plus (but no requirement) What can you expect from AniCura? Work with over 12.000 like-minded and talented Associates at AniCura and over 130.000 at Mars, all guided by The Five Principles Join a purpose driven company, where we’re striving to shape the future of veterinary care, together An industry competitive salary and benefits package Flexible working hours, an international and digital work environment The opportunity to cuddle our beloved 4-legged friends in our offices About AniCura AniCura is present at 500 European locations in 15 countries and creates peace of mind for pet owners through excellent access and patient safety. Every year, AniCura’s 12,000 employees attend to more than 3.6 million companion animal patients. AniCura is a trusted training and referral body. Since 2018, AniCura is part of Mars Veterinary Health, a family-owned company with the sole objective of advancing the veterinary profession for the health and wellbeing of people, pets, and planet. Through our collective network of 2,500 veterinary clinics, hospitals, and diagnostic labs across 21 countries, we can provide the highest standards in pet care and achieve our collective Purpose: A better world for pets through Shaping the Future of Veterinary Care, together. Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

title: Data Scientist
description: Eneco - Regio Rotterdam 32 - 40 uur 0-1 jaar/year €500 - €675 Je krijgt een kijkje in de keuken van ons Credit Management team Onderdeel uitmaken van een enthousiast team Bijdragen aan de energietransitie Waarom kiezen voor Eneco? Wij willen dat iedereen kan meedoen aan de energietransitie. Dat kan alleen als we klanten nog beter gaan helpen en drempels voor ze wegnemen om te verduurzamen. Een groep klanten die onze speciale aandacht verdient, zijn mensen die op de een of andere manier in de geldproblemen zijn gekomen. Bij Credit Management zoeken we naar creatieve manieren om financiële barrières te slechten zodat iedereen mee kan in de energietransitie. En daar hebben we jou bij nodig! Dit ga je doen Word jij blij van het ontwikkelen van modellen die gedrag kunnen voorspellen? Dan is deze stage perfect voor jou. Als Data Scientist ga je aan de slag bij de afdeling Credit Management. Deze afdeling is verantwoordelijk voor klanten die in de financiële problemen zijn gekomen. Gaat dit over jou? Je werkt samen met een team data specialisten met een missie: ervoor zorgen dat iedereen mee kan doen aan de energietransitie. Je hebt al eerder een voorspellend model ontwikkeld en je volgende uitdaging is om dit ook echt in praktijk toe te gaan passen. Je schrikt niet van grote hoeveelheden data en kunt daarin snel onderscheid maken tussen wat relevant is en wat niet. Daarnaast is het volgende belangrijk: Je volgt een HBO/WO opleiding Je gaat beginnen aan je scriptie Je het ervaring met SQL en kunt verschillende tabellen aan elkaar knopen Je kunt data ‘cleanen’, je weet hoe je om moet gaan met missende waarden of uitschieters Je hebt kennis/ervaring met de meest voorkomende machine learning algoritmes (regressie, clustering, tree analysis etc.) Je hebt ervaring met Python (of een andere taal/tool om voorspellende modellen te ontwikkelen) Je vindt het leuk om resultaten begrijpelijk te maken en te presenteren aan mensen die minder gevoel bij ‘data’ hebben Je maakt data graag ‘menselijk’. Je hebt het niet over records maar over klanten. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor Samen met de andere data analisten en data scientists ga je aan slag met het ontwikkelen van voorspellende modellen die als doel hebben om klanten ‘op maat’ te helpen hun financiën weer op orde te krijgen. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan het identificeren van klanten die geholpen zouden zijn met een betalingsregeling. Of uitstellen van een betaling. Maar ook via welk kanaal (e-mail, telefoon, brief) we klanten het beste kunnen bereiken. Want daar begint het mee. Dit worden je collega's Bij Eneco Credit Management werken we met twee teams, jouw Resultaat team en een Operationeel team. Je gaat werken in een multidisciplinair team, zodat je snel kan schakelen bij marktontwikkelingen, feedback van klanten en het doorvoeren van verbeterinitiatieven. Alle disciplines die nodig zijn om een betekenisvolle verandering op te starten, zijn onderdeel van het team. Jouw collega’s in het resultaatteam hebben onder andere expertise op het gebied van Partner Management, Processen, Automatisering en Intelligence. Op ons hoofdkantoor werk je in modern en licht gebouw, op een locatie die uitstekend bereikbaar is: op 2 minuten loopafstand van metro en treinstation Rotterdam-Alexander. We werken hybride: je werkt 40% van je werkweek op kantoor en 40% thuis. De andere dag (overige 20%) bepaal je zelf waar je het beste kunt werken. Stagevergoeding tussen €500 en €675 bruto per maand Op basis van een fulltime stage krijg je maandelijks een stagevergoeding. Kickstart van je carrière Je krijgt veel vrijheid, tijd en ruimte om te leren én je mag meewerken binnen een grote organisatie. Alle kans jezelf te ontwikkelen Eneco zet vol in op persoonlijke en professionele ontwikkeling Hybride werken, thuis of op kantoor Je werkt 40% op kantoor en 40% thuis. De andere 20% bepaal je zelf waar je het beste kunt werken. Werken bij Eneco is voor iedereen Onze klanten zijn divers, en wijzelf ook. Ruim 4.000 Eneco-talenten zorgen voor een open, fijne cultuur waarin iedereen kan groeien en bloeien. Zo creëren we de ideale voedingsbodem voor creatieve inzichten en innovatieve oplossingen. En die kunnen we goed gebruiken om onze ambitieuze missie waar te maken: klimaatneutraal zijn in 2035. Weet je wat het leuke is? Van talent hebben we bij Eneco nooit genoeg. Dus laat van je horen en solliciteer. Samen met jou gaan we voor duurzaam. Werk dat werkt voor jou en het klimaat Kies je voor een carrière bij Eneco, dan kies je voor ambitie, groei en kansen. Je krijgt alle ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen en het werk te doen zoals het bij jou past. Daar hoort ook een goede werk-privébalans bij. Je kunt je tijden flexibel indelen en deels thuiswerken als je functie dat toelaat. Zo werk je aan je eigen toekomst, maar óók aan die van de wereld. Want samen met je 4.000 collega’s ga je voor die ene grote missie: klimaatneutraal in 2035. We helpen klanten sneller verduurzamen, bedenken innovatieve oplossingen en pakken kansen met beide handen aan. Doe je mee? Zo gaat het verder Stap 1 Je solliciteert Stap 2 Wij bekijken je sollicitatie zorgvuldig Stap 3 Wij nodigen je uit voor een 1e (online) gesprek Stap 4 Soms willen we je nog beter leren kennen en volgt er een online assessment en een 2e gesprek Stap 5 Is er een match? Dan bellen we je met een passend aanbod. En dan... gefeliciteerd met je nieuwe baan! Meer weten over deze functie?

title: Data Scientist
description: Data engineer en data scientist in eHealth Wil jij mensen écht helpen om beter in hun vel te zitten? Analyseer en bouw jij mee aan datagedreven projecten en wil je deze omtoveren in waardevolle inzichten die zorgverleners in de psychologie direct toepassen? Kom bij ons werken als data engineer en data scientist! Hoe ziet je dag eruit? Nadat je je eerste kopje koffie hebt genomen, bespreek je de status van verschillende data projecten binnen het data team. Je werkt dagelijks aan uitdagende projecten die in het teken staan van het data driven worden van Therapieland. Vandaag ligt de focus op het uitbreiden van het data warehouse, waarvoor je samen met je team van vijf collega’s een sterke strategie ontwikkelt. Aan het eind van de dag bereid je je alvast voor om morgen aan de slag te gaan met het te implementeren recommendation system. Functie Bij Therapieland werken we iedere dag hard om Nederland een stukje gezonder te maken. We hebben een ambitieus doel opgesteld, namelijk om 100.000.000 mensen te helpen. Als lid van het datateam ben je continu op zoek naar de beste manier om onze data te organiseren en analyseren. Hiermee help je Therapieland om de waarde van de verschillende oplossingen inzichtelijk te maken zodat we de juiste beslissingen kunnen nemen. Wij zoeken een data engineer die de ambitie heeft om elk stukje van de data puzzel op te lossen, van beheer en uitbreiding van het data warehouse, het bouwen van data pipelines, tot de implementatie van datagestuurde oplossingen in een cloud omgeving. Samen met je collega’s bespreek je de talloze keuzes die hierbij te maken zijn en zorg je voor automatisering van het proces. Binnen deze functie ligt de prioriteit op data engineering, maar er zal ook ruimte zijn om data science projecten op te pakken. Jouw taken: Het ontwerpen, implementeren en beheren van data pipelines; Het organiseren, ontsluiten, en beheren van relevante data voor Therapieland uit verschillende databronnen in Google cloud. Het beveiligen, schonen, transformeren, converteren, voorbewerken, integreren en optimaliseren van data, en het beschikbaar en toegankelijk maken van deze data in een analyse-omgeving zodat deze bruikbaar is voor data science en BI-tooling. Complexe statistische analyses uitvoeren in programmeertalen zoals R, Python en MATLAB. Data modelling Je bent succesvol in deze rol als je: Enkele jaren werkervaring hebt als Data Engineer, Data Scientist, Data Steward of Data Analist met programme ervaring. Kennis hebt van data science en affiniteit met data engineering. Bewezen ervaring hebt in het beheren van een data warehouse of data lake die data beschikbaar maken voor data science en BI-tooling, en kennis hebt van PostgresSQL en Google Cloud. Solide programmeerervaring hebt in Python liefst Django, zowel in notebooks als native. Ervaring met Git en databasebeheer. Woonachtig bent in Nederland. Wat bieden we jou? Salaris tussen EUR € 3.500 en €4.500 bruto per maand op basis van 40 uur per week. 75 sociaal betrokken collega’s die samen lunchen, op skivakantie gaan (krijg je als kerstcadeau!) en borrelen op ons terras aan het IJ 30 vakantiedagen op fulltime basis Verschillende initiatieven rondom gezondheid zoals de vitaliteitsweek en vers fruit op kantoor Een platte organisatie waarbij je autonoom kunt werken, jouw ideeën welkom zijn en iedereen gelijkwaardig is Coaching, gericht op jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling Een hybride werkomgeving met een Digital Nomad policy om te werken vanuit huis, kantoor of een een aantal weken vanuit het buitenland Een opleidingsbudget van €500,00 per persoon, per jaar Altijd vrij op 5 mei, bevrijdingsdag! Onbeperkt gebruik van alle programma’s op ons platform Een vergoeding als je met de fiets, het OV of de auto naar kantoor komt. Pensioenregeling (+ overlijden- en arbeidsongeschiktheidsregeling) waarbij je de keuze hebt om bij te sparen Alle tools die jij nodig hebt om fijn te werken en maximaal impact te maken Wie zijn wij dan? Vanuit onze locatie aan het IJ in Amsterdam ontwikkelen wij e-Health. Zo komt de zorg en preventie op een makkelijke en leuke manier bij de mensen thuis, of waar dan ook, op elk gewenst moment. Onze missie is door technologie en psychologie samen te brengen mensen mentaal weerbaar te maken. Ondersteund door technologische ontwikkelingen zoals apps, e-health trainingen en vragenlijsten biedt Therapieland de houvast die hierbij nodig is. We zijn een snelgroeiende scale-up met jonge, enthousiaste en hardwerkende professionals. Therapieland biedt een zelfstandige functie in een persoonlijke, informele en gezellige organisatie. We werken hard, maar houden ook van een vrijdagmiddagborrel of skivakantie! Een van de teams van Therapieland is team Data & Research, dit is een groeiend team dat zich bezighoudt met het organiseren, analyseren en onderzoeken van onze diensten en de onderliggende data. Wij ondersteunen Therapieland in het data-driven worden en bedenken data-gedreven oplossingen om zoveel mogelijk mensen te kunnen helpen. Kom jij ons versterken? Heb je interesse en wil je solliciteren, reageer dan met je CV en motivatie. Vacancy in English Data engineer and data scientist in eHealth Do you get excited about data-driven projects into valuable insights that healthcare providers in psychology can immediately apply? Come work with us as a data engineer and data scientist! What does your day look like? After your first coffee, you discuss the status of various data projects within the data team. You work on challenging projects that are all about making Therapyland data driven. Today the focus is on expanding the data warehouse, for which you develop a strong strategy together with your team. At the end of the day, you prepare yourself to get started with the recommendation system that needs to be implemented. Role and responsibilities As a member of the data team, you are looking for the best way to organize our data. We are looking for a data engineer who has the ambition to solve every piece of the data puzzle, from managing and expanding the data warehouse, building data pipelines, to implementing data-driven solutions in a cloud environment. Together with the team you discuss the countless choices that can be made and you ensure automation of the process. Designing, implementing and managing data pipelines; Organizing and managing relevant data for Therapieland from various data sources in google cloud; Securing, cleaning, transforming, converting, preprocessing, integrating and optimizing data; Making data available and accessible in an analysis environment so that it can be used for data science and BI tooling; Complex statistical analysis in R, Python or MATLAB; Data modelling; Working together with a team of young enthusiastic professionals within a fast-growing company Skills. You will be successful in this role if you: Relevant work experience as a data engineer, data scientist or data steward or data analyst with programming experience Have proven experience in managing a data warehouse or data lake that makes data available for data science and BI tooling, and have knowledge of PostgresSQL and Google Cloud. Solid programming experience in Python, preferably Django, both in notebooks and natively. Experience with Git and database management. Likes to work with developers and have an affinity with software development You have a Master's degree in a quantitative direction (e.g. computer science, computer science, data engineering or data science). Who we are Based in Amsterdam we develop e-Health. Our services make it possible to deliver care and prevention in an easy and fun way. Our mission is to make people mentally resilient by bringing technology and psychology together. Supported by technological developments such as apps, e-health training and questionnaires, Therapieland offers the necessary support. We are a fast-growing scale-up with young, enthusiastic and hardworking professionals. Therapieland offers an independent function in a personal, informal and pleasant organization. We work hard, but we also love a Friday afternoon drink or ski holiday! One of Therapieland teams is team Data & Research, this is a growing team that is involved in organizing, analyzing and researching our services and the underlying data. We support Therapieland in becoming data-driven and come up with data-driven solutions to help as many people as possible. Will you join us? If you are interested and would like to apply, please send your CV, including motivation, to vacature@therapieland.nl.

title: Data Scientist
description: Over deze vacature Bij TNO werken bevlogen experts die hun stempel drukken op deze tijd. Want dit is de tijd om te innoveren. Om de wereld van werk verder te helpen. Dit is de tijd om te werken aan systeeminnovaties voor het verbeteren van de duurzame inzetbaarheid en productiviteit van werkenden voor Nederland en andere Europese landen. Kom werken bij TNO als Data Scientist duurzaam werk en smart organisations en druk ook jouw stempel op deze tijd! Wat ga je doen? Duurzame inzetbaarheid van mensen is van groot belang. Niet alleen voor Nederland, maar ook voor Europa. De expertise groep Sustainable Productivity and Employability bestaat uit psychologen, bewegingswetenschappers, gezondheidswetenschappers, sociologen, data scientists en methodologen (ruim 45 medewerkers). Zij zetten zich in voor het verbeteren van duurzame inzetbaarheid van werkenden. Dat doen wij door te werken aan oplossingen waarmee de totale groep werkenden zo lang mogelijk gezond, vitaal en bevlogen aan het werk blijft. Om dit te bereiken doen we onderzoek, ontwikkelen en evalueren we interventies en oplossingen op het terrein van Foresight, skills matching, ontwikkeling (“leven lang leren”), het aanpassen van het werk (job crafting) en mobiliteit (met aspecten rondom flexibilisering). Als Data Scientist werk je in het team Smart Organisations. Dit team bestuit uit 7 collega's. Er is veel kennis over arbeidsmarktonderzoek, statistiek en modelleren. Wat we nu nog missen is kennis van machine learning, deep learning en neural networks. Hier kom jij om de hoek kijken. Jij voert in teamverband verschillende (inter)nationale onderzoeks- en adviesprojecten uit. Doel hiervan is om de duurzame inzetbaarheid en productiviteit van werknemers te bevorderen en te borgen. Daarbij ligt jouw focus op het uitvoeren van kwantitatief onderzoek, zoals: Het voeren van complexe data-analyses voor gezondheids- en arbeidsdata uit met behulp van statistische methoden, machine learning-algoritmen en data visualisatietools om trends, patronen en inzichten te identificeren; Analyseren van teksten met textmining en Natural Language Processing; het ontwikkelen van data infrastructuur; koppeling van databestanden (big data); tooling en implementatie; het borgen van kennis over machine learning, deep learning en neural networks in het team; het publiceren van onderzoeksresultaten, ook in wetenschappelijke tijdschriften. Je gaat samenwerken met vakinhoudelijk experts en een TNO breed netwerk van Data Scientists die werken aan geavanceerde analytische methoden en artificiële intelligentie (AI). Bijvoorbeeld de ontwikkeling van conceptuele en theoretische verklaringen omtrent beroepsmobiliteit en de betekenis van vaardigheden (skills). Vanuit je rol zorg je voor de verbinding tussen de sociale wetenschappers van de afdeling en de AI specialisten van andere afdelingen. Zo draag je bij aan ontwikkeling en innovatie binnen de afdeling SPE en de unit Healthy Living and Work. Daarnaast werk je mee aan projectvoorstellen, offertes, (beleids- en advies) rapporten en artikelen in het Engels en bij voorkeur ook in het Nederlands. Wat wij van jou verwachten Je hebt aantoonbare ervaring met machine learning, deep learning en neural networks . Denk aan werken met analyse- en programmeersoftware (R, Python, Matlab), up-to-date kennis over artificiële intelligentie en tekst mining #LI-Hybrid Je hebt een relevante (wetenschappelijke) opleiding. D enk bijvoorbeeld aan data science, sociologie, psychologie, econometrie of een andere discipline binnen de sociale wetenschappen). Je hebt ervaring als onderzoeker en je vindt het ook leuk om te publiceren. De ervaring kan je prima opgedaan hebben in bijvoorbeeld een PhD. Je hebt affiniteit met maatschappelijke vraagstukken en arbeidsmarktonderzoek. Het maken van maatschappelijke impact is waar jij het voor doet. Wat wij jou bieden Uitdagend én afwisselend werk met serieuze impact. En volop kansen, want bij TNO heb je grotendeels zelf de regie over je carrière. Naast een bruto (fulltime) maandsalaris tussen € 4.500,- en € 5.750,- (afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring), vakantiegeld (8%), een dertiende maand (8,33%) en een flexbudget (5,58% + €180), krijg je alle mogelijkheden om jezelf te ontwikkelen. Daarnaast kun je bij TNO een ‘menu’ aan arbeidsvoorwaarden samenstellen dat bij jouw persoonlijke situatie past. Wat je ook mag verwachten: Een uiterst professionele, innovatieve werkomgeving, met topexperts als collega’s. Mogelijkheid om cursussen, opleidingen en workshops te volgen en congressen te bezoeken, en coaching als je daar behoefte aan hebt. 33 vakantiedagen (bij een fulltime dienstverband). Een werkgever die divers talent waardeert en stimuleert, met initiatieven als het Female Leadership Programma, onze Rainbow Community en round tables over inclusiethema’s. Een uitgebreide en flexibele mobiliteitsregeling, inclusief volledige vergoeding van openbaar vervoer voor woon-werk en zakelijke reizen. Gezellige activiteiten met je team en andere TNO'ers. Zo leer je snel veel mensen kennen. Flexibele werktijden, de mogelijkheid om parttime (32 of 36 uur) te werken en de mogelijkheid om thuis te werken. Een goede pensioenregeling. Lees hier uit welke arbeidsvoorwaarden je verder kunt kiezen. TNO als werkgever Bij TNO innoveren we voor een gezonder, veiliger en duurzamer leven. En voor een sterke economie. Sinds 1932 ontwikkelen wij kennis en technologie voor het algemeen belang. We vinden elkaar in verwondering en vindingrijkheid, en we zijn gedreven om grenzen te verleggen. Voor jouw talent en ambitie is er alle ruimte en ondersteuning. Je werkt samen met mensen die aan je gewaagd zijn, die jou inspireren én van jou willen leren. Onze state-of-the-art-faciliteiten zijn er om jouw visie te verwezenlijken. Wat je bij TNO doet, doet ertoe: impact maakt het verschil. Want met elke innovatie draag je bij aan het leven van morgen. Lees meer over TNO als werkgever. Bij TNO stimuleren we een inclusieve werkomgeving, waar jij jezelf kunt zijn. Wat je verhaal ook is en welke unieke eigenschappen je ook meebrengt. Juist door onze unieke krachten en perspectieven te bundelen zijn we in staat om innovaties te ontwikkelen die een wezenlijk verschil maken in de samenleving. Meer weten? Lees welke stappen wij zetten op het gebied van diversiteit en inclusie. Hoe ziet het proces eruit? Reageren kan tot en met 6 december 2023. De sollicitatieprocedure bestaat uit twee gespreksrondes. In een laatste gesprek bespreken we de arbeidsvoorwaarden die je zelf samenstelt. We streven ernaar de hele procedure binnen vier weken af te ronden. Een online assessment en referentiecheck kunnen onderdeel uitmaken van de selectieprocedure. Als je bij ons komt werken vragen wij je ook een Verklaring Omtrent het Gedrag (VOG) te overleggen.

title: Data Scientist
description: Do you want to contribute to predicting conversion probabilities for a million households as a Data Scientist? If this speaks to you, you'll feel at home at the International Analytics Hub. And every day at work, you’ll be doing your part for all the charities we support. So it won’t be just your job that’ll inspire you – so will the impact you’ll be helping to make. Maurits van den Brand, Data Scientist: “Every day we aim to identify, discover and implement new possibilities based on data intelligence in order to keep on raising ever more funds for social organisations and causes across the world.” As a Data Scientist, you’ll: Build, maintain and automate statistical models while also developing machine learning solutions. Use data-driven reasoning to provide informed advice and make optimal decisions. Conduct comprehensive research to better understand current and potential customers. Collaborate with marketers, product owners and other stakeholders to design and assess research and experiments. Advise management and stakeholders on analysis results and strategic recommendations. You’d describe yourself as follows: Holder of a master's degree in econometrics, mathematics, business analytics or a related field with 3+ years working as a Data Scientist. Extensively experienced in building and maintaining statistical models and machine learning algorithms using SQL and Python. Knowledgeable about AWS and tools like SageMaker and Docker, and familiar with or eager to learn about MLOps processes. A skilled communicator and collaborator, adept at working in cross-functional teams. Proactive, with a penchant for innovation and strategic, creative thinking. About us: The Postcode Lottery Group is a marketing-driven international non-profit organisation. We operate lotteries to raise funds for a fairer, greener and healthier world. Our players win with their neighbours and generate money for charities together – it’s a win-win! We’ve raised more than €12.6 billion for thousands of good causes since 1989. We’re the third-largest private charitable donor in the world. Working alongside more than 1,500 fellow team members in Great Britain, the Netherlands, Sweden, Germany and Norway, you’ll be helping to build a better world every day! About the department: The Postcode Lottery Group is building an International Analytics Hub to provide our lotteries with the right models, tools, tech and best practices to help realise our growth ambitions. In the hub you’ll work with the business to identify value-adding business cases for advanced statistical analytics. You’ll work on exciting and challenging BI, data and AI projects that will create real impact for the lotteries and our beneficiary organisations. This will make you happy: A monthly salary between €4,800 and €6,500, a variable year-end bonus, an excellent pension scheme, and 28 days’ holiday a year based on a 40-hour week and flexible working hours. We believe it’s important that you’re able to keep developing professionally and personally, so we support ongoing training. The Lottery Academy offers a wide range of courses. And there are plenty of opportunities to grow within the organisation. You’ll work in our sustainable building within walking distance of Amsterdam Zuid station, and you'll get an NS Business Card, which lets you travel for free all over the Netherlands, even outside working hours! We like to celebrate our successes with our colleagues and charity partners at well-attended monthly drinks and parties. We know exercising and relaxing are good for you. So we offer free boot camp, Pilates and kickboxing classes, and some of our employees are training together for a half-marathon. And you’ll enjoy free entry to more than 145 museums, plus theatre and cinema discounts. You’ll receive your full salary (100%) during childbirth and parental leave. To help you get involved in our charity partners’ work, we offer project visits and talks in our on-site auditorium. You can also volunteer three days a year during working hours, potentially with colleagues. Join us: We believe an inclusive organisation is the ideal breeding ground for creativity, collaboration and innovation. Employee solidarity is important to us, too. Each of us has a part to play in that – we are the organisation, after all. We strive to make everyone feel at home. That means keeping an open mind and paying attention to each other’s welfare. Can you see yourself as part of the team? We encourage you to apply – whatever your roots, religion, age, ability to work or life philosophy. Send your CV and covering letter to our Recruitment Business Partner Maria-Christina Kool through werkendoejebij.nl. Do you want more information? She’ll be happy to help at +31657307901. Please note that this is a direct search led by the Recruitment team. Applications from agencies will not be accepted, nor will fees be paid for unsolicited CVs. Vacature-ID 82 Datum plaatsing 17-07-2023 03:24 Locaties Office Amsterdam

title: Data Scientist
description: Brief info about Vinted Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with a growing member base of over 80 million registered members spanning 19 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life. Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year. The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Czech Republic, Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 1,800 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital. Information about the position You'll become part of the Trust domain, Safety track, with a mission to protect the Vinted community from harmful activities and content. The Safety track of the Trust domain is engaged in detecting, understanding, and stopping fraud and other malicious activities within the Vinted Marketplace. As a product team Decision Scientist, you will become part of a cross-functional team and drive quality of decisions by bringing actionable insights from data. Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA), we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways, and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department: Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines. Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision-making. Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms. In this position, you'll Be your team's primary point of contact to provide answers to data-related questions Ensure these questions are answered in optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad hoc deep-dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis) Collaborate with your team and stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions Analyse identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact (i.e. size opportunities) Own the key performance indicators for a team, including selection, tracking, forecasting, and proactively flagging issues Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker) Define the requirements for (A/B) testing and analyze the results of (A/B) tests Help to create a backlog with prioritised hypotheses and analyses About you Strong proven experience in Data Analytics (typically 4+ years of working experience or similar activities resulting in a similar level of proficiency) A good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences Strong analytical, strategic, and business skills A degree in statistics, physics, econometrics, economics, business or a similar field Statistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis) Knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.) Proficient in SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.) Advantage: experience with Machine Learning techniques (especially NLP) Advantage: experience working in the Trust & Safety or Fraud-related area Work perks The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme 25 working days of holiday Newest MacBook models Free access to an office gym Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture Private health insurance On-site canteen serving delicious homemade food at discount prices Frequent team-building events A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation A dog-friendly office Working at Vinted Individual Learning Budget Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You'll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role. Hybrid Work We've adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in office are recommended but not enforced. It's up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you'll spend working together in person. Equal Opportunity The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic. The salary range for this position is € 56,400 - € 79,925 gross per year.

title: Data Scientist
description: Job Description: DIGITAL Are you inspired to be part of the team that digitally reimagines the way we work at Mars? Do you want to practice your digital muscle and ability to engage others on the journey? Do you want to be part of the Planning Centre of Excellence, the driving force of a human centric digital planning transformation. And do you want to contribute to inspire moments of everyday happiness? Read more below…. CONTEXT &THE TEAM In this rapidly changing world, an agile supply chain (SC) makes the difference for our customer and consumers. Mars is transforming their supply chain to become more end to end connected, transparent, faster, agile, customer focused and digital. Mars believes that a human centric and digitally connected planning team is key to unlock this as it is the glue for one end to end SC team. The End to End Planning Center of Excellence (CoE) sits at the heart of this transformation. It can be seen as a digital catalyst to speed up and strengthen the planning transformation. We will share the common passion to bring the benefits of a digital way of working to the people in the (planning) operation all around Europe for their own benefit and that of customers / consumers. The team focusses on production sites in Europe and sales in 90 countries all over the world. It will operate by the principals of; full transparency of processes and data, planning by exception and continuous improvement of people processes and systems. Within the CoE the Insights & Analytics team (IA) is building the data driven decision making muscle to empower our EU MW planning & logistics colleagues. The IA team exists of business analysts who translate business needs and clarify real problem statement, and data scientists who are working on digital prototyping and solutions. On expertise and best practices, the regional team is linked to a Mars global analytics and data scientist network. THE ROLE The data scientist have to make sure that data needs to be gathered in a way that can be easily re-used in the future (data infrastructure), the statistical analytics and forecasting tools need to be optimised and the reporting dashboards provide a real time intuitive summary. The DS engages with the business users to understand the real problem, engages with users to secure data quality and to provide a trusted solution required to create a user-friendly and intuitive dashboard. To face these activities the data analyst is working together with multiple teams that will help with the process knowledge and the stakeholder engagement the data analyst collaborates on these topics and gives guidance through his/her data insights and then leads the technical solutioning where needed. In this way the ideal data scientist has a strong technical profile with high business acumen and a passion to help people utilise digital tools. In practice this means the role has 5 key elements that are based on continuous improvement: 1. Agree and emerge themselves in the priority business problems to be solved. 2. Build the required and reusable data infrastructure for the best analysis 3. Solve data issues through technology or organisational alignment 4. Co-develop a repetitive mechanism to analyse and solve the problem. 5. Repeat the cycle. Key to this is to ensure that the digital solution is communicated and explained to the planning team in a non-technical way to ensure the result is accepted and not overwritten. This requires the ability to listen to market feedback, evaluate statistical findings / improvements, provide business insights on different level an aggregation and clearly communicate to stakeholders in their language. As this is a complete new way of planning in Mars this approach will to evolve over time. The data scientist will need to amend his leadership and stakeholder management style to this. Especially in the beginning it will be crucial to be able to bridge the gap between statistics and standard business way of working. Key Responsibilities Define focused value added planning problem-statements for balancing service, stock and cost for the business based on use-cases, design thinking and value stream analysis. Providing insights from data to support the organization making more and more data driven decisions in the area of: forecasting, supply planning, risk analyst in supply & demand, inventory setting Presenting results in a compelling and clear manner to drive business decision making Supports demand sensing activities in E2Open through the provision of analysis and insights to optimize forecasting results Build algorithms and design experiments to merge, manage, interrogate, and extract good quality data needed for this. Look for opportunities to improve the flow of data and evaluate new and emerging technologies Identifying new relevant data sources and incorporating these in the data structure. Enhancing data collection procedures to create new data sources Experience / Background Education and Professional B.S. or BA in computer science, data science, machine learning, mathematics, statistics or related natural science or technical degree. Master or advanced degree preferred 3-5 years of experience working in a technical / analytics role Knowledge / Experience Experience in a programming language such as Phyton Experience with data structures (SQL, Azure) Experience with ERP and Advanced Planning Systems (preferably E2Open or Rapid Response) Working knowledge of data mining, machine learning and other statistical techniques Understanding of Lean / Six Sigma / root cause analysis, e.g., 5 why’s Ability to support complex analysis in understandable forms to business stakeholders Attention to detail and a passion for data accuracy Fluent in English Experience in the aera of Supply Chain Management Strong expertise in combination of Mathematics, Statistics, Business acumen and programming Strong expertise in combination of Mathematics, Statistics, Business acumen and programming Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description: Ben jij dé pionier in de nieuwe generatie data technologieën? Ben je in staat om de technologie in te zetten om concrete problemen op te lossen en waarde toe te voegen? Werkervaring 5 - 10 jaar Opleidingsniveau WO Vakgebied Corporate staf Functieniveau Senior Jouw rol Als onderdeel van ons team Innovatie & Research binnen het Datalab bevind je je op de frontlinie van technologische transformatie. Dat gaat veel verder dan alleen experimenteren: we bouwen oplossingen en proposities van kop tot staart en zorgen voor naadloze implementatie binnen de organisatie. Het AI Programma & Moonshot-initiatieven: Onze unieke aanpak? Het AI programma, met diverse 'moonshot' initiatieven, gericht op het aanpakken van actuele uitdagingen binnen PGGM.
