Wat bied jij Je beschikt over 3 jaar relevante werkervaring binnen de vakgebieden Bedrijfskunde en/of IT Je bent HBO/WO geschoold in een relevante richting (bijvoorbeeld Business IT & Management, Business Analytics, Operations Research of Technische Bedrijfskunde of Econometrie) Je bevindt je op het snijvlak van IT/data en de business, je bent in beide geïnteresseerd; je hebt dus affiniteit met de technische kant maar ook de rekensom van het geheel De motivatie én deskundigheid om samen met je collega’s processen en werkwijzen structureel te verbeteren Aantoonbare ervaring met het schrijven van robuuste en generieke code (OOP) in Python of vergelijkbare taal Wat bieden wij Iedere dag fruit van de zaak Veelzijdige stack met open source applicaties, frameworks en tools (o.a. MariaDB, Python, PySpark, Ansible, RabbitMQ, ELK-stack) 10+ collega’s met diverse disciplines en expertises (van programmeren tot business analyse en datavisualisatie) Uitgebreid applicatielandschap met een Data Warehouse als middelpunt Werkzaamheden met focus op zowel Business Intelligence als Proces Automatisering Ruimte voor het ontwikkelen van nieuwe oplossingen en applicaties LifeCheck: Gratis en anoniem toegang tot artsen, psychologen, (budget)coaches en voedingsdeskundigen Wat doe je als Data Analist? Als Data Analist bij Broekhuis kijk je naar het geheel; je houdt je bezig met het structureren, analyseren en interpreteren van data. Hiervoor werk je met diverse technieken en databronnen. Daarnaast werk je mee aan ons Data Warehouse en aan het ontwikkelen van compleet nieuwe oplossingen met behulp van onder andere Python en SQL. Daarbij rekenen we op jouw inbreng en die van onze andere specialisten. Zo kunnen we samen bouwen aan een stabiel data-landschap, waarmee we voorbereid zijn op de toekomst. Je komt te werken bij een flexibel en ambitieus team, dat bestaat uit specialisten met diverse disciplines en expertises. Samen met deze specialisten neem jij geen genoegen met traditionele werkwijzen; je zoekt altijd naar verbeteringen. Daarom heb je binnen dit team alle ruimte om te innoveren en de business te adviseren over verbeteringen en vernieuwingen. Dit doe je niet alleen; daarvoor werk je nauw samen met collega’s die zelfs in de pauze of op de fiets nog enthousiast kunnen sparren over ideeën en wensen. Samen denk je bijvoorbeeld na over de vervolgstappen met AI. Kortom, met een ambitieus team werk je aan het creëren van een meer data-driven werkwijze, die perfect past bij Broekhuis. Een greep uit de werkzaamheden: Wensen van de business in kaart brengen, concretiseren en uitwerken Data structureren, analyseren, interpreteren en modelleren voor het Data Warehouse Data ontsluiten, met o.a. onze zelfgemaakte PySpark module (ETL), uit ruim 75+ databronnen verspreid over API's en traditionele databases Configuration as Code met Ansible toepassen voor de inrichting van ons microserver-landschap Samen met collega’s nadenken over het grote geheel; hoe kunnen we het morgen beter doen? Waarom werken bij Broekhuis leuk is Werken bij familiebedrijf Broekhuis is werken bij één van de grootste mobiliteitsaanbieders van Nederland. Met al onze collega’s houden wij ons iedere dag aan de belofte “alles voor een enthousiaste klant”. Om die inzet van iedereen te kunnen vragen, investeert Broekhuis als werkgever juist ook in onze collega’s. Zij zijn namelijk de spil in onze organisatie naar de klanten toe. Het is met die reden dat we onze collega’s een fijne werkplek, met prettige voordelen en ruimte voor persoonlijke groei aanbieden. Bij ons staat de mens centraal, zowel de klanten als onze collega’s. Werken bij Broekhuis - Hoofdkantoor Op het hoofdkantoor van Broekhuis draait alles om de gezamenlijke kracht van de collega’s. Alle teams zijn hecht, ambitieus en ze zetten zich als één groep in om van klanten echte Broekhuis-ambassadeurs te maken. Samenwerken is key! Hoe? Door altijd te willen helpen en te denken in oplossingen. Dit doet Broekhuis ook voor jou! Zo ontvang je onder andere kortingen op je sportabonnement en in de werkplaats om je eigen auto te onderhouden en zijn er leuke uitjes met je collega’s. Pas jij op het hoofdkantoor van Broekhuis en wil je je inzetten voor onze klanten? Kom ons team versterken als Data Analist!

title: Data Analist
description: . Als BI analist haal jij inzichten uit enorme hoeveelheden data die de Tech teams en het Tech management team in staat stellen om data gedreven beslissingen te maken. Jouw nieuwe baan en werkplek. Je maakt deel uit van het Portfolio Analytics team met twee andere analisten. De rol is een mix van het gebruik van jouw technische vaardigheden om gegevens te verzamelen en te analyseren, stakeholder management en het presenteren van informatie op een zinvolle manier. Je hebt veel interactie met verschillende belanghebbenden zoals managers, agile leads en product owners. Je daagt hen uit en legt onze (complexe) bevindingen op een eenvoudige manier uit. Het Portfolio Analytics team maakt deel uit van het grotere Portfolio Management team, dat bestaat uit een groep van 12 jonge, ambitieuze en enthousiaste collega's waarmee je nauw samenwerkt. Samen ondersteunen we het Tech-leiderschapsteam voor de merken Albert Heijn, Etos en Gall & Gall bij het beheren van hun portfolio en het volgen van hun prestaties. In deze functie werk je 40 uur per week, deels vanuit ons hoofdkantoor in Zaandam en deels vanuit huis. Dit ga je als BI analist bij ons doen. Je biedt waardevolle inzichten aan het Tech-management team en helpt verschillende Tech-teams beter te presteren door verschillende datasets te analyseren en verbeterpunten te identificeren. Je creëert interactieve Power BI dashboards die voldoen aan de behoeften van jouw stakeholders. Je ontwikkelt data pipelines die kunnen worden gebruikt door Power BI. Je werkt samen met collega's aan structurele oplossingen en geautomatiseerde analyses. Je gebruikt nieuwe analysemethoden en gegevensbronnen om waardevolle inzichten te ontdekken en deze om te zetten in experimenten voor innovatieve toepassingen. Je betrekt jouw stakeholders bij het data-analyse proces om nuttige inzichten en zakelijke impact te delen. We vinden het belangrijk dat jij bij Albert Heijn jezelf kunt zijn in een omgeving die openstaat voor verschillende perspectieven, een omgeving waarin we nieuwsgierig zijn en elkaar waarderen. Voor deze functie zoeken we bij voorkeur iemand die de diversiteit in ons team, in de breedste zin van het woord, versterkt. Iemand die vanuit eigen achtergrond en persoonlijke eigenschappen een ander geluid brengt en daarmee een goede aanvulling is op ons team. Dit bieden we jou. We betalen je inzet terug met een bruto jaarsalaris tussen 49k en 65k - afhankelijk van je ervaring. Dit bedrag is inclusief 8% vakantiegeld. Je werkt mee aan onze groei en ontvangt daarom een gegarandeerde winstuitkering. Je kunt 45 (ja, vijf-en-veertig) dagen met vakantie: je krijgt 25,5 vaste vakantiedagen en 19,5 ADV-dagen. Een uitstekende pensioenregeling bij het Ahold Delhaize Pensioenfonds Een reiskostenvergoeding of NS-trajectkaart om van en naar Zaandam te reizen. 10% korting op je boodschappen bij Albert Heijn, tot maximaal €300 per jaar. Een Mijn Albert Heijn Premium abonnement met vele voordelen; Via onze Albert Heijn Deals ontvang je exclusieve kortingen op leuke uitjes en producten van grote merken. Een inclusieve omgeving waarin je op persoonlijk en vakinhoudelijk vlak continu kan blijven ontwikkelen. Dit breng je mee. Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding, bij voorkeur op het gebied van IT/data analyse/business intelligence Een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal. Ervaring met stakeholders management en advies geven aan hen. Ongeveer 2-3 jaar werkervaring als BI-analist, data engineer of een vergelijkbare rol; Aantoonbare kennis en ervaring van data-analyse en het presenteren van resultaten. Bij voorkeur op het gebied van portfoliomanagement, projectmanagement, agile ontwikkeling en financiële processen; Ervaring met visualisatietools zoals Power BI Ervaring in het maken van data pipelines met behulp van Python/Pyspark/SQL Kennis van Excel/Powerquery/DAX is een pluspunt; Ervaring met tools zoals ServiceNow, Jira, Github, Databricks is een pre. Ervaring in een corporate omgeving, retail organisatie of met een online platform is een pluspunt; Daarnaast ben je: Proactief en geef je zowel gevraagd als ongevraagd advies Sterk in het adviseren van de business en het betrekken van stakeholders. Communicatief vaardig; je weet complexe informatie uit te leggen aan een niet-technisch publiek. Een echte teamspeler met een innovatieve mindset. Samen beter eten bereikbaar maken. Voor iedereen. Bij Albert Heijn geloven we dat eten en drinken een essentiële rol speelt bij de grote uitdagingen in de maatschappij. Het levert een belangrijke bijdrage aan een gezonde levensstijl, het verbindt mensen en draagt bij aan een beter klimaat en daarmee een duurzame samenleving. Onze missie is dan ook: Samen beter eten bereikbaar maken. Voor iedereen. Ben jij er klaar voor om deze missie samen waar te maken? Klik op de sollicitatiebutton om te solliciteren. Dat kan ook als je nét niet alle artikelen van ons boodschappenlijstje in huis hebt. Wil je liever eerst meer weten? Neem contact met ons op! . Solliciteren Stuur je sollicitatie in via deze website. Gesprek Als je aan het profiel voldoet nodigen we je snel uit voor een gesprek in de winkel. Mogelijkheden Samen bekijken we de mogelijkheden voor jou in de winkel zoals de verschillende werktijden en welke plek het beste bij je past. Welkom! Zijn we allebei enthousiast? Dan kun je snel beginnen! Welkom. We vragen Een aanpakkersmentaliteit Een verbindend karakter Oog voor detail

title: Data Scientist
description: Dit ga je doen Weet jij als geen ander trends en patronen te ontdekken in onze (klant)data of ben jij een ster met time-series forecasting of ML modellen om het assortiment goed te verdelen? Dan zoeken we jou om ons Data Science team te versterken! Als Data Scientist ben je onderdeel van het Data Analytics team voor Kruidvat (Nederland en België) en Trekpleister. Samen met de andere Data Scientists en collega’s uit het team (Data Consultants, Data Analisten en Data Engineers) werk je aan uiteenlopende projecten op het gebied van forecasting, logistieke planning, assortiment optimalisatie, e-commerce en CRM. Door het ontwikkelen van slimme data-oplossingen ben je in staat de interne klant te helpen met concrete inzichten of adviezen op basis van jouw algoritme of analyse. Als grootste Health & Beauty retailer in de Benelux hebben we een schat aan data die we kunnen gebruiken. Elke week worden we bezocht door meer dan 4 miljoen klanten in onze ruim 1500 winkels en op de webshops. Ruim de helft van onze klanten is lid van de Kruidvat Club waardoor we onze klant steeds beter leren kennen. Wat ga je doen in de functie van Data Scientist? Je ontwikkelt data science oplossingen in Databricks en Azure die de business handvatten geeft om direct bij te kunnen sturen. Je ontwikkelt predictive- en prescriptive-modellen met grote, gecombineerde datasets. Hierbij werk je samen met je directe collega’s, maar ook met je collega’s van CRM, Inkoop, Marketing en eCommerce. IT is hierbij je beste vriend. Samen brengen jullie de oplossing tot leven. Je denkt mee en draagt actief bij aan de ontwikkeling van onze technologie en tooling dmv het ontwikkelen van bijvoorbeeld een utility package of het verder ontwikkelen van MLOps methodiek. Je blijft mee ontwikkelen op de innovaties binnen data science en stelt vast hoe we hiermee invulling kunnen geven aan onze ambities. Als organisatie investeren we fors in het neerzetten van een state-of-the-art analytics landschap. Als Data Scientist word jij binnen A.S. Watson Benelux (o.a. Kruidvat, Trekpleister) gezien als expert en dé aangewezen persoon om naar toe te gaan met vragen over modellen en statistiek. Solliciteer snel en 'become part of more'! Dit krijg je ervoor terug Een snelle omgeving waarin je veel kunt leren. En werkplezier door verantwoordelijkheid, vrijheid en de ruimte om jezelf te ontplooien. #bepartofmore Best belangrijk: een goed salaris! Afhankelijk van jouw ervaring en opleiding start je tussen de € 4.300,- en € 6.500,- bruto per maand bij een 40-urige werkweek. Plus personeelskorting bij Kruidvat, Trekpleister en ICI PARIS XL! 24 vakantiedagen en een aantrekkelijke ATV-regeling met 19,5 dagen op fulltime basis. Liever meer vrije tijd of extra geld? Koop of verkoop vakantiedagen of laat je ATV (deels) uitbetalen. Volop ontwikkelings- en doorgroeimogelijkheden met onze eigen A.S. Watson Academy. Bij A.S. Watson sta je nooit stil. Goede thuiswerkmogelijkheden. Hybride werken is bij ons heel gewoon en gaat altijd in goed overleg. Gemiddeld zul je 3 dagen op kantoor zijn. Dit ben jij Je hebt een afgeronde opleiding op WO-niveau. Je bent MSc op kwantitatief vlak, bijvoorbeeld Econometrie, AI, Statistiek, Wiskunde, etc. Je hebt minimaal 4 jaar ervaring als Data Scientist. Je expertise ligt bij SQL en diverse Python packages zoals Pandas en SciKit-learn. Je hebt ervaring met het in productie zetten van modellen Werken in scrums in Jira is je bekend. Kennis van Databricks, Azure of PySpark is een pre, evenals basis kennis van BI tools als Tableau of BO. Je ben in staat om met overtuiging je (technische) werk en de uitkomsten helder uit te leggen aan de interne klant. Verder vind je het leuk om met je collega Data Scientist te sparren over mogelijke oplossingen, PRs op te pakken en mee te helpen aan de verdere professionalisering van onze afdeling. Je werkt netjes en gestructureerd en werken met Git is business as usual. Omdat je internationale contacten hebt, beheers je naast het Nederlands ook het Engels goed in woord en geschrift.

title: Senior Manager
description: The work As a Senior Manager in Artificial Intelligence you will have a 70% focus on client advisory and project delivery and a 30% focus on pre-sales, using thought leadership to co-create, shape and sell new offerings to our clients. People You have experience leading and managing a team of data scientists, ML engineers, and other AI professionals. Ability to build and maintain relationships with clients, stakeholders, and partners. Process You gained deep knowledge of project management methodologies and frameworks and have the ability to oversee projects from inception to delivery while managing timelines, budgets, and resources. Technology You have a strong understanding of the field of Artificial intelligence, for example in the fields of machine learning, deep learning, and natural language processing technologies. You know the benefits of each and can also explain differences between the many available platforms. With all our roles, there is some in-person time for collaboration, learning and building relationships with clients, peers, leaders, and communities. As an employer, we will be as flexible as possible to support your specific work/life needs. Who we are Through unmatched industry experience, leading technologies from our ecosystem partners and startups, and the largest delivery network in the world, we provide a powerful range of capabilities that can be tailored to our client’s most complex business needs. With over 100 innovation hubs deployed around the world, we help clients continuously innovate at speed and at scale so they can outpace their peers. You will bring innovation, intelligence, and industry experience together with the newest technologies to help clients innovate at scale and transform their businesses. Technology is one of five services that make up one Accenture – the others are Strategy & Consulting, Operations, Song and Industry X. #LI-EU Here’s what you’ll need Thought Leader You have a clear vision on Data & AI, what direction the capability will move towards and are able to share this vision to both your colleagues and our clients. Business Translator You are able to identify and build a vision on business problems, initiative, analytics intervention, data scientist management, data science interpretation and storytelling. Data & Analytics Transformation You have experience with setting up current state assessment, operating models, value case, roadmap, and blueprint in the Data & AI landscape. You are an expert in the following technologies : programming/scripting languages like Python, R, and SQL You are familiar with big data tools like Spark, PySpark Knowledge of natural language processing (NLP) technologies like spaCy, NLTK, and CoreNLP. Experience with frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, and Keras. Experience with computer vision libraries like OpenCV and Dlib. Knowledge of Bayesian networks and decision trees. Familiair with hyperscaler offerings and 3rd party technologies: AzureML, Vertex.AI, AWS Sagemaker, Databricks Bonus points if you have You have worked for 5+ years in a consulting capacity or project management type roles. Experience in a sales capacity is a plus. Experience with GenerativeAI implementations You are fluent in Dutch and English (both spoken and written). You have experience with data acquisition, ingestion, and pre-processing for AI projects and know what it takes to design, implement and manage data pipelines for large-scale AI projects. What’s in it for you? Accenture is a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Our people are Change Makers, and to support them as an employer, we make five promises: Work with flexibility, in a culture based on trust Embrace a sustainable growth mindset Live a human-led culture of Inclusion & Diversity by caring deeply for all our people. Lead and transform our clients with technology Connect with our global network of 700.000 colleagues. These promises are reflected through our excellent employee benefits, including: Flexible working hours (4x9) & work location, FlexMoment leave of absence program (50% paid leave of absence for 3 months) and FlexDay; a flexible day you can take off to celebrate what matters to you – from EidalFitr to a birthday. Paid leave: Parental leave, Partner leave for all non-birthing parents, Bereavement leave, and Gender affirmation leave. Paid transport (budget for electric bicycle or car, NS-Business card) Pension scheme, Accenture shares, annual bonus, collective health insurance scheme Social activities like Friday Drinks, sport events and parties What we believe Accenture is an equal opportunity employer. Our leaders are committed to building a better, stronger and more equitable company for future generations to create positive, long-lasting change. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities. Our position as partner to many of the world’s leading businesses, organizations and governments affords us both an extraordinary opportunity and a tremendous responsibility to make a difference. Sustainability is one of our greatest responsibilities, which we embed it into everything we do and for everyone we work with. Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all. Please let us know if you require reasonable accommodation to enable your participation in the recruitment process by emailing ezra.lammers@accenture.com. We will be happy to assist you.

title: Platform Engineer
description: South Pole is an energetic, global company offering comprehensive sustainability solutions and services. With offices spanning all continents across the globe, we strive to create a sustainable society and economy that positively impacts our climate, ecosystems and developing communities. With our solutions, we inspire and enable our customers to create value from sustainability-related activities. Our Corporate Functions team is the “enablement engine” of South Pole. Behind the scenes, we provide the business with world-class solutions and best practices that sustain business growth and success. We cover key areas such as Finance, HR, Office Management, Legal, IT, Operations, etc. If you are a smart, ambitious and dynamic professional with a strong passion to make a real difference in the fight against climate change, the below position may be right for you! Job summary: At South Pole, we are on a mission to drive sustainability through data-driven insights. As a rapidly expanding global company, we are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Data Platform Engineer to join our dynamic team. This role is pivotal in developing and maintaining scalable data pipelines, enabling us to extract valuable insights across the business Main tasks & responsibilities: As a Senior Data Platform Engineer, you will be a key player in our Data team within Technology, reporting directly to the Head of Data. Your responsibilities include: Manage the Google Cloud Platform : Airflow, BigQuery, PySpark and Infrastructure as a Code (preferably Pulumi). Developing Scalable Data Pipelines : Design, build, and continuously improve data pipelines and structured datasets to support analysis by data analysts and BI developers. Organizational Data Infrastructure : Design, document and build the organizational data infrastructure and architecture, contributing to the overall data governance and management policies. Data Analysis and Organization : Analyze and organize raw data from all core enterprise systems (Salesforce, ERP, HR etc.), meta data from unstructured data sources (Google Drive, PowerBI etc.) and external data sources (carbon registries, emission factors, external carbon credit data etc.). Enhancing Data Quality : Explore and implement strategies to enhance data quality and reliability. Including ongoing monitoring and maintenance, ensuring that as a business we are adopting best practices. Collaboration : Work closely with BI developers, software engineers, and the DevOps team to support the generation of scalable and repeatable insights from data. Enthusiasm for working in a rapidly expanding global company in the sustainability sector. Essential - Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field. Proven experience working with cloud infrastructure Proven experience in data engineering with a focus on developing and maintaining scalable data pipelines. Strong analytical skills and attention to detail. Proficiency in working with structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data. Familiarity with data governance and management policies. Experience with business requirements gathering for data sourcing Strong communication and collaboration skills. Desirable - Have experience working with Google Cloud infrastructure and Salesforce Experience working with DevOps and MLOps technologies Enthusiasm for working in a rapidly expanding global company in the sustainability sector. What we offer: At South Pole, we care about our employees as much as we care about the planet. South Pole is not just an employer, we are a Team. South Pole does not just offer people a job, we offer you a career. By joining our team, you will find strong purpose and deep meaning in everything you do. You will have the chance to make a real difference for our clients and for the planet, working alongside a passionate team of like-minded colleagues, while building your knowledge/skills and developing your career in a fun, dynamic, international and fast-growing organisation. We’re a planet of 7.5 billion unique and different people. We all have a contribution to make and South Pole is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, national origin, marital status or disability. Our recruitment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit and business need.

title: Data Scientist
description: Salaris €3.500 - €4.500 Uren per week 36 - 40 uur Opleiding HBO/WO Locatie Randstad Voertaal Nederlands Dare to be Bright! Medior Data Scientist Ben jij thuis in de wereld van data? Als geen ander weet jij dat een bedrijf tegenwoordig niet anders meer kan dan data in te zetten, erop te acteren en vooruit te lopen op het gebied van data. Durf jij te verdwalen om nieuwe wegen te ontdekken? Doe jij liever dingen anders voor betere resultaten? Loop je liever voorop dan dat je volgt? Welkom bij BrightStone Group. Bij ons ga je op ontdekkingsreis. Elke (werk) dag weer. Je toont lef en neemt initiatief. Hierbij mag je fouten maken zolang je er maar van leert. Dat noemen wij ondernemerschap. Ben jij nieuwsgierig? Mooi! Als Medior Data Scientist ga je aan de slag met het verzamelen, analyseren en interpreteren van data. Dit vraagt om een uitgebreide set aan vaardigheden. Zo dien je niet alleen te beschikken over analytisch vermogen, maar wordt ook van je verwacht dat je inzichten uit de data over kunt brengen aan het management. Als Medior Data Scientist wordt jouw expertise namelijk ingezet om complexe zaken vakkundig te doorgronden. Je bent een sparringpartner voor het senior management rondom het verbeteren en automatiseren van bestaande processen Wat ga je doen? Het analyseren en structureren van databronnen door de inzet van nieuwe technologie; Analyses op diverse databronnen die tot nieuwe inzichten en patronen leiden; Het bedenken en uitvoeren van technische oplossingen voor verschillende onderdelen van de organisatie (procesoptimalisatie en of automatisering); Je bent betrokken bij het bouwen en valideren van (voorspellende) modellen; Het actief meedenken bij de vertaling van data vraagstukken naar technische oplossingen; Het eventueel coachen en opleiden van Junior Data Scientisten. Hier mag je op rekenen Een bruto maandsalaris van minimaal € 3.500 tot maximaal € 4.500; Een uitdagend tailor made leerpad; 1-op-1-begeleiding en career counseling door een fieldmanager; Toegang tot de Bright Academy en een online leeromgeving; Een laptop en telefoon; 22,5 vakantiedagen op basis van 36 uur; Een contract van een jaar met als doel bij goed functioneren een contract voor onbepaalde tijd; Doorgroeimogelijkheden naar bijvoorbeeld posities als Senior data Scientist, Data Modeller, of Data engineer of eventueel zelfs een leidinggevende positie. Ons sollicitatie proces Bij BrightStone Group geen maandenlange, ingewikkelde procedures. We reageren uiterlijk twee dagen na jouw sollicitatie en maken graag snel kennis met je! Heb je vragen of wil je meer weten over deze vacature? Melle van Gaal kan jou op weg helpen Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze vacature wordt niet op prijs gesteld Dit neem je mee Een universitaire opleiding afgerond. Denk hierbij aan opleiding als Econometrie, Informatica, Quantitative Finance, Machine Learning, Kunstmatige Intelligentie, Wiskunde, Statistiek of een verwante kwantitatieve opleiding; Ten minste 2 jaar werkervaring met (voorspellende) analysemethoden, machine learning technieken en of modelling; Ervaring met één of meerdere programmeertalen, bijvoorbeeld: SQL, Python, R of Scala, PySpark; Kennis van visualisatie tools, bijvoorbeeld Tableau of Microsoft PowerBI; Een goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal, zowel mondeling als in geschrifte. Dare to be Bright! Weten waar je het over hebt. Dare to Grow! Maak je ambities waar. Dare to be Explore Ontdek de ondernemer in jezelf. Dare to be Different! Een open blik naar de toekomst. Je weet wat je wilt. Je bent ambitieus, gedreven en klaar voor de toekomst. BrightStone Group is de dynamische organisatie waar jouw talent tot zijn recht komt. Wij bieden je een carrière vol groei, de opleidingen om je talenten verder te ontwikkelen en horen graag wat jij te zeggen hebt. Bij BrightStone Group gaan we geen uitdaging uit de weg en zijn we gedreven door ambitie. We kijken niet naar waar je vandaan komt, maar waar je naartoe wilt. Werk mee aan de meest uiteenlopende projecten voor de grote namen in een inclusieve organisatie waar er ruimte is voor nieuwe ideeën. Over Brightstone BrightStone Group is een jonge, dynamische en snelgroeiende consultancy organisatie in Finance, Risk, Data, CDD en Compliance. Wij helpen grote financiële instellingen en snelgroeiende internationale organisaties hun ambitie om te zetten in resultaat.

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description: Is this you? You love to solve real world problems with data & algorithms. You can bridge the gap between Data Scientists, Data Engineers & DevOps. And you are highly motivated to create valuable solutions for our customers with the latest machine learning, cloud and MLOps technologies. Your role As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer at Future Facts Conclusion you are at the center of productionizing our AI solutions. You will coach, train and lead the team on the latest innovations in ML. You will orchestrate data pipelines for model training and prediction, industrialize and train ML algorithms and build high performance, low latency API’s. You will do this in close co-operation with Data Scientists, Data Engineers and other stakeholders and will have the lead in code reviews and pair programming sessions. Therefore, it is key that your knowledge of code and CI/CD best practices is solid. You will work on different ML projects with a wide range of topics. Projects we have done in the past include topics like; package return prediction for a logistics company, fraud detection for an insurance company and subscription cancel prediction for a telecom company. Depending on the projects you will work either on site or remote. Since most of our clients work in agile, DevOps and cloud environments, we have adapted this into our standards. A few examples At Dura Vermeer, a smart building concept has been set up in Azure by means of AI & IoT, in which occupancy rate and atmosphere are calculated and processed in real time. This is crucial for the health of the company's employees. For a large waste processor we use computer vision and camera-wide inspection to detect the different waste flows and to find out how they can be optimized for processing. A gross salary between €4.000,- and - €6.000,- o.b.v. 40h Bonus package, a phone and laptop are of course included Mobility budget, a private internet plan and a general expenses allowance. A learning and development budget and a personal development scheme. A steady job in a company that has over 24 years of expertise in data. A young and ambitious team of data fanatics to share knowledge with. A flexible workspace where you can organize your work-life balance just the way you like it. Our very own Danz Café with a roof terrace and lots of team events where you can socialize with your colleagues. Weekly chair massage, a gym with personal training and a company longboat to go out onto the Amsterdam canals. What you need As a Senior Machine Learning Engineer, Machine Learning infrastructure is something you know everything about. Besides that, it is mandatory that you can communicate complex concepts and make them understandable for other disciplines, both technical and non-technical. To do this you need to be a team player and have excellent communication skills. English speakers are welcome to apply, but you need to be able to understand Dutch to some extend and have the willingness to learn it. Our ideal candidate would look like this: A MSc or PhD in e.g. Computer Science or other STEM related fields, and experience as a Machine Learning- or Software Engineer Experience with ML frameworks like Tensorflow, PyTorch, etc. preferably on large scale projects Deep understanding of Machine Learning and Deep Learning related concepts Hands on programming skills in Python, experience with API design and the DevOps and CI/CD way of working Knowledge of big data processing tools, platforms and infrastructures such as Spark, PySpark, Kafka, AWS EMR, Databricks Linux, Docker, Kubernetes (nice to have), Experience with Cloud frameworks like AWS, Azure or GCP Experience with both SQL and NoSQL Anything else you’d like to add? Your Future Facts Conclusion? With a skilled and ambitious team of 40+ data professionals you will work on projects for new and existing clients all over the Netherlands where you will implement valuable AI solutions. We actively pursue projects in many different sectors. A few examples of our clients are PostNL, IKEA, ANWB, VodafoneZiggo and NS. Our data engineers and data scientists focus on productionizing valuable machine learning & AI solutions, and developing and deploying Machine Learning models. Every project is different, and therefore needs a different approach. With your team, you will determine the most efficient approach, and the appropriate tooling for each project. Your expertise and seniority makes you the perfect advisor on how to implement the solutions.

title: Analytics Consultant
description: Company Description Sia Partners is a specialist Management Consulting firm created in 1999 and has grown into a global firm with approximately 2800 employees and annual revenue exceeding $400m. Our culture is strongly orientated towards high-quality expertise and delivering excellent results and outcomes for our clients, which include a wide range of multinational companies. Our global presence and our expertise in more than 40 sectors and services allows us to accompany clients worldwide. Using innovative technologies such as our own in-house apps, social networks, and digital tools, we provide a truly integrated global service. Through Consulting for Good, we put our expertise at the service of our clients' climate objectives and make sustainable development a performance lever for our clients. Our portfolio of offerings is cross-sectors and 17 % of our revenue is generated from engagements with a CSR focus. Job Description Who will you be working with? The Amsterdam Data Science team is young, diverse and growing. You will work in a team that challenges you and invests in your professional development. We have a flat structure and rely on the entrepreneurial spirit of our colleagues. Taking the initiative is strongly encouraged. We strive for well-being, diversity and knowledge sharing within the team, so that we can grow together. What you are going to do As a Data & Analytics Consultant, you will work with our Data Scientists, Data Engineers and other consultants at Sia Partners Global, on various client projects in multidisciplinary teams. You will use your analytical mindset and data skills to solve complex business problems and deliver actionable insights. Responsibilities include: Work closely with SIA consultants on assignments with an analytical challenge Identify business problems by extracting, interpreting and explaining insights from data Develop statistical and analytical methods to solve specific operational problems Ensure that the deep insights generated from advanced analytics translate into business impact Present results and conduct workshops at customer sites Who you are You want to make business impact, not only by doing data analysis, but also by making recommendations through inspiring presentations You have the ability to adapt quickly and work across different business areas within a challenging environment You have exceptional analytical and quantitative problem solving skills You have the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment You have excellent communication skills and can present complex concepts in a synthetic way You have a good track record of leadership in an academic, professional or extracurricular setting. Qualifications What you need Completed WO Master's degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Business Analytics or a related field of study. You are a young graduate or already have several years of experience in a similar position. Good skills in Python and at least one other analytical language (e.g. R, SQL) Experience with data visualization and reporting (e.g. Tableau, Power BI) Knowledge of Machine Learning techniques or optimization is a strong plus Fluent in English and Dutch, both written and oral. Additional languages are a strong plus. What we offer Training opportunities to develop yourself further Opportunities to work on international assignments Flexible working hours A meritocratic approach to promotion Performance related bonus An attractive package (e.g. lease car, health insurance, pension scheme) Additional Information We are unable to provide a work permit for this position Non-Dutch speaker will no be accepted Sia Partners is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

title: Working Student Data & Smart Automation
description: Job Description & Summary Do you have a passion for working with data and do you have an innovative mindset to translate results into specific solutions for clients using applied technology? If so, come and join our fun team! PwC's Smart Automation & Quantitative Solutions team consists of approximately 20 professionals of many different nationalities. A diverse team with extensive knowledge of data management, data visualization, data science, automation, accountancy and taxation. A team that deals with clients' digital transformation issues on a daily basis and works extensively with different teams within PwC, serving clients all over the world. Ensuring data and applied technology work for us and our clients! What does the work involve? We are looking for data-driven working students for our Data & Smart Automation activities. As a Smart Automation & Quantitative Solutions specialist, you will: Support other teams within PwC regarding ledger, VAT, payroll and payment data analyses; Engage with clients and support them in obtaining a data extract from the ERP system, transforming it into the correct format so that it can eventually be used as useful information in an analysis tool; In addition, you will be the point of contact for the teams within PwC for issues they may have regarding this data; You think of how you can optimize data processes with applied technology; You think of the best way to visualize the data so that management information can be retrieved. Who are you? We are looking for inquisitive and enthusiastic working students who like to explore specific applications of technology and who are real team players. You are the ideal candidate if: you take a hands-on approach and like working with data; you have good communication skills; you have an excellent command of Dutch and English, both written and spoken; you have a university background in accountancy, economics, business economics, taxation or higher professional business IT & management or computer science. What are we offering? We believe in the power of an inclusive culture and we want everyone to feel free to be themselves. We offer access to the PwC global network, where you can exchange knowledge, ideas, and questions with other experienced professionals regarding automation a nd also other disciplines. We also offer you: training sessions and courses that contribute to your personal and professional development; hybrid working at the client, at home, and at the office; an attractive allowance and laptop from PwC; a coach to help you make your working studentship a success; enjoyable informal activities, including drinks get-togethers and other informal activities; You'll also automatically become a member of Young PwC: YoungPwC gives young employees the opportunity to network and exchange knowledge and experience. Colleagues' experience and tips greatly benefit young PwC professionals and help them achieve their ambitions within PwC. Getting started at PwC If all this gets you enthusiastic, then let us have your questionnaire answers, gradelist and CV explaining why you’re applying and why you’re the right person for this position. Click on the red button and apply immediately! After we’ve received your application, You’ll immediately receive confirmation in your inbox. If your qualifications match this position, then we’ll contact you within two weeks for a short introduction meeting. If everyone is enthusiastic, we’ll schedule an online assessment. Depending on the result, you'll receive an invitation for an initial interview. Click here for more information about the application process. If you would like more detailed information about the position of Working student Data & Smart automation at PwC, don't hesitate to contact us! Hugo Verdonk will be happy to help you by phone, e-mail, or WhatsApp. Hugo Verdonk hugo.verdonk@pwc.com +31 06 484 557 42 #LI-HV2

title: Analytics Intern
description: 23-10-2023 ~ Tim Bruines Sensible Sensible is a Dutch Med-tech company working on giving continuous biosensing the economical accesibility, data integrability, and user attractiveness it needs to become feasible for population- scale applications. This is essential to keep chronic disease treatment affordable, and enable better treatment especially in earlier stages where it can have its largest preventative value. Our first product is a single-microneedle based continuous glucose monitor (CGM). To ensure we make the most of our highly specific sensing system, we are looking for an intern or thesis student to work on our existing glucose prediction and sensor data analysis algorithms and software libraries. If you would like to work with data gathered from testers of our sensor, and directly work on a product that makes life easier for them with your data analytics skills, this position would be a great fit for you! The following skills and experience are expected: Experience with the following software technologies: Python Pandas PipEnv PyTest C++ (optional, will be a great help) Dotnet Core (optional) Experience with software development and automated testing is a big plus. Data intake, cleaning, and visualization Experience with patient contact (optional) The position is envisioned as (near) full-time (36-40hrs per week) with the following main responsibilities: Helping our software engineers gather and analyze sensor data. Extending and maintaining our sensor analysis software repository. Implementing and testing new algorithmic improvements based on your research findings. The position takes place in Delft, and has flexibility for 3-4 remote working days. We offer a competitive reimbursement with benefits such as a learning plan and travel cost allowance. Please apply to the position on https://sensible.health/careers with your CV, cover letter/motivation and your earliest availability date included if you’d like to learn more and/or apply to join us on our mission to make continuous biosensing available for everyone!

title: Data Science Intern
description: You have analyzed data during your study and you’ve predicted the future with multiple Machine Learning models. But you know that there is a difference between theory and practice and between the academic world and industry. You therefore want to gain experience what it’s like to work as a Data Scientist at a fast-paced start-up – and earn some money too. If this is the case, then you’ve come to the right place! About Apeiron Insight Apeiron Insight is a data-driven research & analytics company, providing data products and insights to investment companies. We use predictive modelling to deliver actionable intelligence to the biggest sharks in the tank. Apeiron Insight is growing fast. We are hiring for several roles in multiple disciplines to scale up our operation. Your role with us For a couple of months you will work as a Data Scientist/Statistician at a fast moving start-up. You will get your own research project to get insights out of our data; preferably insights that we can sell to our clients! We are happy to work things around other academic obligations. You will be part of the Data Science team. It’s a small team of 5 people, which has the advantage that you will be in close contact with your colleagues, helping them (and learning from them) when you can. Apeiron will provide clear training in terms of the understanding of the raw data, the data engineering process including the algorithms logic and the initial Data Science efforts already implemented. What else will you do? The exact project you will work on will be determined by us, together with you. Some possibilities include: Selecting features for a classifier and then building and optimizing it using machine learning techniques. Analyzing big graphs with novel techniques. Extending the company’s data with third party sources of information. Processing, cleansing, and verifying the integrity of data used for analysis. Performing data analysis, extracting new insights and presenting results in a clear manner. What are we looking for? A student of a study with a heavy emphasis on data analysis and data science. Can be Data Science, Computer Science, Quantitative Psychology, Physics, Mathematics or a related study. Good understanding of machine learning techniques and algorithms. Good programming skills. Familiarity in using Python and/or R. Experience with data visualization tools. A self-starter willing to thrive in a start-up environment, who is interested in working in a high pace, high visibility organization. Experience with Bayesian Probabilistic Programming library (or language) such as PyMC, Stan or Pyro would be a nice to have. Experience analyzing big graphs is a nice to have too. You are living in the Netherlands, either studying or taking a break. You are legally allowed to work in the Netherlands. You are able to come to our lovely office in Rijswijk twice a week, or more. What we offer? This is your chance to join a dynamic data company where you’ll be part of a very ambitious and smart team on a mission. You’ll get all the benefits of working for an agile scale-up such as a relaxed work environment, the possibility to work from home part of the time, easy-going colleagues and freedom in your work. Additionally, we offer you: A competitive internship compensation. Lunch on us! On the job training & coaching to further develop your Data Science skillset & capabilities. Sounds like you? Let us know. Please submit your resume and motivation letter.

title: Data Engineer
description: We love to see people grow. We empower our product teams, farmers, dealers & suppliers to move forward. Driving the digital future of Kramp Group by discovering and building great products, making life easy for our customers. Kramp Group discovers and builds e-commerce, supply chain & data science solutions that are aimed at giving the ag-tech industry a push forward. We’re building a digital platform, serving thousands of customers, and generating a turnover of over one billion euros per year. Our Data vision is to provide a centralized entry point for data to be used on self-service platforms that unlock the full potential of Data for Kramp Group, ensuring data accessibility, quality, and value generation across all departments in a unified way. The mission of a Data Engineer role is to accelerate the rollout of our Cloud Data Warehouse and make an impact on how data and technology are used to provide next-generation tools to an organization. You will be part of Data Office which is an international cross-functional team, combining: Data Governance; BI Development; Software Development; Data Science. The team is in the transformation from an on-premise data warehouse to a Google Cloud Platform-based data warehouse (DWH). This DWH builds the foundation of Kramp's self-service analytics platform feeding different targets as: Data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau); Data-driven e-commerce applications; Kramp's Machine Learning platform. What we offer: The Data Office is international, and cross-functional team, combining Business Intelligence, Pricing Management, Data Science, and Software Development; Working within Agile SCRUM Methodologies and the Atlassian toolchain (JIRA, Confluence, Bitbucket, Git); To build our state-of-the-art cloud data warehouse, we use Python, Java, BigQuery SQL, other Google Cloud Platform services such as Cloud Build, Data transfers, Workflows, Schedulers and Functions; Making use of Dataform, Terraform & CDKTF and Data Modelling Tools; You will get deep insights into the work at an international wholesaler being in the middle of the digital transformation, you can contribute and make a real impact; And a lot of freedom to initiate new ideas and develop these further. Some facts about us: We follow the philosophy of "You build it, you own it, you love it." We believe in empowering individuals to take control of their own growth, with guidance provided. Our colleagues come from 66 different countries, creating an inclusive and open-minded environment. Transparent environment, mature management team with clear vision and specific goals, and open to feedback. Kramp Group is a healthy and financially stable company. What else we bring to the table: 25 vacation days and 12 ATV days (based on a full time contract). Flexible working policy in hours and location (with offices in Utrecht and Varsseveld). Travel and working from home allowance. Profit sharing bonus. Learning budget for training and courses to support your growth ambitions. Generous pension plan. Who are you? Openness to engage in continuous learning and agility in addressing business challenges; Experience in designing, developing, documenting, and maintaining software written in Python and/or Java as well as dataflows written in SQL; Knowledge of different Data Modelling principles and selecting the right one depending on the needs of a consumer; Feeling comfortable working with Linux, git, and Docker to extend and maintain our CI/CD workflows and pipelines or are you eager to dive into this topic; Experience in working in cloud environments (preferably GCP or AWS); Experience or knowledge of Infrastructure-as-Code applications like Terraform and data transformation tools as dbt and Dataform; Cultural awareness, sensitivity, and adaptability in building connections with people from diverse backgrounds; Excel conceptual thinking and a proactive approach to decision-making, taking ownership to ensure project success. Who are we? Thanks to our ambitions we are active throughout Europe: a leading position in the agricultural market for parts. We heavily invest in E-Business and supply chain innovations. Our aim is to make it easy for our customers to run their business. Working at Kramp means working with over 3500 international colleagues. The people at Kramp are enthusiastic, professional and involved. We speak our customers’ language, understand their challenges and earn their trust to exceed their expectations. Our promise “It’s that easy” is embedded in our culture and DNA. Working at Kramp means … you belong here! Being part of our open business community … your work makes a difference! Have an impact on what matters … you will develop and realize! Learn and realize your potential More about Kramp: https://www.careeratkramp.com/nl-nl Procedure and contact Do you see yourself in this role but don't hit every requirement? That's okay! Apply anyway. This is a great chance for you to grow and learn. Don't hesitate to reach out to Julia Bodun julia@kramphub.com if you have any questions. N.B. External recruiters/agencies we'd appreciate it if you'd let us reach out to you if we need help. At the moment, this is not the case. Utrecht (NL) Varsseveld (NL)

title: Data Consultant
description: Your Impact As a Data Visualization Consultant, you’ll help our clients solve complex data issues. You’ll collect data from various sources, optimize datasets for visualization and develop insightful and user-friendly dashboards. Using your own expertise and the Ordina design-thinking methodology, you’ll increase the quality of reporting and visualizations at our customers. The “actionable insights” from the reports and visualizations help the customers make the right strategic, tactical and operational decisions. In addition to the valuable contribution you make to the client, your input contributes to the vision and development of the practice and the unit. Where you're going to get started We create sustainable value for our clients through data within our Data area. We help companies stay agile while in transition by making data and technology part of both daily operations and strategic decision-making. We use data to help our clients stay ahead of change. Our ambition is to help organizations excel with data. The area consists of five practices: Data Governance and Data Management, Data Visualization, Data Science and AI, Data Engineering and Data Migrations, and Spatial Intelligence. Each with a distinct focus on content and the right solution. Over 170 professionals work in a content practice that is a logical fit for them. We believe in the power of multidisciplinary teams. Your expertise, personal ambitions and customer requirements are the basis for the composition of our High Performance Teams. You’ll become an indispensable link in a team of professionals so together you can all bring out the best in each other. Everyone contributes from their own expertise and technology so we all keep learning from each other and no one is ever alone. And you get to build cool Data Visualization solutions with your Ordina colleagues! This is you Bachelor’s degree Four years’ experience in at least one of the following tools or libraries and you can demonstrate this through your portfolio or certifications: Power BI Tableau Qlik D3.js Experience in performance tuning of dashboards Creative but pragmatic with an eye for detail Knowledge of best practices and visual design principles Knowledge of programming languages such as JavaScript, Python, C# is an advantage Knowledge and feeling for UX design would be an added benefit Enjoy being an expert and coaching colleagues and clients Can communicate easily both with your colleagues and with the client and end users of your visualizations Adding your dashboards or portfolio in the application would be an advantage Good command of the Dutch and English languages Benefits Part of our Data community with passionate and experienced peers; focus on working with one of our High Performance Teams (HPT) at renowned clients; you work in a high-tech environment with a focus on knowledge and innovation, an open no-nonsense corporate culture with room for own initiative; working with less travel time; remote & flexible; an environment where entrepreneurship and own initiative are encouraged; a culture where collegiality, knowledge sharing and collaboration are key; a pension plan, to which you are not required to contribute; 20 statutory days off and 7 additional days off via flex benefits; adapt your terms of employment to your personal wishes with flex benefits choice between a company car or a mobility scheme; Everyone is welcome to apply. Because we believe in the power of diversity and value inclusion. After all, the best ideas and smartest solutions arise in diverse teams. That is exactly why we pay so much attention to the composition of our high performance teams. So that you feel at home and can get the best out of yourself.

title: Data Scientist
description: Your Impact As a Data Scientist at Ordina, you’ll dive into the world of Artificial Intelligence (AI). You’ll apply your skills to real scenarios and in different domains, such as the discovery and investigation of payment flows at governmental entities, fraud detection at banks, the development of recommendation systems in the retail sector, and the optimization of supply chains. We are active in themes such as Natural Language Processing (NLP), Computer Vision, Machine Learning Operations (MLOps), AIOps and Explanable A.I. (XAI). You’ll carry out development and implementation of solutions with Machine Learning & Deep Learning at our clients and assess the quality and performance of existing predictive models through to bringing and keeping them into production. Where you're going to get started We create sustainable value for our clients through data within our Data area. We help companies stay agile while in transition by making data and technology part of both daily operations and strategic decision-making. We use data to help our clients stay ahead of change. Our ambition is to help organizations excel with data. The area consists of five practices: Data Governance and Data Management, Data Visualization, Data Science and AI, Data Engineering and Data Migrations, and Spatial Intelligence. Each with a distinct focus on content and the right solution. Over 170 professionals work in a content practice that is a logical fit for them. We believe in the power of multidisciplinary teams. Your expertise, personal ambitions and customer requirements are the basis for the composition of our High Performance Teams. You’ll become an indispensable link in a team of professionals so together you can all bring out the best in each other. Everyone contributes from their own expertise and technology so we all keep learning from each other and no one is ever alone. This is you Master's degree or the equivalent in experience in a Data Science field as a Data Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer, MLOps, or Software Engineer Experience in some of the following Data Science techniques: supervised and unsupervised learning algorithms deep learning anomaly detection recommender systems natural language processing computer vision and reinforcement learning autoencoders, transformers, forecasting Experience in one of the following languages: Python R Experience in bringing Data Science solutions/software to production (Azure, AWS, GCP, Kubernetes, Docker, etc.) Experience in building and implementing advanced analytics solutions and you can provide some reference cases In-depth knowledge of open-source software and libraries in Python and/or R for machine and deep learning Experience in big data and platforms such as Azure Machine Learning Services and Amazon SageMaker is an advantage Good command of the Dutch language Benefits Part of our Data community with passionate and experienced peers; focus on working with one of our High Performance Teams (HPT) at renowned clients; you work in a high-tech environment with a focus on knowledge and innovation, an open no-nonsense corporate culture with room for own initiative; working with less travel time; remote & flexible; an environment where entrepreneurship and own initiative are encouraged; a culture where collegiality, knowledge sharing and collaboration are key; a pension plan, to which you are not required to contribute; 20 statutory days off and 7 additional days off via flex benefits; adapt your terms of employment to your personal wishes with flex benefits choice between a company car or a mobility scheme; Everyone is welcome to apply. Because we believe in the power of diversity and value inclusion. After all, the best ideas and smartest solutions arise in diverse teams. That is exactly why we pay so much attention to the composition of our high performance teams. So that you feel at home and can get the best out of yourself.

title: Freelancing At Dept®
description: We like to have a flexible shell of freelance professionals around our core of Depsters. Simply because we sometimes need specialists. Will you help us out? As a freelance professional at DEPT® you have all the advantages of a large family, with the freedom to go wherever you want. You can fully participate in projects with our customers, or join a team of your DEPT® colleagues. And: you really become part of the DEPT® family. The doors of our offices are always wide open for you. At DEPT® we work with the coolest brands from all over the world. Our task: to make their lives – and that of our customers – better and more fun. That is why we consider a good relationship with our customers to be of vital importance. As a result, they like to come to our parties, and more importantly, we can inspire and challenge them to become even better. Curious about what we do? Check our cases! A few years ago we started our 'DEPT® Freelance Community'. A group of selected digital professionals with whom we would like to work, or want to work with. By leaving your details at the bottom, you sign up for this community and we will contact you when a new opportunity presents itself. So would you like to work with us and are you a: – Software Engineer, Frontend, Backend, Full-stack, Architect – Designer Visual, Interaction, UX, Service design – Data Engineer Analytics, Predictive Modeling, Visualization – Product Manager Product Owner, Scrum Master, Business Manager – Content Creator Copy, Video, Campaign – Creative Content, Art Director – Project Manager – …? Then sign up here! Send your CV and Portfolio, or your own code via a link. Who knows 'till soon!

title: Business Analyst
description: Reference Code: 97413 Business Analyst Amsterdam, NH, NL Fixed Term The story of Cartier is founded on audacity and passion. For more than 170 years we have embraced a bold, pioneering spirit that continues to inspire our teams across all Métiers from our boutiques to our workshops and corporate offices. Our 9000+ colleagues of 105 nationalities are united by a shared independent spirit and commitment to excellence, striving to continuously enrich our Maison’s heritage by pushing the boundaries of creativity. Business Analyst – Cartier Benelux & Nordics (7 month FTC, full time) Want to join Cartier Benelux & Nordics team to actively contribute to data management and business analysis to support our Commercial initiatives? Join us as our Business Analyst. HOW WILL YOU MAKE AN IMPACT? As Business Analyst, reporting to the Commercial Operations & Performance Manager, you are mainly responsible for supporting the Commercial Management & Local Executive committee with data-driven insights & recommendations. Below the main responsibilities: Collect, clean, organize data from various sources, and contribute to the continuous improvement of network performance dashboard elaboration. In particular, design and create dashboards and visual reports to present findings in a clear and understandable manner, for Commercial management to constantly spot business opportunities. Proactively collaborate with Business teams, but as well Client, Marketing and Finance teams, and acquire necessary data to enrich analysis combined with market insight and business result for decision making. Support Commercial management in the sales forecast and ensure accurate upload of the Budget on a quarterly basis. HOW WILL YOUR EXPERIENCE SUCCESS WITH US? You have a keen eye for detail and ability to understand where and how to look for errors in large datasets. You possess strong data visualization skills: ability to analyze data for strategic insights and develop materials that showcase data that summarizes performance for Leadership. You possess a problem-solving mindset, and you are comfortable in a fast-paced changing environment, always driving for excellence You have a “team player” spirit, and the ability to work well within a group / team dynamic. Advanced skills in MS office tools, Excel, PowerPoint. Ability to use POWER BI reports, Google Looker & ANAPLAN sales planning is a plus. HOW DO WE KEEP YOU SMILING? A great opportunity to be a part of a dynamic and diverse team that goes the extra mile. We value our people, and you will be provided with an complete on-boarding and continued training throughout your career to grow with Cartier. This role will also help deepen your knowledge of luxury and its business. YOUR JOURNEY WITH US: If your application is successful, you will receive an introductory call from a member of our Talent Acquisition team to discuss the opportunity. If you are successful through the interview, you will be invited to attend an interview with our Commercial Performance & Operation Manager to assess your fit for the role and who will share insights on our team dynamics and the overall vision. Finally, you will meet the HR Business Partner to ask any questions and have the final feedback.

title: Head of Data
description: About ZEEKR We are ZEEKR, built on a decade of European experience. We are a premium electric vehicle and technology solutions brand from Geely Holding Group, one of world’s largest privately held automotive companies. Our goal and vision is to accelerate the shift to fully electrified mobility. We are committed to driving the future of transportation with cutting-edge technology and a customer-centric approach. Our cars have finally arrived in Europe with the ZEEKR 001 and the new ZEEKR X, and with several markets on our expansion roadmap, there has never been a better time to join the team. The role We are hiring a Head of Data and Business Intelligence to lead the ZEEKR EU Data and Business Intelligence strategy. In the role, you will be the cornerstone of our organization's data-driven decision-making process. Your responsibility will extend beyond managing big data; you will be expected to have first-hand experience working with large datasets, employing both custom-built tools and established platforms like Power BI. Your insights will assist us with efficiency, innovation, and strategic opportunities across the company. As a steward of data, you will empower every department with the information needed to excel in their objectives, ensuring that data is not just a resource but a core pillar of our operational strategy. This is what you will do: Define and own the data and business intelligence strategy for ZEEKR EU across all business functions – marketing, product, HR, legal, finance etc. You and your team will advise and shape the data environment our internal and external customers need to get the most out of their data. Through workshops, presentations, and ongoing education, you will ensure that all levels of the organization understand and harness the potential of BI tools and data analytics. Lead implementation of data governance within the business, onboard and train data owners and data stewards. Focus on compliance and quality initiatives across the ZEEKR EU business groups. Ensure all data framework is in line with EU data privacy legislation. To be successful in the role you should demonstrate the following: Big Data Expertise: Hands-on experience with large data sets and custom-built data tools, with at least 10 years in a data-centric role. Power BI Proficiency: Strong proficiency in employing Power BI for data analysis and visualization, with a minimum of 5 years of practical use. Data Infrastructure Development: Ability to architect and manage scalable data infrastructure, with at least 8 years in data architecture. Analytical Problem-Solving: Proven track record of leveraging data for business innovation and strategic decisions. Leadership in Data Governance: Experience in leading data governance initiatives and fostering a data-driven culture within an organization. Communication and Training: Excellent communication skills with experience conducting workshops and training sessions to enhance data literacy, with at least 5 years in a data advocacy role. Data Analytics and Insight Generation: Skilled at transforming raw data into actionable insights and strategic assets, with extensive experience in data analysis. Experience working with OneTrust. To thrive at ZEEKR we believe that you have the courage to lead with trust and care and you don’t mind getting your hands dirty. You are highly innovative and have a great ability to adapt and perform in a constantly changing, fast-paced, highly demanding work environment. Like us, you believe it’s important to have a passion to work in an international and multicultural environment with the desire and ability to embrace the diversity of people, perspectives, and styles. Apply today, we will perform ongoing selection during the application period. We look forward to hearing from you. Please note that due to GDPR regulations we can only accept applications sent through the recruitment system, not via email or other channels.

title: Data Analyst
description: Powering our sustainable future, together We live in an era where electric mobility is "the new normal." Whereas over the past decade, electric vehicles were only for the few, today they are for everyone. Welcome to the electric era. Enter EVBox. Founded in 2010, EVBox empowers forward-thinking businesses to build a sustainable future by providing flexible and scalable electric vehicle charging solutions. With its offering of residential, commercial, and fast charging stations, as well as scalable charging management software, EVBox ensures that electric mobility is accessible to everyone. We believe in a future where daily transportation is emission-free and sustained by smart charging infrastructure. That's why we've made it our goal to accelerate the adoption of electric mobility by bringing the most accessible and scalable charging solutions to the world. However, the transition from gas to electric cars will change a great deal of what we know about transportation. The growth and success of EVBox is driven by the passion and dedication of everyone in the company. Today, EVBox has grown into an international team across multiple offices in Europe and the United States, with hundreds of driven professionals from different wals of life working for us. About Us: At the Everon Platform Organization within EVBox, we empower forward-thinking businesses to build a sustainable future by providing top-notch EV Charging management solutions. Our engineers build new products, enhance existing solutions and resolve many interesting challenges on a daily basis. This work is delivered in a culture that emphasizes ownership and excellence. Everyone is empowered to make bold decisions and take responsibility for the solutions they build. About the Role: As a Data Analyst, you will join our Data team to expand the data capabilities of the Everon platform. We leverage the vast amounts of data from our global network of customers and charging stations to build high-quality data sets, generate valuable insights, and create innovative data products. We build and run data services and pipelines that validate and enrich incoming data, and provide convenient and secure access to teams across the organization. Our aim is to empower our customers and deliver a delightful user experience by responsibly leveraging data, learning from insights, growing our knowledge, and paving the way towards a sustainable future. In this role you will: Analyze transactional and operational data, leveraging data analysis and models to unlock actionable insights, identify business improvement opportunities, and provide recommendations to enhance performance and efficiency Design, execute, and interpret experiments to validate hypotheses, drawing detailed and impactful conclusions to drive innovation and optimize delivery processes Collaborate closely with various teams, aligning on data strategy and KPIs. Engage with stakeholders to collect requirements, deliver insights, and ensure clear communication of findings, recommendations, and progress Provide and support tools and data visualizations to stakeholders to empower their data-based decision-making process Develop data-driven business insights to find opportunities and recommend the prioritization of product, growth, and optimization initiatives Being able to define and design business value from raw data and implement data models with an abstraction level close to the business domains Enhance the data landscape by collaborating with peers to ensure data logging and data pipelines' availability, integrity, accuracy, and reliability About you: You hold a Bachelor's degree or higher in Math, Economics, Statistics, Engineering, Computer Science, or other related quantitative fields 4+ years of experience in roles such as Product Analyst, Data Analyst, or in other data analysis-focused functions Advanced SQL expertise and strong Python proficiency for data analysis and modelling. Experience working with dbt is a plus Experienced with dashboarding/data visualization platforms such as Grafana, Tableau, Looker, or similar Ability to deliver on tight deadlines and prioritize multiple tasks while maintaining quality and detail Proven track record of handling large datasets, extracting insights, and summarizing key learnings and takeaways Proven aptitude toward Data Storytelling and Root Cause Analysis using data At EVBox, we believe that when people feel valued and rewarded their potential is unlimited. We offer competitive salaries and review remuneration packages regularly to ensure that our pay always positively reflects performance. We promote within, offering learning and development opportunities, and we also provide the following benefits, as standard: A very diverse workforce and an open culture Private pension contribution 25 vacation days Holiday Swap (2 days) - ability to swap out a public holiday for a paid vacation day Commuting allowance Up to 3 days remote working, including working from home allowance of EUR 2 net per day (in consultation with your manager) Budget of 600 Euro to set up your home office Ability to work remotely from anywhere outside of the Netherlands for 4 weeks Access to learning platforms and personal development budget Across our 8 locations, more than 700 EVBoxers work together to provide electric vehicle charging solutions that help businesses move forward. Are you ready to join them? Hit apply. We at EVBox aim to take down historical and structural barriers that stand in the way of our employees. The chargers we manufacture are built for the sustainable future we believe in. We commit to sustained action in tackling processes and practices that systematically penalize our employees. Our DEI efforts are designed not just for the present, but create long-lasting change in the future of our industry. We continue to learn and dismantle the roadblocks that our people face in order to create positive outcomes for all. We believe in an equitable, diverse and inclusive environment where everyone, no matter their gender, race, ethnicity, national origin, age, sexual orientation, identity, religious belief, education or ability, feel valued and respected. We embrace diverse life experiences and heritages and ensure that all voices are valued and heard. Do you want to get to know us even better? Then pay a visit to our Career page, blog or check out our social media channels: LinkedIn, YouTube, Instagram, Facebook or Twitter. EVBox will retain your personal data collected through the application process for 1 year after the position is filled in case of rejection. You can request your data to be deleted at any time. Please read about how EVBox processes your personal data here. EVBox will retain your personal data collected through the application process for 1 year after the position is filled in case of rejection. You can request your data to be deleted at any time. Please read here how EVBox processes your personal data.

title: Data Analyst
description: As a Web Data Analyst you are responsible for analyzing our website’s overall performance. By closely monitoring our KPIs, and working together with our digital development-, commercial-, SEA- and SEO teams, you will strive every day to improve the quantity and quality of our traffic and conversion rate, while decreasing our bounce and exit rates. You will work with a team of analysts on digital forecasting, querying, automation, dashboarding and reporting. You have a crucial role in making the different teams work aligned and synchronized. Does this sound interesting? Then we might be looking for you to join our team! Tasks And Activities Tracking and forecasting of wide variety of KPIs (special focus on traffic and conversion rate); Digital forecasting and automation of data flows; In charge of automating reports through the use and creation of dashboards; Weekly and monthly reporting of performance; data visualization and data storytelling; Build action plans based on analysis, assess other teams on implementation. Track performance once implementation is done; Providing input to management about the online performance; Supporting the online growth by providing new insights and actively sharing these with internal and external stakeholders; Be part of the AB testing process, providing valuable insights and hypothesis to test but specially defining the correct metrics and analyzing test results; Your Profile Ideally 3-5 years of working experience as a web data analyst (experience with CRO considered a big plus); HBO/WO Degree in the field of Economics, Business Administration, Statistics, Mathematics or equivalent; Experience with SQL is a must (BigQuery is a plus); Knowledge of Google Analytics including custom reporting, complex segmentation, marketing tools connections and their use; Knowledge of dashboarding (PowerBI, Looker Studio, Tableau, etc); Knowledge of Google Tag Manager; Knowledge of Python is a plus; Customer focus and data driven; Pro activeness, ownership, willingness to learn; Stakeholder management and strong communication skills; Prioritization and time management skills; Critical thinker and problem-solving skills; Flexible, ability to adapt and work autonomously; Our Offer A - without exaggerating - fantastic workplace on the 40th floor in 'De Rotterdam' with a view of the Erasmus Bridge; Good working conditions and development and opportunities for growth; Renumerations will be based on experience, skills and competences; Freedom and responsibility to shape your own role and to bring ideas to fruition in an environment where anything is possible; The opportunity to achieve the best results as a team, simply because you are a winner; In addition to a great place to work, we also offer 30 holidays, an attractive employee discount, group health insurance, company fitness and discounts on various insurance products; At MediaMarkt we simply have guts. We are entrepreneurs within a company, giving you the chance to develop yourself quickly and in a variety of ways; This is Us We are the market leader in consumer electronics in the Netherlands. As a team we work together to remain the omnichannel player with 49 branches and an online shop. How do we do that? By putting our customers first. Always. By offering the best customer experience both online and offline. We build a party for and with our customers. We believe that anything is possible if you take action yourself. Working at MediaMarkt means: having fun and wanting to win!

title: Data Analyst
description: Introductie Voor een interessante opdracht bij onze eindklant in Noord-Brabant zijn wij op zoek naar een Freelance Data Analist . Location: Den Bosch Startdate: ASAP Duration: 12 months with option to extent (40 hrs. /week) Extra: – 4 days remote, 1 day in the office is possible – CV’s and motivation written in English Organisatie The Technology department is responsible for the digital strategy, innovation and digital transformation as well as developing analytics solutions for our products and services. Developing state of the art analytical solutions powered by a modern and scalable architecture is seen as a key differentiator for the future. With analytics we strive to improve efficiency while improving outcomes and support fact based decisioning within the organization.
