Assist in data analysis, report generation, and offer insights from both web analytics and CDP data.9. Train team members on tracking tool setup, CDP usage, and best practices.10. Ensure compliance with data privacy regulations and best practices.Requirements:1. Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Marketing, or a related field plus 3 years commercial experience2. Proven experience in implementing and maintaining web analytics tracking systems and CDP platforms.3. Strong understanding of digital marketing, web analytics, and customer data management.4. Proficiency in HTML, CSS, JavaScript, JSON, and relevant CDP technologies.5. Familiarity with data layer concepts, structures, and data integration methodologies.6. Strong problem-solving skills and keen attention to detail.7. Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical audiences. Preferred:1. Google Analytics, Google Tag Manager, and major CDP platform certifications.2. Experience with other tag management systems, web analytics tools, and CDP integrations.3. Knowledge of SEO, SEM strategies, and data privacy regulations.If you apply for a position at Polaroid, we will process your personal data. Please see our Job Applicant Privacy Policy for more information about how we handle personal data of job applicants. https://www.polaroid.com/privacy-policy

title: Analytics Engineer (L5) - Globalization
description: At Netflix, our mission is to entertain the world by connecting our members to an extensive library of stories from all over the globe. We are revolutionizing international storytelling as we deliver billions of hours of movies and TV shows per month to 200+ million members across 190+ countries in 30+ languages.The Globalization Data Science and Engineering team is at the forefront of removing language barriers and providing a stellar member experience to all our members regardless of their language preferences. We are responsible for the translation and cultural adaptation of all aspects of member interaction, including beautiful localized user interfaces, subtitles, and dubbing of award-winning Netflix originals.EMEA is a significant center for our broader Studio and Creative Production teams. We are looking for an experienced Analytics Engineer based in our Amsterdam office to join our growing EMEA team. In this role, you will design and develop analytic tools and systems to create more member value via localization expansion and optimization. You will partner with a talented cross-functional team of engineers, scientists, product managers and domain experts to shape localization strategy and deliver business impact.ResponsibilitiesAct as strategic partner for stakeholders and cross-functional collaborators to identify business opportunities and enhance business strategies with automated data solutionsDrive the direction and execution of your work, which span from developing scrappy analytic tools to designing scalable analytic systemsPartner closely with other engineers and scientists to improve foundational data models and accelerate productization of data insightsShare your innovation and collaborate with the broader community to strengthen analytics enablementBecome a regional expert on Globalization Data Science and Engineering, helping educate and connect with regional officesAbout YouProven track record of designing and developing scalable analytic tools and systemsHigh proficiency in standard tech stack (e.g., Python, SQL, Spark) and common data visualization tools (e.g., Streamlit, Tableau)Familiar with fundamentals of Machine Learning and Statistical Inference as well as data engineering best practices5+ years of relevant experiences with building data products powered by big dataExceptional communication and collaboration skills coupled with strong business acumenComfortable with ambiguity; able to take ownership, and thrive with minimal oversight and processNetflix culture resonates with youNetflix cultureNetflix's culture is an integral part of what makes us successful, and we approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that bringing together different perspectives and backgrounds helps build stronger teams. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description: 【About Tencent】Tencent is a world-leading internet and technology company that develops innovative products and services to improve the quality of life of people around the world. Founded in 1998 with its headquarters in Shenzhen China, our guiding principle is to use technology for good. We are not only a major video game publisher in the world, we also produce other high-quality digital content, enriching interactive entertainment experiences for people around the globe. We offer a range of services such as cloud computing, advertising, FinTech, and other enterprise services to support our clients' digital transformation and business growth.【About Level Infinite】 Level Infinite is a global gaming brand dedicated to delivering high-quality and engaging interactive entertainment experiences to a worldwide audience, wherever and however they choose to play. It operates from bases in Amsterdam and Singapore with staff around the world. To learn more about Level Infinite, visit www.levelinfinite.com, and follow on Twitter,Facebook, Instagram and YouTube.Responsibilities:1. Responsible for the development of the IEG Global advertising platform.2. Responsible for the design and implementation of the cloud data platform part of the advertising platform.3. Responsible for the technical support and technology exchange with game studios.Requirements:1.Bachelor degree or above, majoring in computer science, engineering or related fields.5+ years of working experience, 3+ years of data development experience.2.Experience in SQL and at least 2 programming languages: Python, Scala, Java, etc. and complies with coding standards and technical design.3.Deep understanding of big data tools: Hadoop, Hive, Spark, Flink, etc.Experience in Spark, Flink or related application development.4.Ability to build cloud data platforms on common cloud platforms such as Azure, GCP, AWS, etc. 5.Excellent communication skills and good teamwork spirit . Active learning and love of sharing. Experience in open source project maintenance is preferred.[DEI Statement] Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Tencent: Diversity, equity and inclusion are important, interdependent components of our workplace. As an equal opportunity employer, we firmly believe that diverse voices fuel our innovation and allow us to better serve our users and the community. We foster an environment where every employee of Tencent feels supported and inspired to achieve individual and common goals.

title: Data Engineer
description: Working at the heart of the energy transition and supporting the terminals to become a data-driven organization.is well underway to become a digital and data-driven organization. We are investing heavily in the data foundation as well as speeding up the utilization of data. For years, we have been standardizing our business processes across our terminal network, modernizing our application landscape, started governing and modelling our data, and implementing new cloud-based integration-, and data analytics platforms. More and more data is utilized in customer portals, data sharing platforms with partners in the logistic supply chain, and for advanced analytics & AI.In a brand new department within Global IT, the Data and Analytics Office, all data capabilities needed to support the data journey are centralized, ranging from Data Engineers & Data Scientists to Data Quality experts and Data Architects.As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for expanding and optimizing the preparation and delivery of our data towards our data consumers, including collection/ingestion and integration of data from various internal and external data sources, into the different data stores and systems optimized for reporting and analytics. Examples are our cloud-based data lake (AWS S3), enterprise data warehouse (Snowflake) and data virtualization & catalogue (data. world).Furthermore, we are in the process of implementing an ambitious data analytics architecture, where we are translating our business strategy and requirements to new data technologies.One of your first assignments will be the migration of our current data integration solution into a modernized data integration technology.We are looking for a (medior) Data Engineer to help us in our journey towards becoming a data-driven company.RequirementsAs a data engineer, you will:Develop and maintain data pipelinesManage our data lake for reporting purposesBuild collectors (Lambda, DMS, Spark or Glue) and processes in AirflowConfigure and manage tools like Cloudformation (CDK)Use support tooling such as Gitlab (CI/CD)Focus on the technical implementation of use cases and required tools on a new data platformBe involved in the data standards and initiatives that we have set for our customersIn this role, you have the autonomy to, together with your team, decide how to maintain the data lake as you want it. You will be working with a variety of use cases and different data sets and will be continuously working on maintaining and keeping the platform alive. The report that you will deliver have an impact: they are used for sales and forecasting reports and enable our colleagues to work efficiently. You will be taking on various cases, as well as finding answers to questions like these:How can we incrementally develop a data platform that enables the most optimal development of use cases?How can we most efficiently develop a use case on the data platform and incrementally enhance the data platform to accommodate new use cases from our colleagues and our organization?

title: Data Engineer
description: At D2X we are looking for an experienced Data Engineer to join our Amsterdam office. Are you a problem solution-seeker and do you have a genuine desire to craft clean and correct code? Then keep reading!About D2XAt D2X we are driven to become the first regulated derivatives exchange for the digital asset industry in Europe. Our mission is to bridge the gap between Tech and Finance and to facilitate the institutional adoption of digital assets through derivatives. We recently raised our seed funding round, and we are looking for exceptional talents with an entrepreneurial drive and an interest in the digital asset space to join our fast-growing team.Working for D2X means being independent, creative, and adaptive. Our culture of innovation and accountability creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career.Technology at D2XDigital assets trade round-the-clock, 365 days a year. Therefore, we are constantly seeking the most advanced technology to offer a fast and reliable trading interface. Rust allows us to achieve that in a productive way. Developing, testing and optimizing our codebase is the bread and butter of our Engineers.Your ResponsibilitiesData Pipeline Development: Design, implement, and maintain end-to-end data pipelines for collecting, processing, and storing large volumes of financial data from various sources, including market data feeds, trade records, and user activityData Modeling and Warehousing: Develop and optimize data models and data warehousing solutions to support real-time and scheduled analytics, reporting, retention and business intelligence needsScalability and Performance: Architect and manage systems that can handle high-frequency trading data, ensuring low latency and high availability through stages in entity lifetimesInfrastructure Management: Manage and improve data storage, processing, and analytics infrastructure, running both on-premises and in the cloud (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)Monitoring and Troubleshooting: Implement robust monitoring and alerting systems to proactively identify and resolve data pipeline issues and performance bottlenecksSecurity and Compliance: Ensure data security and compliance with industry and regulatory standardsRequirementsBachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related fieldProven experience (5+ years) as a Data Engineer in a fast-paced environmentStrong knowledge in data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousingExperience with real-time data processing and streaming platforms (e.g., Kafka, Flink)Proficiency in SQL and NoSQL databasesExperience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes)Knowledge of financial markets and trading systems is a plusExperience with a Systems Programming Language (e.g. C, C++ or Rust)Excellent problem-solving and communication skillsExperience working collaboratively in a fast-paced, startup environmentBenefitsEnergetic, Collaborative & Fun Work environmentGenerous base salary compensation with bonus post-launchStock Option PlanBike compensated by the company, up to EUR 749Gym membership, up to EUR 35Dynamic, international, innovative, and respectful work environment – employees are at the core, we value every person and encourage initiativePremium office space with rich amenities in AmsterdamHybrid working mode with 4 days a week at the office and 1 day a week from homeWe welcome applicants from all over the world. We believe in diversity and inclusivity and are committed to creating a welcoming and supportive environment for all of our employees. We will support the right candidate with their visa application process. Where applicable, we will provide assistance with the 30% ruling application to help ensure a smooth transition to working and living in the Netherlands.Are you up for the challenge? We would love to get to know you! Apply directly here: https://d2x.bamboohr.com/careers/55

title: Data Analytics Engineer
description: Data Analytics Engineer Ready to break boundaries in the analytical world? Accelerate your further Analytics engineering career with our advanced training program while working for our partner organization. We fully pay this program as well as your salary.✅ Help a data driven team and their business by developing data-driven business solutions✅ Working on the data modelling and creating relevant data sets and dashboard✅ Build data pipelines to facilitate reporting✅ Improving and automating data flows and processesThe role itself· 2 fulltime weeks of hands-on bootcamp training where you’ll focus on writing deployable code, containerization, Analytics engineering & data engineering fundamentals· Work 4 days a week as an Analytics engineer at one of our clients· Join us every Wednesday at the Xccelerated office in Amsterdam. Here you will get ongoing training and project support from our technical leads· At the end of your first year, you get the opportunity to join the partner organization directlyAs an Analytics engineer you will work together with Data engineer & BI developers, whereby you will contribute on developing data-driven business solutions. You will do this in the form of machine learning models, strategic analyses and a self-service data model.A big focus of your role will be data modelling and creating relevant data sets and dashboards. You will also be the one that transforms raw data to structured data files. To achieve this, you will build data pipelines to fully automate the availability of data for reporting.About XcceleratedXccelerated is an initiative within the Xebia Group, accelerating growth of Data, Cloud & AI competence. Our 13-month advanced training programs integrate hands-on learning and skill development with working at one of our partner companies. It is an intense learning journey for who have proven their potential and are ready for the next step in their career.Are you one of them? Join our dream team of 45 great people. Each member of our team brings a unique specialty and passion to our shared mission: eliminate the shortage of highly skilled Data & AI professionals. To achieve our goal, we empower each other to reach their full potential and inspire others to do the same. This is youFrom a personal perspective, you are customer focused and have a strong can-do mentality.We are looking for a communicatively strong and enthusiastic colleague with a passion for data. Next to this, you have:✅ A bachelor’s or master’s degree✅ 1-4 years of work experience as an Analytics engineer/BI Developer/Data analyst✅ Experience with data modelling, dashboarding and visualization (PowerBI)✅ Experience with SQL; preferably also Python✅ Experience with Cloud components What Xccelerated offers 💰 Good salary🛫 25 vacation days📙 Kick off with 2 full-time weeks of hands-on bootcamp training📊 Technical trainings & Innovation days for a full year (every week)✅ Challenging assignments💻 Macbook and Iphone🍎 Lunches, amazing coffee and snack bar🎒Flexibility in working from home & at the officeInterested? We’d love to meet you! Please get in touch! Contact Samantha Alves Goncalves at sgoncalves@xccelerated.io or by phone at 0613889770. Application Process· First interview with one of our recruitment consultants· Making a technical assessment (from home) you will present to one of or Tech Leads (home/on remote)**We aim to complete an application process (from application to offer) within 1-3 weeks. As you will understand, this also depends on your own availability.

title: Analytics Engineer
description: Analytics Engineer at TransferzTransferz operates a global marketplace for ground transportation, dedicated to travellers, travel brands, and transfer companies. Travellers can complete their travel plans with door-to-door transfers by selecting the transfer they want, based on vehicle type and price, and enjoy peace of mind on the first and last mile of their journeys. With coverage in 150+ countries, 800+ airports and more than 1.500 transfer companies in the network, Transferz is truly global. We have the ambition to become the market leader in ground transportation worldwide.Transferz is seeking a talented Analytics Engineer to join our Product/IT department. As an Analytics Engineer, you will play a crucial role in analyzing and interpreting data to drive business decisions and improve our products.In this role, you will work closely with our international teams to streamline the data warehousing, develop data models, and create visualizations that provide insights into KPIs and product performance. You will collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and translate them into actionable reports and dashboards.Our ideal candidate has a strong analytical background and is fluent in SQL. Knowledge of python is an advantage. In addition, We’re looking for someone that has experience with querying and modelling relational databases, as well as Google BigQuery or other Cloud-based data warehouses. To help us further up our data game, strong data visualisation skills are also required for this role.Responsibilities:Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insightsDevelop and maintain data models and databasesCreate and maintain reports and dashboards to track key performance indicatorsCollaborate with stakeholders to understand their data requirementsProvide data-driven recommendations to improve product performanceStay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in analyticsWe can offer you:a place where you can be yourself and grow your skills; we personalize your learning trajectory based on your desired outcome!a great working atmosphere with driven and ambitious peers;all the tools you’ll need to excel; both hardware and software;a vibrant new office in Amsterdam with a global impact on ground transportationan entrepreneurial environment where the sky is the limit!We believe it’s the people that make the business and we are looking for like-minded individuals to join us in creating an open, transparent, motivating, inspiring, and fun working environment. We have a typical scale-up culture, growing fast, hard-working, and have huge ambitions. But no worries, work hard = play hard!With truly global coverage, Transferz is a multilingual and multinational company and believes in fostering diversity. We are headquartered in Amsterdam with an additional office in Cordoba (Argentina), and presence in Bangkok.Want to join the ride? Apply now and get onboard!You have around 2+ years of work experience in a similar roleYou have excellent SQL skills (GoogleBigQuery / PostgreSQL are a pre)You have strong data visualisation skillsYou have experience with dashboard tools (Looker or similar BI tools) and relational database modelingYou have very analytical and good problem-solving skillsYou have empathy, curiosity, and a data mindset for understanding and addressing complex issuesYou have affinity with statistics and hence understanding when analysis or models are significant (CI, distributions and distance measures)

title: Founding Analytics Engineer
description: Increment is building a Data Cloud Optimisation product, helping data teams understand the cost of their data workloads and helps them take the right actions towards optimising those costs. We're building an interpretation engine that pulls in metadata and transforms it into actionable recommendations and granular insights. We're looking for someone who can help us develop our foundational cost optimisation model. What you'll doIncrement is taking a unique approach towards cloud optimisation. Modern cloud platforms, like Google BigQuery, come with a usage based pricing model where they charge for every byte that you process or store. Using the platform metadata, we build a bottoms up cost model, enabling cost insights at the most granular level (SQL/Table level).Then we apply a combination of advanced analytics engineering, SQL parsing, and LLM's to create highly relevant, and actionable cost savings recommendations with clear effort and ROI labels.In this role, you'll be working closely with the founder to build up this model and the surrounding technologies. What you'll need? At least 6 years experience in a data role, of which the last 2 in analytics engineering A deep understanding of the Google Cloud Platform, especially BigQueryExcellent understanding of data modelling frameworks and paradimes Understanding of SQL Query execution plans Expert in SQL, highly proficient in PythonYou're an innovative problem solverYou're a great communicator

title: Analytics Engineer
description: You support your team through your technical expertise and passion for data. Together with your team, you build amazing data products that provide important insights to Coolblue, so everyone can make better and educated business decisions.How do I become a Analytics Engineer at Coolblue?You work in a multi-functional team, collaborating with other Analytics Engineers, Data Engineers and Analysts, to provide insights that support strategic decision-making across your domain.You play a key role in building complex data products by combining and transforming raw data into insights, while applying software engineering best practices in handling analytics code base. You publish and share these products and make them easy to access by keeping an updated data catalog and implementing data governance. Your efforts ensure data consistency, reliability, and accessibility across the organization.Share your knowledge and passion for data analytics with colleagues. You'll be instrumental in fostering a culture where data-driven decision-making is the norm, not the exception.You are confident in your skills, in particular in SQL and Data Modeling, and you use all opportunities to coach your colleagues about those topics. Would you also like to become an Analytics Engineer at Coolblue? Read below if the job suits you.You enjoy doing thisTransforming complex data into meaningful insights by working alongside business teams, understanding their needs, and delivering data-driven insights that help them achieve their goals.Organizing data, ensuring it's easily accessible. Your work with data catalogs and governance frameworks ensures that data is reliable, consistent, and readily available for analysis.Spreading your knowledge in data analysis, cultivating a data-driven mindset throughout the organization.You are always eager to learn new tools and techniques in analytics and business intelligence, keeping Coolblue at the cutting edge of data-driven decision making.You recognize yourself in the followingYou have 3+ years of experience working as data engineering or in a technical data analytics role.You have experience with SQL and a programming language, preferably Python.You are able to work with dbt in cloud environments such as BigQuery, Snowflake or Redshift.You have a solid understanding of data warehousing, orchestration, pipeline and visualization solutions.You have knowledge about visualization tools such as Looker.You have excellent communication skills and the ability to adjust your message to different audiences.This is what you’re looking for in a jobMoney.Over 30 training courses at our own Coolblue University.Travel allowance and a retirement plan.25 leave days. As long as you promise to come back.Travel allowance, a pension plan and where-you-work-money.A discount on all our products.Relocation assistance: from A to Z. We will make sure it goes well and give full support. An extraordinarily good work environment with colleagues from all over the world who make you happy, epic Coolblue parties, pubquizzing, and other activities.Room for new initiatives and ideas. We’re always open to those, whether you’ve been with us for a week, a month, or a year.A job at one of the fastest-growing companies in the Benelux.A picture-perfect office at a great location. You could crawl to work from Rotterdam Central Station. Though we recommend just walking for 2 minutes.At this moment we have a hybrid way of working: a combo between working from home and at the office. Of course we take care of a home office supplies. Including a desk chair, laptop and blue colored decoration.

Experience with other programming languages is a plusExperience with data engineering tools and frameworks such as Apache Hadoop, Spark, and KafkaKnowledge of database design, data modeling, and data warehousing conceptsFamiliarity with cloud platforms such as AWS or AzureStrong problem-solving and analytical skillsExcellent communication and collaboration abilitiesRequirements Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field 3+ years of experience in data engineering or a similar role Proficient in SQL and Python. title: Data Engineer
description: Be part of a mission-driven company that is leading the energy transition towards a sustainable future.Work with a diverse range of data and cutting-edge technologies to build a robust, scalable cloud-based data platform.Enjoy the freedom and responsibility to make critical technical decisions that will shape the future of Eneco's digital innovations.WHY CHOOSE ENECOAt Eneco, we're accelerating the energy transition with our 'One Planet plan', aiming to be the first CO2-neutral energy company by 2035. We're committed to helping everyone take the next sustainable step towards smarter, cleaner, and more sustainable energy.We're looking for talented individuals who are passionate about our mission of 'sustainable energy for everyone'. By joining our data team, you'll contribute directly to Eneco's digital innovations, playing a crucial role in our journey towards a more sustainable future. Our Digital department is dedicated to developing these innovations, with data at the heart of our efforts.WHAT ARE YOU GOING TO DO?As a Data Engineer, you'll be a key player in a cross-functional team. You'll be working with a wide range of data, including customer data, smart meters, wind turbines, solar panels, power plants, and IoT devices. Your task will be to build a cloud-based data platform that can handle, store, process, and utilize this data efficiently.Your work will not only empower other departments by making data accessible and usable, but also give you the freedom and responsibility to make critical technical decisions. Your choices will ensure our solutions are robust, scalable, and ready to meet the challenges of the future.YOU ARE RESPONSIBLE FORSupporting Data Scientists, Data Analysts, and Machine Learning Engineers by integrating and preparing raw data.Make high quality data accessible easily.Assisting in the design and implementation of data solutions for new projects.Supporting the deployment, monitoring, and management of pipelines and applications in production.Writing well-documented code and reviewing code from colleagues.Collaborating with stakeholders to gather and discuss product requirements.YOU BRINGYou have at least 1 year of experience as a Data Engineer or Software/ML/DevOps Engineer.You are proficient in either Python, Java, or Scala.You have experience with a cloud provider (Azure), Kubernetes, SQL and NoSQL databases, Docker, CI/CD, DevOps principles.You have familiarity with Kafka, Airflow, Snowflake, or Spark.WE HAVE A LOT TO OFFERA gross salary between €65.000,00 - €93.000,00 (annual salary including 8% holiday allowance for a full-time contract), depending on knowledge and experience.A free spendable flex budget of 14% per on top of your monthly salary, for example to buy extra vacation days or have it paid out.Public transport card, also privately sustainable on the road, with which you also travel for free in your free time throughout the Netherlands.Parental leave, good pension scheme and career opportunities.Hybrid working; you will work 40% in the office and 40% at home. The other day you decide where best to work.Drive data driven decision making to build innovative digital productsHelp Eneco and its customers become climate neutral by 2035INTERESTED?Do you see yourself working as a data scientist at Eneco and do you dare take up the challenge to extend the leading position of Eneco in the energy transition? Then you should apply for this position! Do you want to know more about this vacancy at Eneco? Evgeny Tskhovrebov is the manager of the team; he will gladly answer your questions. You can contact him at evgeny.tskhovrebov@eneco.comAn EU work permit is required to qualify for this position.

title: Data Engineer
description: ALL DATA ENGINEERS BASED IN EUROPE BEWARE!Put your technological skills to work for a sustainable future!We are looking for a driven data engineer who wants to make the move to a growing and ambitious organisation. title: Data Engineer
description: Wat je gaat doenAls Data Engineer bij onze Partner maak je deel uit van een dynamische omgeving met leuke en zeer getalenteerde collega's. Je zult werken in de Data & Analytics (DnA) omgeving en bijdragen aan de groei en ontwikkeling van de organisatie.Bij onze partner help je onze klanten meer datagedreven te worden door datapipelines te bouwen en ruwe, ongestructureerde gegevens om te zetten in formaten die andere dataprofessionals, zoals datawetenschappers en analisten, kunnen analyseren. Dit werk omvat het creëren en onderhouden van een infrastructuur die het bouwen van analyses en machine learning-modellen automatiseert. Onze klanten bestaan uit middelgrote en grote organisaties.Vereiste kennis en ervaringAls Data Engineer bij onze Partner haal je voldoening uit het structureren en automatiseren van gegevens. Je krijgt energie van het ontwerpen, opzetten, verbeteren en automatiseren van datapipelines. Je werkt graag in een klein, hecht team binnen een opschalingscultuur.Naast het dagelijkse plezier werk je graag samen met collega's. Je hebt goede communicatieve vaardigheden en bent in staat om te communiceren met niet-technische belanghebbenden. Het spreken van Nederlands is noodzakelijk.Vereiste vaardigheden & kennisMust: Cloud ervaring (AWS, GCP of Azure) en programmeren in Python Pre: Oracle Data Integrator | ETL-tools | SQL | PL/SQL | SAP Powerdesign | Microsoft SQL Server | ERD | SSIS | SSAS | SSRS | Agile | Power BI | TableauWat wij jou biedenAls onderdeel van het Data & Analytics team maak je deel uit van een gedreven en gepassioneerd team. Je werkt in een klein en hecht team binnen een opschalingscultuur. Wij geloven dat succes dankzij data niets te maken heeft met cijfers, algoritmen, systemen of processen. Wij geloven dat het een zaak van mensen is. Daarom richten we ons op persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Dat is belangrijk!ArbeidsvoorwaardenEen uitstekend salaris, afhankelijk van werkervaring en opleiding25 vakantiedagen + Goede Vrijdag en 24 en 31 decemberEen informele, vriendelijke sfeer met zeer aardige collega'sEen stimulerende werkomgeving met veel mogelijkheden voor verdere leer- en ontwikkelingsmogelijkhedenEen uitstekend opleidings- en persoonlijk ontwikkelingsbudgetDeel uitmaken van een grote Microsoft-community van ervaren expertsEen open cultuur waar het delen van kennis en ervaring wordt aangemoedigdEen leaseautoUitgebreid startpakket inclusief laptop en mobiele telefoon - kies je eigen apparaat!Pensioenregeling (boven marktniveau)Aantrekkelijke carrièreperspectieven (nationaal en internationaal)

title: Analytics Engineer, Strategy and Competitive Intelligence
description: Brief info about VintedVinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with a growing member base of over 80 million registered members spanning 19 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Czech Republic, Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 1,800 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.Information about the positionAs a Competitive Intelligence Analytics Engineer, you will be responsible for developing, executing, and maintaining our competitive intelligence data processing and insight creation, gaining insights into the market landscape, growth and developments. You’ll be fueling our strategy with up to date market intelligence. This is a role that requires a strong understanding of data processing and data quality management, and we are looking for someone with an independent mindset, able to collaborate across functions and teams.Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines. Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making. Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithmsIn this position, you’llArchitect, build, and maintain automated scripts and data workflows to process web data into strategic insights. Monitor data pipelines, identify anomalies, and troubleshoot data quality issues in a timely manner with different internal and external stakeholders. Conduct root cause analysis to identify the source of data issues and work towards long-term solutions. Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Data Science, Engineering, and Strategy, to understand data needs and insights to be delivered, as well as managing external data providersPerform analysis to enrich the data with strategically relevant insights, creating data visualizations and reports to effectively communicate data quality insights to stakeholders, performing root cause analysis in case of issues in production processesDesign and maintain data quality metrics and KPIs, providing insights into data accuracy and completeness. Analyze large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies that may impact data quality. Ensuring that you and other end-users are able to optimally use the data models - drive optimization, documentation, training, and monitoring of best practicesAlso, we work with Looker to disclose our data to the teams, experience in Looker is a nice-to-have. Proactively identify and drive opportunities to make Data Science and Analytics within Vinted even more impactfulAbout YouProven experience: typically 2+ years (of working experience or alternative activities resulting in a similar level of proficiency) with data collection and monitoring as an Analytics Engineer, Data Engineer, Cloud Engineer or equivalentFluent in SQL and Python. Working experience in a programing language like Java, Scala or similarExperience with DBT (data build tool) and Google Cloud Platform (incl. BigQuery) are an advantageExperience developing and maintaining data processing systems at scale and being able to make architectural decisions taking into account aspects like scalability, efficiency and reliability. Experience with data modeling. Excellent attention to detail. We are looking for someone who understands the value of documentation and clean, tidy codeIndependent working, capable of setting up, running and maintaining data processes without much supportStrong communication & collaboration skills - able to build and maintain multi-functional relationships with various teams across the business as well as translate business needs into technical solutionsExcellent at communicating in spoken and written EnglishAdvantage: Interest and experience in competitive intelligence Work perksThe opportunity to benefit from our share options programme25 days of paid annual leaveNewest MacBook modelsMental and emotional health support through the Mindletic appFrequent team-building eventsHome office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furnitureA daily lunch allowanceClassPass (Gym Membership subsidy)Frequent team-building eventsPension plan with total contribution of 12%, 8% by the Company and 4% by employeeA personal monthly budget for shopping on VintedAn NS mobility cardThe opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workationA dog-friendly officeWorking at VintedIndividual Learning BudgetVinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.Hybrid WorkWe’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.Equal OpportunityThe Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.The salary range for this position is € 47,900 - € 64,860 gross per year.

title: Data Engineer
description: WIJ ZOEKEN EEN DATA ENGINEER IN DEN BOSCHBen jij die gedreven Data Engineer die de sleutelpositie speelt in het beheer en de doorontwikkeling van ons datawarehouse? Heb jij een passie voor data, het bouwen van scripts en is de SQL server-infrastructuur jouw domein? Dan hebben wij een baan voor jou!HOE EEN WERKDAG ERUIT KAN ZIENIn deze rol vertaal jij een indrukwekkende hoeveelheid data in bruikbare data-sets en heb jij de sleutelrol in het beheer en de doorontwikkeling van de SQL server-infrastructuur. Bij Van der Velden is het datawarehouse de ruggengraat van onze Power BI rapportages. In deze rol draag je daarom actief bij aan de verdere doorontwikkeling van onze management informatie en aan de ambitie om meer en meer data driven te werken. Je hebt een diepgaand begrip van de data-architectuur en vervult een belangrijke rol als het gaat om de implementatie van robuuste data-oplossingen die Van der Velden in staat stelt om op data gebaseerde beslissingen te nemen.Hoe?Als Data Engineer zorg jij ervoor dat ons datawarehouse op een efficiënte en betrouwbare manier wordt beheerd, zodat deze toegankelijk is voor rapportages.Jij zorgt ervoor dat onze data efficiënt uit de bron systemen ontsloten wordt en vertaalt deze data naar bruikbare datasetsJij voegt nieuwe bronnen van informatie toe aan ons datawarehouse en zorgt voor de juiste integratie ten behoeve van Power BI rapportagesDe SQL Server-infrastructuur is jouw domein. Je beheert, optimaliseert en monitort de SQL server. Technische problemen? Jij spot ze en lost ze opJe documenteert het ontwerp, de configuratie, procedures en wijzigingen met betrekking tot het datawarehouseJij onderzoekt waar mogelijkheden zijn om ons data platform verder te ontwikkelen en betrekt daarin ook nieuwe technologieën en tools om de data-engineering infrastructuur te verbeterenJe werkt nauw samen met de specialist Power BI en rapporteert aan de Business Controller, waardoor je de behoeften van de organisatie goed begrijpt en optimaal kunt ondersteunenWAT WE VAN JE VRAGENJe hebt minimaal 2 jaar ervaring met het ontwerpen, implementeren en beheren van datawarehousesHBO werk- en denkniveau (informatiekunde, (bedrijfs-)informatica, data/computer science of vergelijkbaar)Kennis van en ervaring met SQL server management en API koppelingen, Microsoft Azure en DatabricksKennis van en ervaring met Power BI is een préEen goed inzicht in bedrijfsprocessen en datastructurenEen nauwkeurige werkhoudingGoede communicatieve vaardigheden op alle niveausFlexibel in een dynamische omgeving waarbij je kunt schakelen tussen verschillende informatie vraagstukkenGedreven, initiatiefrijk en energiek: door jouw nieuwsgierigheid wil je tot de kern van analyses te komenWAT WE JE BIEDENWij creëren voor iedere held van Van der Velden een werksfeer met zoveel mogelijkheid voor vrijheid en zelfstandigheid. Onze helden verdienen het: Van der Velden Rioleringsbeheer past de cao voor de metaal en technische bedrijfstakken (cao Metaal en Techniek) toe in de rioleringsbranche. Daarnaast hebben we goede arbeidsvoorwaarden zoals, 25 vakantiedagen en 13 adv-dagen, opleidingsmogelijkheden, mogelijkheden tot flexibel werken en deelname aan ons fietsplan.Verder bieden wij je:Een startsalaris tussen de €3.651,00 en €4.093,00 bruto per maand op basis van 40 uurEen baan voor 32 uur per week (waarbij minimaal 28 en max 36 uur bespreekbaar is)Na een jaarcontract een contract voor onbepaalde tijd (bij een positieve beoordeling)Je komt te werken op ons gloednieuwe hoofdkantoor in Den Bosch en maakt deel uit van het Finance Team. Deze bestaat uit een directeur Finance, de Financieel Controller, de afdeling Power BI/Business Controlling, de afdeling Financiële administratie en het Shared Service Center Finance.

title: Data Engineer
