Joining their expanding Data and Analytics team to work on building out a new function for their global offering.Responsibilities:Lead a proficient team of analysts and engineers in crafting insightful dashboards and conducting data analyses.Collaborate across departments, contributing to strategic decisions and elevating product capabilities.Bridge the gap between the analytics team and the organization, transforming clear requirements into impactful data solutions.Shape external narratives through contributions to industry reports and insights.Qualifications:A minimum of 5 years in analytics or business intelligence, with at least 2 years in a leadership role.Proficient in cloud data warehousing or lakehouse.Expertise in data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, or Metabase).Advantageous: experience in version control systems (Git) and infrastructure-as-code solutions.Strong analytical acumen and adept stakeholder management.Results-oriented, quality-focused, with the ability to inspire and assert.Apply now for a confidential chat!

title: Data Engineer
description: Data Engineer Houd jij van puzzelen en stop je niet tot je de uitkomst hebt gevonden? Dan pas je in ons team van data engineers en data modelling experts. Jij wordt expert op het gebied van de technische ontwikkeling van onze Planning & Control applicatie en specialiseert je in de integratie met andere systemen. Wie zijn wij? Wij zijn Cogix, onderdeel van de Anago groep. Een jonge, snelgroeiende software organisatie binnen een sector waar de toekomst ligt. Met slimme applicaties kunnen we echt het verschil maken bij de klant, en uiteindelijk ook in de wereld.Cogix maakt begroten in het onderwijs gemakkelijk met een complete cloudoplossing voor de Planning & Control cyclus. Onze applicatie zorgt ervoor dat dit complexe, en veranderlijke proces zo eenvoudig mogelijk wordt gemaakt. Hierdoor krijgt de klant (een onderwijsbestuur) meer grip op het financiële en personele proces, en zal door middel van monitoring beter in staat zijn proactief te kunnen schakelen. Daarmee worden middelen vrijgespeeld om effectiever en efficiënter in te zetten, waardoor je echt bijdraagt aan het vergroten van de kwaliteit van het onderwijs!De Cogix applicatie creëren we met ons eigen low-code ontwikkelplatform Anago Assemble. Binnen deze omgeving worden berekeningen, gegevensstromen en schermen gemodelleerd met bouwstenen en waar nodig wordt geprogrammeerd. De data engineers bouwen continu aan nieuwe functionaliteiten en verbeteringen van de applicatie en de integratie met andere systemen. Naast het ontwikkelplatform Assemble wordt ook Talend Open Studio for Data Integration gebruikt voor het modelleren van de koppelingen (Data Extraction, Transforming and Loading, ETL).Wat ga jij doen? Als data engineer start je in ons Young Professional Program. Hierin leer je in de eerste twee maanden de basiskennis over Assemble en Talend. Daarnaast krijg je workshops in professionele vaardigheden, word je ondergedompeld in onze ontwikkelmethodes en duik je in onze complexe en veelzijdige Cogix applicatie. Zo maak jij een vliegende start!Daarna ga je meewerken in onze 2-maandelijkse sprints waarbij jij betrokken bent bij het gehele ontwikkelproces van ontwerpen en bouwen tot testen en oplevering. Wat je gaat ontwikkelen bepalen we voorafgaand aan de sprint. Dit kan gaan om wensen van bestaande klanten, nieuwe klanten, bugs in het systeem of eigen verbeterideeën op basis van onze toekomstvisie.Jij zorgt ervoor dat de integratie met andere systemen robuust gebouwd wordt. We hebben honderden verschillende klanten en tientallen systemen waarmee we (willen) koppelen. Daarbij moet ook rekening gehouden worden met verschillende inrichtingen die de klant in die systemen gebruikt. De uitdaging is om al die verschillende soorten data op te halen en te stroomlijnen, zodat het vervolgens uniform en bruikbaar is voor de klantapplicaties. Met deze integratie sta je aan de basis die nodig is om een bruikbaar product te kunnen bieden. Hiervoor werk je veel samen met je team, klanten en systeembeheerders.Een voorbeeld van een nieuwe functionaliteit waar je aan kan werken:Je bouwt aan een nieuwe functionaliteit die ervoor zorgt dat de vacatures uit het HR-systeem worden ingelezen en verwerkt in de formatieplanning binnen Cogix. Dit doe je door te modelleren in Anago Assemble en Talend Open Studio. Je bedenkt hiervoor welke data en berekeningen nodig zijn zodat gebruikers uiteindelijk de juist resultaten te zien krijgen. Je let hierbij op functionaliteit, performance, gebruiksvriendelijkheid en dataveiligheid.Jouw teamJe werkt in een team met 7 data modelling experts, 3 data engineers, één solution designer en één product owner. Daarnaast werk je samen met het team van implementatieconsultants die de applicatie implementeren bij de klant.Collegialiteit vinden we belangrijk; je werkt veel samen met je collega’s, er is elke dag een dagstart en er wordt onderling veel samengewerkt binnen projecten. Je kunt veel van elkaar leren doordat we verschillende achtergronden en ervaringen hebben.Wat breng je mee? Je hebt een universitaire opleiding (of vergelijkbaar niveau) met een kwantitatief karakter (zoals Econometrie, Operations Research, Data Science, Toegepaste Wis-/natuurkunde, Technische bedrijfskunde).Je bent analytisch sterkJe kan goed samenwerkenJe bent nauwkeurig en gestructureerdJe bent creatief; bij nieuwe problemen (die je nog niet kent) kun je nieuwe oplossingen bedenken.Je bent geïnteresseerd in de techniek en werking achter dingen.Je hebt enige ervaring in het verwerken en omzetten van gegevens met bijvoorbeeld omgevingen als Python, databases of ETL omgevingen.Je bent starter of hebt enkele jaren ervaring.Je bent 32-40 uur per week beschikbaarWat kun je van ons verwachten? Je komt terecht in een snelgroeiende organisatie in een branche die volop in beweging is. We geloven in een goede werk-privé balans. Als jij met plezier naar je werk gaat, zien wij dat terug in de kwaliteit van je werk. En daar gaan we voor. We zijn betrokken bij elkaar en vinden naast resultaat, plezier van groot belang.Daarnaast kun je van ons de volgende arbeidsvoorwaarden verwachten:Een salaris van €3150,- voor een starter.Een winstdeling afhankelijk van je prestaties in de vorm van een bonus26 vakantiedagen en de mogelijkheid tot het bijkopen van 6 extra dagen of de mogelijkheid tot het inzetten van ATV-dagen.Ons kantoor is gevestigd naast centraal station ’s-Hertogenbosch waar je op flexibele tijden kan werken, ook heb je de mogelijkheid om thuis te werken met bijbehorend verzorgde thuiswerkplekEen persoonlijk opleidingsbudget (3% van gecombineerd jaarloon) om zelf je groei en ontwikkeling vorm te geven, want dat vinden wij belangrijk.Reiskostenvergoeding (gehele vergoeding van OV-kosten of een vergoeding van €0,21/km voor de auto of fiets)Regelmatig teamuitjes, bedrijfsuitjes, borrels en elke dag een verzorgde lunch op kantoor.Ben je geïnteresseerd?Laten we een kop koffie of thee drinken om elkaar te leren kennen. Voor meer informatie kun je mailen naar werkenbij@anago.nl

title: Data Engineer - Python, C#, Azure, SQL
description: Role: Senior Data Engineer Tech Stack: Python, C#, Azure, SQL, No SQL Industry: Climate ChangeLocation: Utrecht, NetherlandsOur hyper-growth, climate change scale up, use their AI and Machine Learning technology to generate robust business data to predict future climate change probabilities. As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for assisting in the design, development, and maintenance of our data processing systems. You will work closely with senior, experienced data scientists, data engineers, software developers and analysts to understand their data requirements and help build robust and efficient data pipelines to support their work.What You’ll Do:Assist in the design, development, prototyping, operations and implementation of data pipelines using technologies such as Python, SQL, DBT, AWS, Airflow, and our reporting tools.Work closely with the business to understand their data requirements and translate them into technical solutions.Collaborate with the machine learning team to understand their data requirements and provide data engineering solutions to support their model development, training, and deployment needs.Help to ensure the quality, accuracy, and security of data throughout its lifecycle, including data ingestion, collection, storage, processing, and analysis.Requirements:Strong software engineering skills including familiarity with Python, expertise in data manipulation using SQL and experience with version control systems.Experience writing production-level code and deploying code to production, including familiarity with containerization best practices.Familiarity with cloud-based data engineering and storage technologies such as Azure and orchestration tools such as Airflow.Knowledge of data modelling and database design principles.Understanding of data integration and ETL processes.Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.Strong communication and collaboration skills.A minimum of 2 years’ experience managing business critical data pipelines.Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field.Desirable:Basic understanding of machine learning concepts and workflows, and experience in working with data engineering solutions to support machine learning initiatives.If you are a talented Data Engineer looking to join a company of severe growth coupled with lots of opportunity to work on cutting edge, greenfield projects, then send a copy of your updated CV to this advertisement and to david.b@weareorbis.com

title: Data Engineer
description: (Freelance) Data Engineer12 Month ContractHourly Rate: €100-130Tech Stack: AWS, Docker, FastAPI, SnowflakeHybrid - AmsterdamFor a leading client, we are looking for several Data Engineers to work on a number of existing and upcoming projects. Key Responsibilities:Design and construct reliable, robust, and accurate data pipelines following established best practices.Transform source data to align with business needs.Assist the team in transitioning manual processes into a well-managed data environment.Collaborate with key stakeholders and other data consumers to gather and understand their requirements.Ensure the stability, robustness, and resilience of the projects you create, exercising a significant degree of autonomy while adhering to established standards.Provide ad-hoc support for database administration tasks as necessary.You will need: Proficiency in Snowflake architecture, data modeling, and administration.Experience in designing and implementing efficient ETL/ELT pipelines.Knowledge of PythonUnderstanding of dimensional modeling for Data Warehousing (Kimball).Proficient in writing SQL, creating stored procedures and views, optimizing complex queries, analyzing query performance, and utilizing partitioning and clustering.Strong problem-solving and data analysis skills.The capability to translate business requirements into technical solutions.The client are looking to interview at the earliest possibility with the intention of onboarding by the end of the month. Contact William Howard on william.howard@venturi-group.com for further information. Alternatively, if you are not available, who could you recommend from your network for this?

title: Data Engineer
description: About: The Data Engineer extracts, combines, transforms, loads, manipulates and cleanses data all whilst effectively handling interfaces to large amounts of data and creates/integrates data structures suitable for analysis. The Data Engineer must understand data architecture and data management. Develop and deploys algorithms in performance-efficient code in analytical and data platforms. Liaise with enterprise architects, data governors, and subject matter experts to fill any gaps in the requirements or design.Core Responsibilities:• Works and experiments with state-of-the-art data storage and processing technologies.• Builds large-scale batch and real-time data pipelines with data processing frameworks in cloud platforms or on-premise• Leverages best practices in continuous integration and delivery• Pre-process, clean and structures data to facilitate data exploration and advanced analytics/Machine Learning activities• Learns and uses modern data preparation, integration and AI-enabled metadata management tools and techniques.• Tracks data consumption patterns, working with data governance and information stewards within these teams, and participates in vetting and promoting content created in the business and by data scientists to the curated data catalogue for governed reuse• Performs intelligent sampling and caching.• Recommends and implements automation in existing and future integration flows.• Helps improve data quality by driving advancements in data acquisition, testing and tooling• Works in cross-functional agile teams to continuously experiment, iterate and deliver on new product objectives• Analyzes requested changes to fill in the details fitting in the complete picture and while doing that aligns with all parties involved (Architects, Data Governance, …), either as preparation for yourself or for data engineer colleagues, before starting the implementation.Education & Experience:• Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Computer Science preferred or equivalent combination of education and experience• Minimum 4 years of experience as a data engineer• Experience in (captive) financial services and understands the processes and execution models in financial services is an asset• Experience in Azure SQL, Azure Data Factory, Azure DevOps, Databricks, Delta Lake is a must, certification is recommended• Experience in working with high-volume heterogeneous data sets 2• Experience in agile software processes and data-driven development• Experience with data lakes and dimensional modelsRequired Competencies and Skills:• Azure Data Engineer Associate certification is recommended• Databricks Data Engineer Professional certification is recommended• Strive for clean, reusable and performant code• Skilled ETL/ELT developer• Strong understanding of data and information• Business savvy, understand information from a business perspective and use that to more effectively develop enabling technologies• Strong problem-solving and analytical skills• Goal-oriented and positive attitude to deliver against targets• Able to work independently and proactively• Global, open, innovative, holistic and goal-oriented mindset• Ability to set and meet deadlines• Ability to work in high-pressure situations• Excellent attention to detail• Advanced level of English, oral and writtenIf you are interested in this position or know someone who would be perfect for this role please contact us to find out all details of the position!

title: Data Engineer
description: Als Data Engineer codeer, automatiseer en onderzoek je nieuwe oplossingen voor CI/CD-gedreven data pipelines. Hierbij maak je gebruik van relevante en innovatieve oplossingen met behulp van AWS-, Azure- of Snowflake-technologie. Je maakt deel uit van projecten die onze Performance Improvement-expertise inzetten en concrete voordelen opleveren voor de klant.Ook werk je aan migraties waarbij on-premise-applicaties naar de AWS- of Azure-cloud worden gebracht. Vaak gaat het om miljarden records die tijdig en efficiënt verplaatst moeten worden, om bruikbare informatieproducten voor de business te realiseren.Voorbeelden van projecten:Voor de grootste pech-hulpverlener van Nederland realiseren we een Datahub waarin data voor de gehele organisatie beschikbaar wordt gesteld. Bij een openbaar vervoerbedrijf ontwikkelen we een modern datafundament o.b.v. cloud-technologie. Hierdoor kan de klant nóg meer waarde uit data halen. Voor een grote logistieke dienstverlener bouwen we een cloud native lakehouse als fundament onder een nieuw enterprise-breed BI-platform. HBO/WO werk- en denkniveauGezonde dosis relativeringsvermogen en gevoel voor humorScherpe ideeën en een open manier van communicerenKennis van Azure, AWS of Snowflake, maar Databricks en GCP zijn ook meer dan welkomErvaring met dataplatformen en warehouses met daarin Microsoft, Oracle of cloud native warehouse-oplossingen zoals Synapse, Redshift of Snowflake (en bijbehorende oplossingen om een lakehouse te kunnen vormgeven)Ervaring in datamodellering: derde normaalvorm – dimensioneel – data vaultBegrip en ervaring in concepten zoals CI/CD en infra-as-codeBeheersing van SQL, Python (en/of Powershell of Bash)Goede kennis van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal

title: Data Engineer Internship
description: Are you a student in the field of Data Engineering, Data Science and Analytics and looking to gain practical experience within a fast-moving international company? This is your chance! OMRON Healthcare is looking for a bright and creative Data Engineering student to join our dynamic team for an exciting internship!What will be your role?As a member of the EMEA Digital Health team, you will be working at the forefront of OMRON’s digital health revolution.Our Digital Health team is launching a range of new consumer health product, focused on digital services. Your role will be to design and implement data pipelines and analysis to generate insight and drive user engagement. At OMRON there is never a dull moment and you can expect that during your internship, you will:Design, implement and test data pipelinesBuild the infrastructure required for optimal data extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a variety of data sourcesCollaborate with domain experts to solve data challengesDevelop data reporting interfaces & dashboards to gain deeper insights into the performance of our servicesBe a voice to the data-driven strategies for the Digital Health teamWho are we looking for?A currently enrolled Master level student in the field of Data Engineering or Computer ScienceExperience programing with Python, SQL and working with AWS services (preferred)Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product developmentFamiliar with best practices such as CI/CD, testing and coding standardsUnderstanding of statistical techniques and conceptsCurious, open-minded and a fast learnerComfortable to work in a fast-paced environmentWhat is in it for you?Experience in an international healthcare company, working towards reducing the burdens of health management for everyoneLearn, understand, and implement best practice data security techniques when working with sensitive health dataExperience working in an ambitious and international team with a diverse skill setDuration 6 to 12 monthsPlease note: This is a full-time internship. Only applicants who are enrolled as students for the entire duration of the internship will be considered.

title: Analytics Engineer
description: About The JobAt Salonized, our Data Analytics team is responsible for building a BI platform that helps business teams get access to clean, accurate, well-modeled and intuitive data.As a Analytics Engineer, you will play a key role in shaping our data strategy, owning and improving our modern data stack, and delivering data models to fuel our reporting systems.Our newly formed stack consists of Stitch for data ingestion and dbt Cloud for transformation and orchestration. We store and process the data on AWS redshift, and use Tableau and Hex for reporting.You will be joining an enthusiastic team of analysts, and reporting to one of our Engineering Managers.How You Will Have An ImpactDesign and implement clean, ready-to-use data martsOwn the organisation’s data definitions and make them discoverable and understandable by people outside the data teamWork closely with Finance, Marketing, Growth and product teams to understand and bridge their analytical silosSet the standard for great engineering practices and advocate for data quality, testing and documentationCollaborate with Backend Engineers to ensure that the source data is architected with data in mind, flagging and helping to resolve data discrepanciesWith the help of the Cloud Engineers, monitor the health of our stack and set up observability, monitoring and alerting toolsYour superpowersFull proficiency in SQL and dbtGood understanding of data modeling techniques (preference towards dimensional modeling)Experience with analytical data warehouses (preferably Redshift), including query optimisationExperience working with reporting tools (Tableau/Looker)Comfortable with GitExcellent team player with strong business orientationNice to HaveExperience with Redshift administration (understanding cluster types, performance tuning, access management, cost optimisation)Experience with CI/CD and Github ActionsExperience working in a Cloud Environment (preferably AWS)Experience with a scripting language (preferably Python)Experience with TerraformWhat We OfferA competitive salary based on your experience;Free & delicious lunch every day in the office.Career opportunities and strong stimulation of personal development;MacBook, a Swapfiets (bike) in the city of your choice, and a museum card;Regular (some call it frequent) dinners, drinks, and parties;A yearly retreat with the whole team (oh my!);And to rest: 28 vacation days a year.What you can expect from our hiring process?Resume review: We check your resume to see if you’re a good fit.Video Screening: We get to know you a little better, and you us!Interview: You'll speak with two team members about your background and previous experiences.Case: We'll test your abilities through a practical exercise.Offer: The Salonized team welcomes you!**Please note that we do not offer relocation assistance for this position.Apply for this positionAbout UsAt Salonized, we are on a mission to make work beautiful for beauty professionals with our easy-to-use salon software. We believe we can transform the salon experience. Together with around 70 Salonizers, we work hard to create a phenomenal experience for our clients. With over 12.000 salons believing in us, we are the market leader in the Benelux. We are already expanding rapidly into new countries, and we’re not done yet. That’s where you come in.Apply for this position

title: Data Analytics Engineer
description: Vattenfall is een Europees energiebedrijf met ongeveer 20.000 werknemers werkzaam in diverse landen. Al meer dan 100 jaar houden we ons bezig met het electrificeren van industrieën, het leveren van energie aan de huizen van mensen en het moderniseren van onze manier van leven door innovatie en samenwerking. Vattenfall wil een fossielvrij leven mogelijk maken binnen één generatie. We lopen voorop in de transitie naar een duurzaam energiesysteem. Om dit ambitieuze doel te kunnen bereiken zijn wij op zoek naar getalenteerde personen die naast hun passie voor hun eigen rol ook een sterke teamspirit hebben en willen bijdragen aan het ondersteunen van een betekenisvolle bedrijfsmissie.Je zult deel uitmaken van de Vattenfall BtC (Business to Consumer) Data & Analytics afdeling, die op data gebaseerde oplossingen ontwikkelt voor onze klanten en klantprocessen. De afdeling is verdeeld in drie teams voor verschillende bedrijfsdomeinen; waar data-experts en zakelijke experts nauw samenwerken om waardevolle data science-oplossingen te realiseren. Elk Data & Analytics domein team bestaat uit een Analytics Translator, Analytics Engineers en Data Scientists, en wordt ondersteund door Data- & Machine Learning Engineers van IT.De afdeling werkt verdeeld in drie teams voor verschillende bedrijfsdomeinen; waar data-experts en zakelijke experts nauw samenwerken om waardevolle data-oplossingen te realiseren. Elk domein team bestaat uit een Analytics Translator, Analytics Engineers en Data Scientists, en wordt ondersteund door Data & Machine Learning Engineers van onze IT (Informatie Technologie) afdeling.We hechten waarde aan gezamenlijke ontwikkeling in manieren van werken en het delen van best practices. Dit wordt gefaciliteerd in onze data science autoriteit en data foundation autoriteit. Als Senior Analytics Engineer lever je een belangrijke bijdrage aan de Data Foundation autoriteit.Jouw rolAls Senior Analytics Engineer weet je hoe je de wensen van onze stakeholders kunt vertalen naar de juiste inzichten uit data. Je bent bekend met de beschikbare data bronnen op ons platform en hebt proactieve ideeën voor aanvullende bronnen die ons beter van dienst zouden zijn. Samen met relevante stakeholders stem je af en creëer je de nodige data definities. Je bent een expert als het gaat om data modellering. Je kent de voor- en nadelen van alternatieve oplossingen en zoekt naar de beste aanpak in elke situatie. Je creëert relevante datasets en dashboards en coacht gebruikers over hoe ze deze kunnen gebruiken. Je bent een actief lid van de data foundation autoriteit; voortdurend op zoek naar manieren om onze data producten naar een hoger niveau te tillen. Dit kan bijvoorbeeld worden gedaan door afstemming met je collega's over verbeterde standaarden, het toevoegen van nieuwe functionaliteiten voor eindgebruikers of het delen van nieuwe kennis met alle analytics engineers. Je brengt je enthousiasme over data over op de organisatie. In deze functie krijg je de kans om met innovatieve technologieën te werken en een impact te maken!Jouw Taken En VerantwoordelijkhedenVertaal de wensen van stakeholders naar duidelijke vereisten voor data producten.Creëer bruikbare inzichten voor verschillende stakeholders.Ontwikkel datasets en dashboards die gebruikers in staat stellen om hun vragen te beantwoorden.Leg op een eenvoudige manier uit hoe datasets en dashboards geïnterpreteerd en gebruikt kunnen worden door verschillende stakeholders.Breng enthousiasme over data over om de organisatie te inspireren en te betrekken.Benut data om trends, patronen en kansen voor bedrijfsgroei te identificeren.Werk samen met het team om het data model van de organisatie te verbeteren en data producten te verbeteren.Blijf op de hoogte van innovatieve technologieën op het gebied van data-analyse en gebruik ze om impact te genereren.Speel een cruciale rol in de ontwikkeling en implementatie van data oplossingen voor Vattenfall BtC.Als Senior Analytics Engineer ben je een sterke communicator en enthousiaste collega met een passie voor data. Je voelt je op je gemak in een breed stakeholder veld. Je bent analytisch, resultaatgericht en werkt graag in een wendbaar team. Daarnaast ben je proactief op zoek naar nieuwe oplossingen en standaarden om mee te werken.Daarnaast Voldoe Je Aan De Volgende CriteriaEen afgeronde HBO/WO-opleiding.Minimaal 7 jaar ervaring in een vergelijkbare rol.Meerdere jaren ervaring in een omgeving met grote hoeveelheden data.Zeer sterke Transact-SQL-vaardigheden.Ervaren professional als het gaat om Data Modeling en Dimensional Modeling.Sterke rapportagevaardigheden met Microsoft Power BI of vergelijkbare tools.Gewend om te werken met CICD, testen en code-reviews.Ervaring met de Agile manier van werken - Scrum.Gewend om te werken aan grote projecten of met een breed stakeholder veld.Aanvullende informatieWij biedenWij bieden je naast een marktconform salaris goede secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden, die je zelf voor een deel kunt samenstellen. Ook zijn er veel mogelijkheden je vakinhoudelijk en persoonlijk te ontwikkelen.Daarnaast kom je terecht in een moderne, dynamische en plezierige werkomgeving. Bij Vattenfall heerst een hechte teamcultuur waar tegelijkertijd volop ruimte is voor eigen initiatief.Standplaats van deze functie is Amsterdam, hybride werken is op dit moment de norm. We hechten bij Vattenfall veel waarde aan een goede werk-privé balans, wij blijven dus samen kijken hoe wij hier als werkgever aan bij kunnen dragen.

title: Data Engineer
description: Heb je verstand van de techniek achter data-gedreven werken? Ben je bekend met data engineering-tools en/of data platformen? Dan ben jij onze nieuwe Data Engineer!De functieWe zijn op zoek naar Data Engineers die ervaring hebben met het realiseren van (cloud gebaseerde) data driven oplossingen. Als Data Engineer overzie je processen en kun je deze vertalen naar oplossingen binnen (cloud) data platformen. Je adviseert en werkt in teams om technische oplossingen te realiseren. Je vindt het leuk om nieuwe technologieën te ontdekken, verder te verkennen en deze te delen met je collega’s en opdrachtgevers.Jouw profielAfgeronde HBO of WO opleidingAnalytisch en pragmatischKennis Azure, AWS of SplunkKennis van SQL en/of PythonKennis van data modellering en data logistiekHands-on ervaring bij BI projectenGoede beheersing van de Nederlandse taal, zowel in woord als geschriftPersoonlijkheidJe beschikt over goede communicatieve en sociale vaardigheden en vindt het interessant om technische uitdagingen aan te gaan. Binnen uiteenlopende projecten maakt jouw vakmanschap het verschil. Daarnaast ben je proactief ingesteld en werk je graag in teamverband. Verder vinden wij het ook belangrijk dat je jezelf kunt herkennen in onze kernwaarden: People, Fun, Technology, Knowledge, Aim high en Open & Involved.ALTEN biedtSamen gaan wij op zoek naar een uitdagende opdracht, waarin jouw groei centraal staat en jouw kwaliteiten het best naar voren komen. Daarnaast geloven wij dat je als IT’er nooit bent uitgeleerd en daarom krijg je bij ons de mogelijkheid om je zowel persoonlijk als vakinhoudelijk verder te ontwikkelen. Onze consultants organiseren bijvoorbeeld regelmatig kennisavonden over nieuwe technologieën, waaraan jij kunt deelnemen. Of misschien vindt jij het zelf leuk om met je collega’s een kennisavond te organiseren?Als jij de gesprekken net zo leuk als wij hebt ervaren, dan krijg je een vast contract. De volgende stap is het uitzoeken van een telefoon en auto. Wij maken je laptop gereed en je bent klaar om aan de slag te gaan. Hard werken wordt bij ons beloond met een goed salaris en een bonus, maar relaxen vinden wij net zo belangrijk, dus krijg je van ons 27 vakantiedagen. Niet genoeg? Dan kun je er nog 10 bij kopen. Over je pensioen hoef je je geen zorgen te maken, dat regelen wij voor je (premievrije pensioenregeling).Met je mentor en Business Manager ga jij je nieuwe avontuur aan en krijg je vanuit ons de juiste begeleiding. Samen zorgen wij ervoor dat jij je ambities kunt verwezenlijken.ALTENALTEN IT maakt onderdeel uit van ALTEN Nederland en is gespecialiseerd in consultancy op het gebied van BI en Analytics, Software Development, Softwaretesten, Agile, Cloud en Internet-of-Things en dit binnen verschillende branches. Bij ons kom je terecht in een divers en hecht team, dat zich bezig houdt met de laatste ontwikkelingen.Onze klanten bevinden zich in de top 100 van Nederland. De klantenkring varieert van overheden en energiemaatschappijen tot financiële instellingen, zakelijke dienstverleners, hightech bedrijven en telecomproviders.Wij bieden volop uitdagingen. Solliciteer daarom nu om deel uit te maken van ons gezellige team!InformatieNeem voor meer informatie vrijblijvend contact op met een van onze Corporate Recruiters: regio Zuid (locatie Eindhoven) via +31(0)40-256 3080. Je kunt ook een e-mail sturen naar: sollicitatie@alten.nl

title: Marketing Analytics Engineer
description: Are you an experienced marketing analytics engineer who can connect the dots between organizing and analyzing first-party data and the communication channels that companies are using? Then we would love to meet you!Your roleCrystalloids specializes in Cloud For Marketing, officially called Marketing Analytics by Google, which is a mix of technology and analytics that helps companies optimise their marketing efforts by making better use of their first-party (own) data.Most companies are using the Google Marketing Platform services such as Display & Video 360, Search Ads 360, Analytics360 and other services such as Facebook. The combined power of both Google Cloud Platform and Google Marketing Platform enables data-driven companies to provide better experiences to customers and improve marketing and services ROI significantly.Main responsibilities and tasksAs an experienced product owner and consultant with data engineering knowledge, you will help our customers develop and improve their current marketing initiatives based on data and analytics. Applying the Google Cloud technologies you will support our clients to improve collecting, transforming, analyzing, visualizing and activating data and models into the sales and marketing processes.Reporting directly to the Managing Partner you will; PLAN; make backlogs and suggest sprint planning based on adding value.DO;engineer the collection and transformation of data to prepare for analysis and visualizationimplement activation of information into media channelsCHECK; design reporting to analyse the effectiveness of the proposed changesACT; adjust and improve the activation and analysis of the marketing campaigns. Present the outcome to stakeholdersYour profile Bachelor and/or Master in Computer Science and/or Economics, InformaticsConsultancy, Product Owner and Scrum management skills3+ years of experience and knowledge of;Statistics (and/or Machine Learning), data engineering (how to prepare for data sciences work) and privacy rules. Understanding of how algorithms of digital advertising platforms work.Marketing Platforms;Google Marketing Platform, social media, Amazon e-commerce platform, email, tag management toolsGoogle Cloud Platform, GSuite, Google Spreadsheets, Google DocsPython, SQL, Javascript and Regular ExpressionsData visualization toolsCustomer journeys, Webpages and Web analytics softwareEnglish writing skills, speaking Dutch is a plusWhat we offerCompetitive salary with an interesting bonus and pension schemeExcellent work/life balance and up to 28 days of annual leave Freedom to work from one of our offices in Rotterdam, Amsterdam or other "Spaces" locations across the Netherlands and join Spaces' events and workshops.Flexibility to work from home or abroadA laptop and first-class travel arrangement by public transportAn opportunity to develop yourself through different (technical) coursesAn international environment with a start-up vibe - no need for a suit at the office!About Crystalloids* WE ONLY ACCEPT APPLICATIONS FROM CANDIDATES ALREADY RESIDING IN THE NETHERLANDS *Crystalloids was founded in 2006 and as a team of qualified data specialists we help organisations innovate and grow their business by building solutions in Google Cloud. We have been an official Google Cloud partner since 2011. At Crystalloids, the foundation for a successful solution is based on three dimensions: the people, the processes and the technology. We always take these three dimensions into account when we build solutions for our customers.We gained a very respectable client portfolio over the years. Our clients operate in market segments like retail, e-commerce, CPC, media, telecom, finance and insurance and are based in the Netherlands and in other European countries: Rituals, PVH, Swiss Sense, KNVB, Body & Fit, CoolBlue, FD Mediagroep, de Bijenkorf, HEMA, ACSI and others.What's next?Are you interested in the above vacancy for Marketing Analytics Engineer? Crystalloids is looking forward to receive your application! By clicking on the 'apply' button in this job listing, you'll be directed to the original posting where you can take a few effortless steps to submit your application for Marketing Analytics Engineer.

title: Analytics Engineer - Partner Analytics
description: How do you make our customers happy? At bol.com, we are dedicated to making daily life more convenient for our customers. We do that via our own retailer as well as via the 51.000+ selling partners. As Analytics Engineer, you build the data analytics foundation for the partner business of bol.com. That takes more than analytical and engineering skills; it also requires you to be a team player and understand a platform business. Right up your alley? Welcome aboard! The biggest challenge Bol.com excels at data-driven decision making. Analytics teams support product & business teams in providing direction, setting up experiments and monitoring processes. With state-of-the-art tools, processing power and high-quality data sources we transform Terabytes of data on a daily basis. The challenge we are facing is; how do we make sure all these data transformations are of high quality?The Analytics Engineer curates the data so that data analysts in teams can do their work more effectively. Analytics engineers improve data quality by bringing the rigor of software engineering to our analytics code while, at the same time, bringing a deep business understanding into the data transformation process.What You Do As Analytics EngineerAs Analytics Engineer, you’ll land in a central data & analytics team which is on a mission to make sure all decisions across our partner business teams are data-driven (>100 colleagues). Your team (~10 colleagues) focuses on several mission-critical topics such as building an integral view on our partners using different data sources, monitoring the quality of our partners, understanding and targeting our valuable partners at the right time and experimenting with new business solutions.You will support your colleagues in the analytics team to create high quality data pipelines. Clean Code principles such as test-driven development, meaningful names, small functions, DRY, are what you practise and preach. You ensure data transformations are tested, documented, monitored, logged, performant and adhere to our security & privacy policies. Next to that, you will be involved in some data heavy projects like developing and maintaining some of the bol.com KPIs. You use tools and concepts like; Git, CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes, Python, SQL, Airflow, dbt , data testing, monitoring and alerting, to create a state-of-the-art analytics environment that enforces quality standards. You develop, monitor and safeguard the partner business KPIs, and consult with colleague Data Analysts. You use your strong communication skills to train and support your colleague Data Analysts in the ways of the Analytics Engineer through pair-programming and workshops. You’re an ambassador for our analytics platform and help colleagues take a more data-driven approach, for example, by modelling and creating highly valuable datasets. Why you can make the difference Because you’re an enthusiastic team player who lives and breathes software engineering & analytics. You combine solid technical skills with the ability to translate abstract problems into specific code improvements. You enjoy discussing insights with colleagues and are open to feedback. You inspire your team to reframe challenges as opportunities.3 reasons why this is (not) for you - Passive You have a hard time forming and expressing your opinion. Your contribution in meetings is generally limited to shaking your head and nodding - Output over outcome Your work ends when you complete a feature – who cares how users experience it - Conservative You're not curious to new techniques and methods and rely on one-trick-pony power #safetyfirst + High quality code & data You have a background in software engineering and a deep interest in analytics (>2 years experience) + SQL, dbt, Git & Python SQL, dbt, Git & Python are your home away from home + Sharing is caring You like to share your knowledge and experiences with others It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.

title: Data Scientist
description: I am currently working with an Agritech scale up, who are on the look out for an experienced data scientist to join their growing team in Amsterdam. They are innovating in the field of vertical farming and autonomous greenhouses, with the aim of solving global food insecurityResponsibilities:You will play a vital role in development and implementation of data science strategy and use data to improve organizational growth, continuous improvements and iterations.Be a part of the main link between the business, customers and technology solutions by providing valuable insights through modelling and transforming datasets to help us make decisions and build customer solutions.Lead the strategic design, delivery and maintenance of the data science work that give meaningful insights on our performance, support the company's priorities and accelerate innovation.Have end-to-end ownership of data science work and lead alignment on all solutions developed through collaboration.Help build a data-driven culture within through data science workRequirements:- Strong knowledge of Python- Professional working experience within data science (2+ years of experience)- Experience with machine learning models is essential- Experience with the agriculture sector is beneficial but not required- Willingness to work with or previous experience in sensor dataSalary Package:• Up to €95,000 per annum (D.O.E)• Travel allowance• Hybrid working and the ability to work remotely for 4 weeks of the year• Annual bonus. (usually 5-8%!)• Pension scheme and 25 days of holiday (possibility to buy extra days)Feel free to apply below, or contact me on the following:Phone: +31203997864Email: joe.woodard@vividresourcing.com

title: Data Scientist
description: DATA SCIENTIS WI-FI AND SMART HOME POSITIONFreelancer: 40 hours per week for a period of at least 6 months.Permanent: 40 hours per week LOCATIONFreelancer: Connect with us from anywhere in the world, as long as you groove to the rhythm of Amsterdam's dynamic timezone.Permanent: Join us in the vibrant heart of Amsterdam, Netherlands, where innovation meets tradition. ABOUT GAMGEE Based in the lively city of Amsterdam, Netherlands, Gamgee is a trailblazing user experience firm at the intersection of technology and innovation. Our mission is to empower users through our digital platform, allowing them to effortlessly manage their wireless networks, smart devices, internet access, parental controls, and cybersecurity measures. But that's just the beginning! We also offer identity protection, robust work-from-home solutions, and smart home monitoring and automation services. With Gamgee by your side, taking control of the digital realm has never been more intuitive or accessible. COMPANY CULTURE AND VALUES At Gamgee, we're committed to putting our customers at the forefront of everything we do. Our promise is to deliver an exceptional personal experience in the world of smart homes. We're all about simplifying complex technologies into user-friendly solutions, designed to enhance everyday living while fostering a profound sense of safety and tranquility. We're not just a tech company; we're a partner in the journey to a smarter, safer, and more connected home. JOB SUMMARY Ready to embark on a transformative journey with us? Gamgee is searching for a talented Data Scientist to join our passionate team. As we lead the charge in reshaping the smart home landscape, you'll play a pivotal role in harnessing Wi-Fi sensing data to create groundbreaking algorithms. These algorithms will not only redefine home security but also empower fall detection, pet and child monitoring, home automation, and so much more. Your work will be pivotal in realizing our vision of a smarter, safer, and more connected world. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Channel your expertise in DNN, RNN, and CNN to create, refine, and evolve AI algorithms that will drive our innovative applications.Craft algorithms for motion detection, localisation, categorisation, and assigning motions to people, pets, objects, and more.Collaborate seamlessly with cross-functional teams, including Wi-Fi specialists, to ensure your innovations seamlessly integrate into our product offerings.Be at the forefront of developing advanced solutions for home security and automation. QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS Bring your 2 to 5 years of expertise to the table, preferably in a similar role.Master the art of AI/ML, and if you have an inkling of Wi-Fi enthusiasm, all the better.Your ability to communicate and your business acumen are as sharp as your algorithms. EXPERIENCE: 2 TO 5 YEARS, PREFERABLY COLLABORATION You're not just joining a team; you're joining a movement. We embrace Agile Scrum methodologies, fostering innovation collaboratively. While you’ll have the independence to excel in your tasks, you’ll also be an integral part of a team that includes Wi-Fi specialists – experts you can rely on for their domain knowledge. TOOLS AND TECHNOLOGIES Python is your primary instrument, as your algorithms will be embedded in router software. Proficiency in other relevant programming languages is a plus.Dive into structured and unstructured data, and utilize industry reference data to unlock the full potential of your algorithms. REPORTING You'll report directly to the visionary CEO of Gamgee. APPLICATION PROCES AND CONTACT INFORMATION Ready to embark on this exciting journey? Send your resume and a captivating cover letter to hr@gamgee.com. At Gamgee, we move fast, so expect two or three rounds of interviews within an exhilarating 2-week timeframe. For inquiries and applications, please contact hr@gamgee.com to start your vibrant career adventure with us. Your journey to shaping the future of smart homes begins here!

title: Python Engineering & Machine Learning Internship
description: Welcome to SkillLabAt SkillLab, we envision a world where everyone has equal career opportunities. We enable and lead a radical change - a focus on skills instead of titles and degrees. Our AI-driven technology creates more inclusive and efficient labor markets. SkillLab is working with employment and career services in 25+ countries and seeks to transform labor and education markets globally.Your opportunityYou will experience the culture of a technology start-up company with a social missionYou will work in an international team with team members from +25 countries and clients across the globeYou will work closely with the the data science team to provide data-driven insights to every part of SkillLab and its clientsYour teamYou will work closely with Aaron who leads the data science team and has many years of experience in multiple industries in data science and AI. The data science team consists of two more data scientists, Rihab and Anna.Rihab is specialised in taxonomies. Her responsibilities include developing and maintaining our taxonomies' data structures, as well as training and evaluating NLP models. Anna is specialised in recommendation systems.We are proud of the people we work with and excited to work in a company with a social mission. We hope you will be too!What You Will DoYou will work with our Lead data scientist and DevOps engineer to manage our deployment processYou will maintain the libraries and codebase of our production recommender service. You will help us strengthen the machine learning processes on multiple cloud platforms and assist in training models. You will assist the data science team in developing internal tools for both prototyping and experimentationRequirementsIs this you?You have studied in a field like computer science, data science, or other quantitative fieldsYou are very comfortable in Python and enjoy optimising codeYou have a demonstrated ability to create applications using python web frameworks such as Flask or DjangoYou are familiar with PostgreSQL or similarYou have a demonstrable knowledge of Docker and comfortable with GitYou are eligible to work in the Netherlands. We don’t support visa applications for applicants from outside the EUYou are currently enrolled as a student in your final year or graduated within the last 12 monthsYou are able to commit to a six month internshipExtra awesomeExperience with KubernetesFamiliar with deployment on GCP or AzureCompensation, start-date & locationThis is a paid internship. If you live in Amsterdam or relocate to Amsterdam during your internship, then the monthly reimbursement is will be 1.000 EURYou can do the internship by living in another city in the Netherlands and commuting to the office 1-2 days per week. If you do the internship remotely, then the monthly reimbursement will be 700 EUR. SkillLab covers your train commuting expenses to AmsterdamWe accept applications on rolling basis and we envision a start date in January/February 2024BenefitsYou will have a personal learning budget to invest in your professional developmentYou will have access to mentors & coaches (SkillLab is part of the Google for Startups SDG accelerator)You will have access to a monthly flexible budget of benefits via Yourcampus app. You can spend this budget on a large selection of providers, ranging from gym memberships to bike subscriptions and online storesYou will join our bi-annual company offsite retreats in different locations like Belgium, Germany etcOur selection procedureYou apply for the role and we review your profileWe will invite you for a short screening callWe will invite you for a 60min interview if we find that you are a good fit. The interview will involve a live coding testWe will offer you the internship and discuss logistics, if we think that you are the ideal candidate for the roleWhat else to know?This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the internship position and may be subject to change based on the organization's requirements and prioritiesIf this job is not for you, perhaps you have a friend who might be a good fit. Send them this job posting!Get 3 tips for your application: https://skilllab.io/en-us/news/skilllabjobapplication SkillLab is committed to diversity, equality, and inclusion at the workplace. We welcome applications of candidates from all backgrounds

title: Data scientist
description: FunctiebeschrijvingAls Data Engineer ben je verantwoordelijk voor het inrichten & onderhouden van het Datawarehouse van een mobiele app. Hierin heb je zowel een strategische als uitvoerende rol en ben je degene die overkoepelend kijkt naar mogelijkheden om data steeds slimmer in te zetten ten behoeve van relevantie voor de users van de app. Deze rol geeft jou als ervaren Data Engineer de mogelijkheid in samenwerking met de verschillende development teams tot gezamenlijke inzichten te komen en het datawarehouse verder op te zetten en aan te sluiten op de dagelijkse activiteiten van de app. Het datawarehouse is een belangrijke spil waarin data van veel verschillende bronnen samenkomen om de verschillende use cases binnen de app te ondersteunen. De engineer is bij uitstek iemand die vanuit de verschillende doelen/use cases de vertaling kan maken naar de technische invulling en hierbij zowel bronnen in front- als back end aan elkaar weet aan te sluiten. Wat ga je doen?Je onderhoudt en sluit verschillende (interne) bronnen (zowel front- als back end bronnen) aan;je creëert een toekomstvaste visie met betrekking tot inzetten van data; je koppelt de warehouse aan verschillende web en app omgevingen.Wie ben jij? Ervaring met het onderhouden van een data warehouse & data pipeline architectuur (binnen AWS) Ervaring met gangbare tooling in data: Airflow, dbt, Metabase, PowerBI, Redis, e.a. Ervaring met het opzetten van complexe ETL pipelines en orchestration van deze ETL processen (binnen AWS) Ervaring met AWS (specifiek: Redshift, Aurora Serverless, DynamoDB, & RErvaring met CI/CD processen (Pre) gecertificeerd: AWS Certified Data Analytics – Specialty Wat bieden wij jou? De mogelijkheid om jezelf verder te ontwikkelen (professioneel en persoonlijk) via ons Live your potential programma. Dit is een aanrader voor zowel starters als ervaren professionals;een competitief salaris;100% reiskostenvergoeding met het openbaar vervoer, € 0,21 cent per kilometer met de auto;een internationale omgeving en diversiteit;pensioenopbouw direct bij aanvang van je opdracht;25 vakantiedagen per jaar.Een brutomaandsalaris tussen €4.250,- en €4.950,- op basis van een 40-urige werkweekInteresse in deze vacature? Solliciteer via deze pagina, of neem direct contact op met recruiter Sara Carlos Campos via s.carloscampos@wearekayak.com of 0629677665.

title: Machine Learning Engineer

The company focuses on creating easy-to-use devices that provide personalized training and real-time monitoring. wearM.AI is based in Enschede and offers a dynamic and creative work environment.Role DescriptionThis is a contract position (towards a full-time job) for a Machine Learning Engineer who specializes in Computer Vision. you will be responsible for designing and implementing machine learning algorithms and developing pattern recognition models. title: Sustainability Data Scientist
description: About OlamOlam Agri supplies food, feed and fibre to meet rising demand and a shift to protein-based diets, particularly in Asian and African countries. Headquartered in Singapore and present on all continents, our value chains include farming, processing and distribution operations, as well as a sourcing network of an estimated 2.5 million farmers. Our teams have built leadership positions in many Olam Agri businesses, including rice, flour, animal feed, sesame, cotton, wood, and more. As a purpose-driven company, we aim to contribute positively to the prosperity and well-being of people along our supply chains, the protection and regeneration of our natural resource base, and the fight against climate change.Role OverviewThe global climate crisis requires us to reduce global GHG to net-zero emissions by 2050 in line with the Paris 1.5 agreement; to do so whilst feeding 10 billion people sustainably and ensuring inclusive growth, is the greatest challenge of our lifetime. With some 2.5 million farmers and 10 million hectares in our supply chains, and our on-the-ground ground presence -- throughout grower programmers, our farms and processing units, and our supply and distribution networks -- OGA businesses can make a tangible, positive impact for people, nature and the climate. As part of the Corporate Responsibility & Sustainability department, you will ensure that the company accurately and transparently reports on its environmental, social and governance (ESG) performance. You will also play a key role in helping Olam Agri measure its impact and integrate sustainability considerations across its businesses and operations. The responsibilities of the Sustainability Data Scientist / Researcher will includeDesigning studies to support sustainability programming and risk management.Identifying and building alignment around the key questions to answer and metrics to measure, to help the company achieve its sustainability goals and drive decision-making.Developing metrics, methodologies, surveys and tools for measuring sustainability baseline, outputs and impactsTopics may include, inter alia, farmer incomes, food security, drivers of farm yields, women’s empowerment, child labor, post-harvest loss, deforestation, carbon emissions. Collecting and analyzing dataCollating and analyzing data related to Olam Agri’s ESG performance and impact.Generating insights from large amounts of data and developing practical systems for relevant business users to access and visualize data insights. Guidance, training and quality control Training and guiding workstream leads and survey enumerators.Ensuring quality study design and analysis conducted within team’s workstream. Communication & disclosuresCollect, Analyse and prepare data for sustainability reporting, considering reporting standards such as GRI, TCFD, SASB/ISSB, and CDP.Keep up to date with the latest developments and best practices in sustainability impact measurement, reporting and disclosures.Supporting responses to inquiries from banks and investors Continually improving data processesIdentifying opportunities to automate data collection and management and improving online systems.Advancing supply chain traceability, in collaboration with finance, IT and commercial departmentsMaintaining documentation of processes and methodologies around data collection, ESG metrics/indicators and calculation methodologies The candidate will collaborate with a wide range of internal stakeholders for the execution of the above, including the CSO, CR&S unit leads) environment, social, governance and partnerships), business managers, IT, Internal Audit, Risk, Finance and Human Resources.QualificationsA personal passion for sustainable agriculture and food systemsExcellent data sourcing and analysis capabilitiesA good eye for designing clear and impactful graphical visualizations of data insights.Strong & clear communication and presentation skillsFamiliarity with in ESG reporting frameworks, social impact measurement, carbon footprint accounting, and survey design.University degree related to data analytics, statistics, internal audit or another relevant domain.10+ years of relevant experience, such as in ESG reporting, monitoring & evaluation, sustainability audits or ESG risk analysis

title: Data Scientist
description: Data ScientistLocation: UtrechtHybrid modelDuration: 1+ year rolling contractPreventing Money Laundering & Terrorist Financing is crucial in our society, and as a leading organisation in the banking industry, we play a vital role. We seek a talented individual like yourself who thrives on analysing data, identifying patterns, and uncovering illegal activities to join our team.As a Data Scientist, you will optimise our current Transaction Monitoring (TM) system and ensure its future-proof by incorporating advanced analytics methodologies like Machine Learning.Position Overview:Our TM system evaluates millions of transactions daily and needs to perform within specified computing time and resource constraints. It is an ongoing development, with new computationally intensive functionality being added. Your role will be to optimise the performance of model components. However, this task is more than just technical; you will also need to thoroughly understand the functionality of the model and its elements within the context of transaction monitoring.Requirements:Academic degree (MSc/PhD) in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or a related field (required)Strong software development skills, including Git, bash scripting, release management, and proven success in bringing analytics models to production (required)Minimum of 5 years of experience in advanced analytics, modelling, or artificial intelligence activities with large data sets (required)Highly skilled in Python, PySpark, and Spark (required), with experience in Azure Databricks (preferred)Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English (required)Ideal Candidate:Motivated by the opportunity to make a measurable impact, such as catching criminals, rather than solely focusing on building complex analytics modelsStructured, precise, and communicative, with the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse individuals and rolesThrives in a high-impact, dynamic, and fast-paced environmentProactive, results-oriented, and has a business-focused mindset to fight financial crime effectivelyResponsibilities:The successful candidate will be responsible for delivering the following results:Enhancing functionality within our data model (TDM) while efficiently integrating all required data sources (30+) for Transaction Monitoring. These sources include transaction data, logging data from sources like CNA, AZS, PEX, RASS, as well as enrichment data from sources like Siebel, Omnikassa, Geldmaat, VCM.Ensuring the TDM design enables Rabobank to comply with regulatory, audit, and internal requirements, including building versions on both account and customer levels.Establishing the TDM as a solid building block that can function independently and be leveraged by other KYC/TM projects.Optimising the computational performance of the TDM for daily batch scoring and one-off runs on multiple years of data using (Py)Spark.Assignment Description:The assignment aims to add functionality to our data model (TDM) to meet regulatory deadlines related to Transaction Monitoring model changes, lookbacks, and tuning & back testing.The added functionality should be computationally optimised. Once set up and running, it will become a business-as-usual task that requires no external support.Regular alignment with technical and non-technical stakeholders, such as product owners, to ensure progress and results are on track.The Model Developer will review and accept proposed solutions that align with technical and functional requirements.

title: Data Scientist
description: Marbazzar is designed for the Gen-Z and Alpha consumers who demand engaging, interactive, and personalized shopping experiences. Our platform allows users to create personalized 3D avatars using Generative AI, reflecting their unique body shapes and sizes, promoting a body-positive shopping environment. 🙌From static 2D images to dynamic 360° 3D experiences, Marbazzar brings products to life right before your eyes. Shoppers can try on clothes virtually, reducing the rate of returns and increasing buyer satisfaction.For our e-commerce partners, we offer an opportunity to boost conversions and provide an immersive shopping experience to customers.At Marbazzar, we believe in a greener planet and by reducing return rates, we aim to contribute to a more sustainable future. 🎉If you are passionate about designing cutting-edge, AR technology and believe in our mission to transform the online shopping experience, we'd love to hear from you!ResponsibilitiesAssist with data collection and preprocessing;Implement machine learning models for geometry textures and poses;Implement data flows for the machine learning pipelines;Deployment of machine learning models to development environment;Monitor and evaluate model output performance metrics;Track experimental evaluations;Design and implement simple APIs.QualificationsFluent in Python 3 is a MUST, demonstrate by code sample;pyTorch and/or Tensorflow;Some understanding in image processing;Some understanding in 3D Graphics;Nice to have training machine learning model;Passion in 2D to 3D conversion, 3D Graphics, and machine learning.CompensationTop-tier salary and benefits;Free office food and drinks;Gym and internet reimbursements;High-end gear for specific roles;Paid time off with 20 working days minimum;Unlimited sick days;Full maternity leave;13th-month salary bonus.Employer of Equal OpportunitiesAt Marbazzar, our core values are Integrity, Innovative Courage, People-Centricity, Zero Tolerance for Broken, Customer Centricity, Embracing Diversity, and Striving for Simplicity. We are firmly committed to being an employer that values equality, fostering a workspace where diversity and inclusion form the very essence of our identity.Our aim is to bring together a workforce that mirrors the diversity of our customer base, enabling us to design products and services that optimally cater to our clients' needs. We firmly adhere to the principle of non-discrimination in our employment practices. We do not base our employment decisions on race, color, religion, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status.In all our practices, we strictly comply with the Dutch employment laws, ensuring that our commitment to equal opportunity extends to all aspects of employment.

title: Data Scientist
description: Our client is an innovative startup based in the heart of Amsterdam, acquired by a leading insurance company in the UK. This strategic partnership provides them with a solid financial foundation while allowing them to maintain their startup culture and agility. Nestled in the vibrant Science Park in Amsterdam, our client is expanding their team to capitalize on their recent success.Role Overview:Our client is on the lookout for a skilled Data Scientist to join their dynamic team. In this role, you'll play a crucial part in uncovering valuable insights from extensive datasets, contributing to smarter decision-making, risk reduction, and improved service delivery. As they integrate with their new parent company, your primary focus will be on applying data mining techniques, statistical analysis, and building predictive systems that enhance their product offerings.Key Responsibilities:Develop and maintain reproducible data pipelines from raw data sources to actionable insights, utilizing literate programming narratives.Utilize open-source software, including command-line tools, emacs, org-mode, and a Python stack (numpy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) for robust data solutions.Document assumptions, hypotheses, tests, and evidence within data pipelines, ensuring transparency and traceability.Collaborate in a hybrid Agile environment with a startup mindset, contributing to innovation and excellence.Skills and Qualifications:Strong understanding of current machine learning techniques and algorithms.Proficiency in Python and experience with data science libraries (numPy, pandas, scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch).Excellent communication skills for conveying complex technical concepts to diverse stakeholders.Hands-on experience with data visualization tools such as matplotlib, seaborn, D3.js, GGplot, etc.Familiarity with RDBMSs and proficiency in SQL.Solid scripting and programming skills, including knowledge of bash and Unix command-line tools.If you have a PhD in a relevant field or teaching experience, this would be considered a great assetOffered:Competitive salary: up to €55,000Pension scheme for financial security€30 net gym budget for well-beingSwappfiets subscription for convenient commuting25 days of holiday leave for work-life balanceHybrid work environment, combining the flexibility of remote work with collaborative in-office sessions.Join our client at this exciting juncture as they combine the agility of a startup with the stability of an established insurance company. Apply now to be a key player in their growth story!

title: Data Scientist AI
description: CIMSOLUTIONS AI is een nieuwe business unit van CIMSOLUTIONS. Onze missie is het leveren van innovatieve softwareproducten en oplossingen met de hoogste business value voor het bedrijfsleven en de overheid, gebaseerd op Artificial Intelligence en Data Science. We bevinden ons in een spannende fase van groei en expansie, en we zijn op zoek naar een getalenteerde en ambitieuze Data Scientist AI die ons kan helpen om ons doel te realiseren.Als Data Scientist AI ben je verantwoordelijk voor het vergaren van waardevolle inzichten uit Data door geavanceerde analysetechnieken toe te passen. Daarnaast ben je in staat om deze resultaten helder te presenteren. Je identificeert meerdere gegevensbronnen en zorgt voor consistentie van gegevenssets. Je benut passende wiskundige modellen, selecteert en optimaliseert AI/ML algoritmes om bedrijfswaarde te leveren door middel van vergaarde inzichten. Je bent bedreven in het identificeren van patronen en het aanbevelen van toepassingen voor de gegevens.Wat breng jij mee?Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding met een sterk ICT-component;Ervaring met het structureren en analyseren van grote hoeveelheden data om daarin relevante inzichten te ontdekken;Kennis van gangbare AI/ML algoritmes, data verwerkerings- en analyse-technieken, en/of andere statistische methodes;Kennis van Python, R, Matlab en/of Julia (of vergelijkbaar) en respectievelijke ML libraries (zoals TensorFlow, Keras, SKLearn, Caffe, Torch, Flux);Kennis van en ervaring met databasetechnologieën zoals SQL/NoSQL of vergelijkbaar;Ervaring met het visualiseren van data met behulp van de laatste state-of-the-art technologieën;Uitstekende communicatieve vaardigheden in zowel Nederlands als Engels;Een geldig rijbewijs B.Wat bieden wij?Een business unit gericht op AI, waarin jij jouw ambities en visie voor AI samen met andere specialisten in ons AI team kunt realiseren en delen.Een stimulerende en innovatieve werkomgeving die oplossingsgericht met je meedenkt.Naast een dienstverband voor onbepaalde tijd, een max. salaris van € 8.000, bonusregeling, leaseauto, pensioenregeling en maandelijkse onkostenvergoeding;€ 5.000,- opleidingsbudget en daarnaast 5-10 dagen studietijd;Kennissessies met o.a. SIG Data Analytics en Competence Center Data Analyse, Big data en BI25 vakantiedagen en snel oplopend tot 28 vakantiedagen per jaar;Het aan- of verkopen van vakantiedagen;Regelmatig sociale uitjes zoals sportdagen, weekendjes weg en gezellige borrels.Waarom werken voor CIMSOLUTIONS?Werken bij CIMSOLUTIONS betekent werken bij een dynamische, financieel gezonde organisatie. CIMSOLUTIONS is een middelgroot bedrijf, hetgeen tot uiting komt in de persoonlijke aandacht voor onze medewerkers en onze platte organisatiestructuur. We bieden jou persoonlijke ontwikkeling aan en zo werk je aan jouw carrière. Learn, create and make it work is niet alleen onze slogan, maar is ons DNA. Als Data Scientist kun je doorgroeien naar diverse rollen, zoals Data Science Consultant.Als jij de juiste persoon bent om ons AI team te versterken en een belangrijke rol in de ontwikkeling van onze AI producten, aarzel dan niet om te solliciteren. Stuur je cv en motivatiebrief naar recruitment@cimsolutions.nl of bel naar 0347-368100 of bezoek onze website www.cimsolutions.nl/Werken-bij.

title: AI Developer
description: As an AI Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and implementing artificial intelligence solutions to improve business processes, enhance decision-making capabilities, and drive innovation. You will work collaboratively with a team of experts to create cutting-edge AI solutions that meet the needs and requirements of our organization. Your expertise and knowledge in AI will play a key role in building internal and external capabilities.Essential Duties:Design and develop machine learning models and algorithms to solve complex business problems and improve decision-making processes.Develop robust data engineering solutions to ingest, preprocess, and transform large volumes of structured and unstructured data for AI applications.Train AI models using various techniques such as supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and reinforcement learning, and deploy them to production environments.Continuously refine and optimize AI solutions to improve accuracy, performance, and scalability, and minimize resource usage.Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, and domain experts to translate business requirements into AI models and solutions, ensuring alignment with organizational objectives.Keep abreast of advancements in the field of AI, including new algorithms, frameworks, and tools, and evaluate their potential for enhancing existing systems or developing new solutions.Requirements:Proficiency in programming (e.g., Python) and machine learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).Strong mathematical foundation (linear algebra, calculus, statistics).Knowledge of deep learning and neural networks.Data preprocessing and feature engineering skills.Experience with cloud platforms and model deployment.Full fluency in Dutch is preferred.Minimum Bachelor degree education.What DevOn Offers: Unlimited holidaysChallenging assignments with several market leadersCar allowance, laptop and mobile phoneWeekly knowledge sessions with colleaguesTraining budget of €3.000 per year to become even more knowledgeable.Open work culture, lean hierarchy, work-life balance, no micromanagement, new-niche technology.Growth opportunities in a fast-moving, innovative organization.Learning by expert training, meet up sessions & in-house certified trainer-certifications. About DevOn:DevOn is a global technology company at the forefront of leading DevOps transformations and setting up High Performance Distributed DevOps teams with leading companies worldwide. DevOn helps market leaders to take the next step in software delivery. We consist of dynamic teams, in which personal growth is central to our organizations success.Within DevOn you get the chance to realize your ambition, in any direction. Do you really want to develop your knowledge and be known as a guru in the market? Or do you want to be more entrepreneurial and start your own team? You choose!To learn more, visit - https://devon.global

title: Machine Learning Engineer
description: ML Engineer Ready to break boundaries in the analytical world? Accelerate your ML engineering career with our advanced training program. We fully pay this program as well as your salary. Your job? Working as a ML(ops) engineer at one of our clients like Lely, ING, ASML or KLM on challenging projects. What kind of projects?✅ Help data-driven teams to build production-ready, scalable machine learning systems✅ Productionizing machine learning models✅ Maintain and improve automated ML pipelines and ML experimentation infrastructure focusing on scalability, usability, and performance The role itself· 2 fulltime weeks of hands-on bootcamp training where you’ll focus on writing deployable code, containerization, ML(ops) engineering and cloud fundamentals· Work 4 days a week as a ML(ops) Engineer at one of our clients like Heineken, Rabobank, ASML, Lely, FedEx, Vattenfall· Join us every Thursday at the Xccelerated office in Amsterdam/ on remote. Here you will get ongoing training and project support from our technical leads· At the end of your first year, you get the opportunity to join the partner organization directly As a ML(ops) Engineer you will work together with other medior- and senior team members on challenging projects for our clients. In these projects you will work on data science & ML related topics, such as predictive software solutions, fraud detection or data engineering challenges such as building data pipelines, developing on cloud architectures and productionizing machine learning models.Besides this, you like big data tools and programming frameworks to ensure that the raw data gathered from data pipelines are used to build production-ready scalable applications driven by data and AI. About XcceleratedXccelerated is an initiative within the Xebia Group, accelerating growth of Data, Cloud & AI competence. Our 13-month advanced training programs integrate hands-on learning and skill development with working at one of our partner companies. It is an intense learning journey for who have proven their potential and are ready for the next step in their career. Are you one of them? Join our dream team of 45 great people. Each member of our team brings a unique specialty and passion to our shared mission: eliminate the shortage of highly skilled Data & AI professionals. To achieve our goal, we empower each other to reach their full potential and inspire others to do the same. Or as Nikki, our ML engineer says: “The skills I learned at Xccelerated are incredibly valuable – I use them every day at work. After the bootcamp, I had the feeling that I wanted to rewrite all my previous projects”. This is youFrom a personal perspective, you are customer focused and have a strong can-do mentality. You focus on results, have a desire to complete challenging tasks and learn while doing. Next to this, you have: ✅ A technical bachelor’s or master’s degree (e.g. Data Science, Econometrics, Artificial Intelligence)✅ 2-4 years of work experience as a ML Engineer or Data scientist✅ Statistical knowledge but are mainly experienced with end to end systems and able to run, deploy and monitor them✅ Knowledge of open-source technologies like Spark, Kafka, Airflow or Kubernetes What Xccelerated offers 💰 Good salary🛫 25 vacation days📙 Kick off with 2 full-time weeks of hands-on bootcamp training📊 Technical trainings & Innovation days for a full year (every week)✅ Challenging assignments💻 Macbook and Iphone🍎 Lunches, amazing coffee and snack bar🎒Flexibility in working from home & at the office Interested? We’d love to meet you! Please get in touch! Contact Samantha Alves Goncalves at sgoncalves@xccelerated.io or by phone at 0613889770. Application Process · First interview with one of our recruitment consultants (Samantha or Jessie)· Making a technical assessment (from home) you will present to one of or Tech Leads (home/on remote) **We aim to complete an application process (from application to offer) within 1-3 weeks. As you will understand, this also depends on your own availability.

title: Data Scientist (L5) - Promotional Media - EMEA
description: Our mission at Netflix is to connect global stories with global audiences. When a Netflix member opens our app, we have a few precious moments to help them choose a story that is right for them at that instance. Presenting them evidence – Artwork, Trailers, Synopses – that authentically represents each title and resonates with the member is essential to this effort.Getting this evidence just right for each title is a tall order but our creative strategists, art designers, and video editors are masters of this. Perhaps a more unique aspect of Netflix is that these teams leverage data to inform their decision-making. This is made possible because Netflix UI is a thriving learning machine, personalized via reinforcement learning.Europe is a significant center for our broader Studio and Creative Production teams. We’re looking for a Senior Data Scientist based in our Amsterdam office to join our growing European team. In this role, you would serve as a trusted partner for regional Creative Production leadership. Given this data & insights-rich landscape, we are looking for a highly motivated Senior Data Scientist to partner with teams and product managers. This is an opportunity for you to have direct influence on strategic decisions through technical and thought partnership that will ultimately shape promotional content.As a Senior Data Scientist in this space, you will…As a Senior Data Scientist, you will be partnering with a diverse range of cross-functional partners to uncover new opportunities, design, execute, and analyze experiments, and deliver solutions that have a significant impact and implications for our usersYou will help drive innovations through effective identification and application of analytics, causal inference, experimentation, and machine learningThis is a high-impact role in which you will have a direct influence on how product decisions are madeEffectively identify and apply analytics, causal inference, experimentation, and machine learning techniques for given problemsLead the design, analysis, and interpretation of experiments Proactively perform data exploration on engagement behaviors to discover future opportunitiesIdentify, compute and validate the appropriate metrics to measure success in a product areaCultivate strong partnerships with cross-functional stakeholders from product, engineering, operations, design, consumer research, etcYou are…Advanced degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, Economics or related quantitative field5+ years relevant experience with large scale dataStrong statistical knowledge and intuition -
