description: For this position we require:• Academic degree (MSc / Phd) in Data Science, Computer Science, Mathematics or a related field (required)• Software development skills such as Git, bash scripting and release management and proven success in bringing analytics models to production (required)• A minimum of 5 years of experience in advanced analytics / modeling / artificial intelligence activities working with large data sets (required)• Highly skilled in working with Python, PySpark and Spark (required). Skilled in working withing Azure Databricks (preferred)• Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English (required)Our ideal candidate:• Is motivated to work on models that realize measurable impact (i.e. catch criminals), not necessarily to build the most complex advanced analytics models• Is structured, precise, communicative, and can work well with different people and roles• Thrives in a high-impact, dynamic and high-paced environment• Is pro-active, has a business focus and can-do mentality to make a difference in fighting financial crimeThe candidate will take responsibility for delivering the following results:• Build functionality into our data model (TDM) while continuing to combine all (30+) data sources required for Transaction Monitoring in a computationally efficient way. Our sources contain event data[e.g., transaction data and logging data from sources like CNA, AZS, PEX, RASS] and enrichment data (e.g., customer data and cash data from sources like Siebel, Omnikassa, Geldmaat, VCM)]• Ensure the TDM design enables the customer to comply with all regulatory, audit and other internal requirements (e.g., building a version on account level and a version on customer level)• Set-up the TDM to function as a solid building block that can function on its own, and can be leveraged by other (KYC/TM) projects as well• Make the computational performance of the TDM sufficient for daily batch scoring and for one-off runs on multiple years of data (using (Py) Spark)Assignment description:• The goal of this assignment is to add functionality to our data model (TDM), which enables comply with regulatory deadlines on Transaction Monitoring model changes, lookbacks andtuning & back-testing.• This functionality needs to be set up and computationally optimized, but once it is running it will be BAU to maintain it, and no external support will be required anymore.• Alignment throughout the assignment with technical and non-technical stakeholders (e.g. product owners) are expected to keep track of progress and results.• The Model Developer will accept the proposed solution if it aligns with technical and functional demands.End date: 1 -1-2025Location:In consultation, regular visits to the office in Utrecht which the candidate can schedule.

title: BI Analyst
description: Op het hoofdkantoorBij Albert Heijn werken is niet zomaar een baan. Het is werk met betekenis. Je werkt in een informele cultuur samen met een bevlogen team dat graag voorop wil blijven lopen en verschil wil maken. Met jouw unieke talent maak je impact op het leven van al onze klanten. Je leert van experts in hun vakgebied en we helpen je jouw loopbaan vorm te geven. Je kunt bij ons flexibel werken, zowel vanuit huis als op ons hoofdkantoor in Zaandam. Een baan bij Albert Heijn is niet alleen een baan voor nu, maar ook voor laterWat betekent dit voor jou?Als BI analist haal jij inzichten uit enorme hoeveelheden data die de Tech teams en het Tech management team in staat stellen om data gedreven beslissingen te maken.Jouw nieuwe baan en werkplek. Je maakt deel uit van het Portfolio Analytics team met twee andere analisten. De rol is een mix van het gebruik van jouw technische vaardigheden om gegevens te verzamelen en te analyseren, stakeholder management en het presenteren van informatie op een zinvolle manier. Je hebt veel interactie met verschillende belanghebbenden zoals managers, agile leads en product owners. Je daagt hen uit en legt onze (complexe) bevindingen op een eenvoudige manier uit.Het Portfolio Analytics team maakt deel uit van het grotere Portfolio Management team, dat bestaat uit een groep van 12 jonge, ambitieuze en enthousiaste collega's waarmee je nauw samenwerkt. Samen ondersteunen we het Tech-leiderschapsteam voor de merken Albert Heijn, Etos en Gall & Gall bij het beheren van hun portfolio en het volgen van hun prestaties.In deze functie werk je 40 uur per week, deels vanuit ons hoofdkantoor in Zaandam en deels vanuit huis.Dit ga je als BI analist bij ons doen. Je biedt waardevolle inzichten aan het Tech-management team en helpt verschillende Tech-teams beter te presteren door verschillende datasets te analyseren en verbeterpunten te identificeren.Je creëert interactieve Power BI dashboards die voldoen aan de behoeften van jouw stakeholders.Je ontwikkelt data pipelines die kunnen worden gebruikt door Power BI.Je werkt samen met collega's aan structurele oplossingen en geautomatiseerde analyses.Je gebruikt nieuwe analysemethoden en gegevensbronnen om waardevolle inzichten te ontdekken en deze om te zetten in experimenten voor innovatieve toepassingen.Je betrekt jouw stakeholders bij het data-analyse proces om nuttige inzichten en zakelijke impact te delen.We vinden het belangrijk dat jij bij Albert Heijn jezelf kunt zijn in een omgeving die openstaat voor verschillende perspectieven, een omgeving waarin we nieuwsgierig zijn en elkaar waarderen. Voor deze functie zoeken we bij voorkeur iemand die de diversiteit in ons team, in de breedste zin van het woord, versterkt. Iemand die vanuit eigen achtergrond en persoonlijke eigenschappen een ander geluid brengt en daarmee een goede aanvulling is op ons team.Dit bieden we jou. We betalen je inzet terug met een bruto jaarsalaris tussen 49k en 65k - afhankelijk van je ervaring. Dit bedrag is inclusief 8% vakantiegeld. Je werkt mee aan onze groei en ontvangt daarom een gegarandeerde winstuitkering. Je kunt 45 (ja, vijf-en-veertig) dagen met vakantie: je krijgt 25,5 vaste vakantiedagen en 19,5 ADV-dagen. Een uitstekende pensioenregeling bij het Ahold Delhaize PensioenfondsEen reiskostenvergoeding of NS-trajectkaart om van en naar Zaandam te reizen. 10% korting op je boodschappen bij Albert Heijn, tot maximaal €300 per jaar. Een Mijn Albert Heijn Premium abonnement met vele voordelen; Via onze Albert Heijn Deals ontvang je exclusieve kortingen op leuke uitjes en producten van grote merken. Een inclusieve omgeving waarin je op persoonlijk en vakinhoudelijk vlak continu kan blijven ontwikkelen. Dit breng je mee. Een afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding, bij voorkeur op het gebied van IT/data analyse/business intelligence Een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal.Ervaring met stakeholders management en advies geven aan hen.Ongeveer 2-3 jaar werkervaring als BI-analist, data engineer of een vergelijkbare rol;Aantoonbare kennis en ervaring van data-analyse en het presenteren van resultaten. Bij voorkeur op het gebied van portfoliomanagement, projectmanagement, agile ontwikkeling en financiële processen;Ervaring met visualisatietools zoals Power BIErvaring in het maken van data pipelines met behulp van Python/Pyspark/SQLKennis van Excel/Powerquery/DAX is een pluspunt;Ervaring met tools zoals ServiceNow, Jira, Github, Databricks is een pre.Ervaring in een corporate omgeving, retail organisatie of met een online platform is een pluspunt; Daarnaast ben je:Proactief en geef je zowel gevraagd als ongevraagd adviesSterk in het adviseren van de business en het betrekken van stakeholders.Communicatief vaardig; je weet complexe informatie uit te leggen aan een niet-technisch publiek.Een echte teamspeler met een innovatieve mindset. Samen beter eten bereikbaar maken. Voor iedereen. Bij Albert Heijn geloven we dat eten en drinken een essentiële rol speelt bij de grote uitdagingen in de maatschappij. Het levert een belangrijke bijdrage aan een gezonde levensstijl, het verbindt mensen en draagt bij aan een beter klimaat en daarmee een duurzame samenleving. Onze missie is dan ook: Samen beter eten bereikbaar maken. Voor iedereen.Ben jij er klaar voor om deze missie samen waar te maken? Klik op de sollicitatiebutton om te solliciteren. Dat kan ook als je nét niet alle artikelen van ons boodschappenlijstje in huis hebt. Wil je liever eerst meer weten? Neem contact met ons op!

title: Senior Data Engineer
description: Wat ga je doenAls Senior Data Engineer bij Future Facts leg jij het fundament voor onze Data Scientists en zorg je ervoor dat onze klanten waarde blijven halen uit hun modellen. Dit doe je door het ontwikkelen en implementeren van Machine Learning- en AI-oplossingen en het programmeren van datasystemen.Samen met een hecht en ambitieus team van meer dan 36 collega's ben je projectmatig bezig bij nieuwe en bestaande klanten verspreid over Nederland. Wij zijn niet gespecialiseerd in één sector, maar zoeken juist de uitdaging op door vele verschillende sectoren te helpen. Maar wel met één gemeenschappelijke factor: bij alle bedrijven maak je direct maatschappelijke impact.Elk project is anders en heeft daarom een ​​andere benadering nodig. Samen met je team bepaal je dan ook de meest efficiënte aanpak en de juiste tooling voor elk project. Jouw expertise en aanpak maken jou de beste adviseur voor het implementeren van onze oplossingen. De data- en machine learning engineers binnen Future Facts zijn de motor en brandstof achter onze oplossingen. In de praktijk betekent dit dat je veel bezig bent met het afstemmen van benodigdheden met technische en minder technische teamgenoten, het programmeren van verschillende oplossingen in de cloud en het reviewen van code van collega’s. Daarnaast kom je de volgende onderwerpen tegen in de projecten:Machine Learning en MLOps-toepassingen ontwikkelen in cloudomgevingen zoals Azure en AWSTechnologieën als Python, PySpark, Kafka, Docker, Kubernetes, Tensorflow en TerraformProcesvaardigheden zoals Scrum, DevOps, Automated Testing, CI/CDIn de projectteams met de klant gebruik je jouw soft skills als interview- en presentatietechniekenNaast inhoudelijk meewerken in de projectteams kun je ook junior collega's begeleiden of je specialiseren tot Technical Lead.Aanpak Future FactsWat Future Facts uitzonderlijk maakt in de markt is dat wij niet alleen de modellen ontwikkelen, maar deze ook naar productie brengen en daadwerkelijk implementeren in de cloud-omgeving van de klant. We rusten niet tot alles écht werkt en je de impact ziet van de vaak maatschappelijk-relevante oplossingen, zoals betere doorstroming in de sociale huursector, accuratere levering van postpakketten, het herkennen van aanstootgevende graffiti of snellere reparatie van een internetverbinding.Voorbeelden projecten:Voor de grootste chocoladefabrikant ter wereld, Barry Callebaut, heeft het team van Future Facts een model ontwikkeld om de kans op kinderarbeid bij lokale cacaoboeren te voorspellen.Het project ‘Hollandse Luchten’, wat vrij vertaald ‘Dutch Skies’ betekent, maakt gebruik van experimentele technologie en onderzoekt de waarde van nieuwe sensortechnologie voor inwoners van Noord-Holland. Er is een IoT-platform in AWS opgezet waarin de luchtkwaliteit continu wordt gemeten, samen met meetgegevens van de inwoners van Noord-Holland.Wat bieden wijSalaris tussen de € 4.000,- en € 6.500,- o.b.v. 40 uurEen leasebudget en bonusregelingTelefoon en laptop van de zaakOnkostenvergoeding én internetvergoedingSabbatical opties en goede pensioenverzekering27 vakantiedagen en 2 prestatieverlofdagenAandacht voor een persoonlijk ontwikkelingsplan en veel mogelijkheden om kennis uit te bouwen via cursussen, trainingen en opleidingenFlexibel werken: regie over je eigen werktijden - naast thuis en bij de klant, bieden we je een goed bereikbare werkplek in Amsterdam met een prachtig uitzicht over het IJWekelijkse stoelmassage, een gym, dakterras en Danz Café waar je altijd even een praatje kunt maken met je collega’sWat breng jij meeHBO/WO werk- en denkniveauMinimaal 3 jaar ervaring met cloud- en dataomgevingenJe bent gespecialiseerd in datalakes en analytics services binnen Azure of AWSKennis van big data processing (bijvoorbeeld Spark/PySpark, Kafka, AWS EMR, Databricks etc.)Kennis van storage- en database technologieën (bijvoorbeeld HDFS, S3, ADLS, GFS, Redshift, Cassandra, DynamoDB, MongoDB, Neo4J, FlockDB)De brug kunnen slaan tussen data, organisatie en data scientistsJe hebt een passie voor techniek, data en vooruitgangVloeiend in ten minste een programmeertaal (Python, C,C++, Java, SQL) Goede beheersing van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal in woord en geschrift

title: Data Engineering Intern
description: Who We AreWe are Metyis, a forward-thinking, global company that collaborates with business partners and clients to create and implement the capacities and capabilities required to improve future performance. We operate across a wide range of industries, and with our embedded partnership model we commit to driving sustainable growth for industry-leading organisations, elevating their potential with a long-term vision.At Metyis, we develop integrated solutions that enable growth by working within our business partners’ organisations with diverse and multidisciplinary teams. This collaborative environment allows Metyis to build strategies and execute them through an ecosystem that combines Big Data solutions, Digital Commerce solutions, Marketing & Design solutions, and Advisory services.Our teams are set up so that you have plenty of room to build bigger and bolder ideas by speaking your mind and being creative with your knowledge. Imagine the things you could achieve with a multidisciplinary team that encourages you to be the best version of yourself.We are Metyis. Partners for Impact.What We Offer3 months of intensive training from our super skilled Data engineering team on topics like data warehousing, data pipelines, distributed computing using Pyspark, data modelling & data lake.Followed by 3 months of relevant working experience on a live business case.Interact with clients regularly to drive their business towards impactful change.Play a key role in the team by creating new business solutions via data-driven insights.Receive guidance by a dedicated mentor to make sure you make the most out of your time at Metyis.Experience being part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.What you will doAssisting in the design, development, and maintenance of data pipelines to extract, transform and load data from various sources.Helping with data warehousing and data modelling activities.Participating in the creation of data-driven solutions to support business needs.Collaborating with data scientists, business analysts and software engineers to understand and implement data requirements.Implementing data quality and data governance processes.Participating in code reviews and providing constructive feedback.Staying up to date with the latest developments in data engineering technologies and best practices.What you’ll bringPursuing a degree in computer science, software engineering, or a related field.Strong programming skills in one or more programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala..Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.Ability to work well in a team environment.Good communication and interpersonal skills.Passion for Data: A strong interest in data and technology, and a desire to learn and grow as a data engineer.

title: Data Analytics Engineer
description: HighlightsJe hebt direct impact op trending topics binnen de grootste havenlogistiek van Europa. Je krijgt de mogelijkheid om jouw visie op Data Analytics in de praktijk te brengen en verder te ontwikkelen.Je begeleidt, faciliteert en inspireert Portbase en de havencommunity om het potentieel van data te benutten.Omschrijving van je professionele missieAls Data Analytics Engineer vind jij het leuk om het hele proces van de data flow te beheersen. Dat komt goed uit wanneer je aan de slag gaat met het bouwen van zowel data-pipelines als dashboards voor Portbase. Doordat je onderzoekend bent en een drive hebt om dingen te leren en beter te maken, zoek je actief naar mogelijkheden om continu te blijven verbeteren.Het team waarin je komt te werken heeft net een succesvolle migratie naar Databricks Lakehouse achter de rug en is klaar voor de toekomst. Het team is klaar om nog meer data-bronnen te ontsluiten en het potentieel van data te benutten. De ene dag werken wij met interne data om de klantbeleving te optimaliseren, de andere dag bouwen wij een dashboard om de havenlogistiek efficiënter te maken. Je werkt met de nieuwste technieken in AWS en er is veel ruimte om zelf in te vullen. Power BI, DAX, SQL, Python/Pyspark. Er is genoeg ruimte om te leren en op gebied van streaming data, Machine Learning, real time dashboarding en andere AI-toepassingen. Alles om de waarde uit de data te halen!Het Data Analytics team bestaat uit een Product Owner, Tech Lead, Data Analytics engineers en een Analytics Translator. Als centraal team binnen Portbase zijn wij van alle markten thuis. Wij ontwikkelen zelf dataproducten en dashboards, ondersteunen self-service analytics en bouwen samen met andere teams aan analytics oplossingen voor de havencommunity.Voor deze rol zijn wij opzoek naar een kandidaat die ons met name aanvult op het bouwen van dashboards in Power BI maar ook graag aan de slag gaat met data ontsluiten, preparatie en kennis heeft van data modelleren.We zoeken jou als je ons kan verrijken metErvaring met het bouwen van Power Bi dashboards.Ervaring met ETL en dimensioneel modeleren.Ervaring met het bouwen van data pipelines; in Python of SQL.Ervaring met Databricks is een pré.Ervaring met streaming data is een pré (zeker gezien de de toekomst).Interesse in gebruik van AWS Cloud Services (bijv S3, IAM, EC2).Interesse/ervaring in toepassen van Machine Learning.Een agile mindset en de wens om te werken in een DevOps cultuur.Analytisch denkvermogen om problemen te kunnen analyseren binnen het complexe domein van Portbase. Dit heb je opgedaan door een opleiding en/of werkervaring.Sterke vaardigheden op het gebied van proces- en stakeholdermanagement.Dit heeft Portbase jou te biedenEen flexibele werkplek op loopafstand van Station Blaak en De Markthal. Bij Portbase werken wij hybride.Performance management; ownership over je eigen ontwikkeling, jij hebt de regie, wij faciliteren.PKE’s (Portbase Knowledge Exchange); interactieve kennissessies.Veel ruimte voor creativiteit, innovatie en eigen initiatief.Prettige cultuur; we werken samen naar één doel waarin we waarde leveren aan de logistieke community. Dit voel je aan alles en merk je in de samenwerking.Prettige werksfeer; met een ontspanningsruimte, maandelijks een verzorgde gezamenlijk lunch/borrel.26 vakantiedagen; en de mogelijkheid om bij te kopen.Noodzakelijk tools en goede secundaire voorwaarden; laptop, telefoon, reiskostenvergoeding, goede pensioenregeling, etc.Goed jaarsalaris; inclusief een 13e maand.Over PortbaseWe opereren als IT-bedrijf en als logistiek dienstverlener. We zijn beiden en dat maakt ons sterk. We kennen de markt, de spelers en hun belangen. We brengen partijen samen, initiëren ketenafspraken en werken samen aan oplossingen die de Nederlandse havens en hun supply chains aantrekkelijk maken voor bedrijven die goederen via Europa willen vervoeren.We luisteren aandachtig naar alle partijen in de logistieke keten. Van rederij tot terminal, van chauffeur tot douanier: alle schakels in de keten hebben hun eigen uitdaging. We werken dan ook voor de gehele havencommunity. Zij werken efficiënter en effectiever door het eenvoudigweg op tijd verwerken van 90 miljoen transacties per jaar via 43 verschillende services.Keeping things movingPortbase bestaat 21 jaar en daar zijn we trots op. Wat ooit begon met de opdracht om papierwerk te digitaliseren, is uitgegroeid tot een van de meest vooruitstrevende Port Community Systemen van de wereld en een verbindende factor tussen alle havenpartners.Ook in de toekomst zullen we het voortouw blijven nemen in het ontwikkelen van keten brede digitale oplossingen om integrale dienstverlening eenvoudiger en veiliger te maken. Als er één ding is dat we hebben geleerd in de afgelopen 20 jaar dan is het dat we niet stil kunnen staan. Als havencommunity zijn we in beweging. Letterlijk.SollicitatieprocedureStap 1: Een van onze recruiters neemt contact met je op.Stap 2: Een 1e interview bij ons op kantoor met je toekomstige manager en een van onze recruiters Yen of Shanti.Stap 3: Een online assessment in de vorm van een game die je vanuit huis kan maken in maximaal 16 minuten.Stap 4: Een 2e interview bij ons op kantoor met een van je belangrijkste stakeholders en een collega uit het team.Stap 5: Een aanbod.Stap 6: Je ontvangt je contract en wij starten de pre-employment screening. De screening wordt uitgevoerd door een externe partij.Wil je meer weten over deze vacature of het werken bij Portbase, neem contact op met een van onze recruiters Shanti of Yen via werkenbij@portbase.comMet deze vacature werven wij zelf onze nieuwe collega. Als ons dat niet lukt, nemen wij de stap om een bureau in te schakelen om ons daarbij te helpen. Acquisitie stellen wij daarom niet op prijs. Voor deze vacature staan wij niet open voor een ZZP of tijdelijke invulling.

title: AWS Python Data Engineer
description: Role: AWS Python Data EngineerLocation: Hague Netherlands (Hybrid)Role Type : Contract 6-12 monthsMust be atleast B2 Level Dutch SpeakerMust Have:AWS, Python, CICD, SQL Candidate with good work experience on below skills: SQL Server (Must have) Data analysis skillsData modeling skills Data Build Tool (DBT) AirflowAWS Serverless architectureAWS services (RDS, Lambda using NodeJs/Python, ECS, S3, Athena, API Gateway etc.) Understanding of AWS network infra (Nice to have) CI/CD pipelines using Jenkins, Gitlabs and AWS Native toolsInfrastructure as Code AWS CDK / Terraform / etc., AWS CloudFormation (Nice to have) Python (Expert Level)PySpark , C# Data Bricks (nice to Have) Asset management domain knowledge - is big plus * Should have 5-8 years of experience * Good communication

title: Freelance/Interim Data Analyst - €70/hour - Randstad
description: Senior Data Analyst - Job Description As a Senior data analyst you will be helping the department to make good decisions, give direction to the right conversations and change perception where necessary. You ensure that that data is used efficiently and effectively. Key responsibilities as a Senior Data Analyst You take the lead on strategically important topics. You unlock timely, relevant and reliable data for your team and for stakeholders of the advertising domain. You analyze, edit, enrich and model (raw) data. You also develop the right dashboards and reports, with which colleagues can make well-founded decisions.You work closely with stakeholders (Leadership, Product teams, Sales teams, Operations teams) and translate their challenges into an organized roadmap of analyticsYou set priorities (autonomously), design analyses (which you also perform) and create dashboards (for self-service analysis)You gain extensive domain knowledge, so that you can effectively develop, monitor and monitor advertising business KPIsKey requirements as a Senior Data AnalystYou write high-quality and easily interpretable SQL and Python code, which colleagues can reuse. You can easily make the code scalable (because the data volume is growing steadily)Your days are extremely varied, but at their core, you use Pyspark, Tableau & Hadoop to create metrics, analytics, and predictions that help the business and advertisers make better decisionsYou inject data-driven insights into decision-making and discussions with a lot of persuasion, into conversations with everyone (ranging from colleague to CEO)You are a full sparring partner for the business and act as the data-driven conscience of the organization Please note: this is NOT a remote position, you have to be registered and located in the Netherlands.

title: Data Team Lead
description: Position: Data Team Lead / Lead Data Engineer Employment Type: Permanent, Full-TimeLocation: Amsterdam, NetherlandsStart Date: December 2023 - February 2024Salary: €80,000 to €95,000 per annumPackage: Bonus, Pension, Health Insurance plus many more benefitsWork Arrangement: Hybrid - 2 days on-site in Amsterdam per weekLanguage Requirement: Business language is English (spoken and written)Company Overview:The end client is a subsidiary of a prominent holding company, counted among the largest enterprises in the Netherlands, with a global presence spanning over 28 countries. The team comprises proficient Microsoft architects, developers, and engineers dedicated to the ongoing development and maintenance of business operations.Job Description:My client is seeking an experienced and dynamic Data Lead Engineer proficient in Microsoft Azure, Azure Data Pipelines, PySpark, and database technologies. This hands-on leadership position requires a candidate with a strong technical background, significant experience in leading and managing teams, and a proven track record in designing and implementing data solutions.Key Responsibilities:Lead and manage a team of data engineers, providing technical guidance, mentorship, and fostering a collaborative and innovative environment.Demonstrate expertise in Microsoft Azure, particularly in Azure Data Pipelines, PySpark, and various database technologies.Take a lead role in designing and architecting robust data solutions that align with business objectives and scalability requirements.Engage in hands-on development activities, contributing to the implementation of data pipelines and solutions.Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, analysts, and business stakeholders, to understand requirements and deliver effective data solutions.Implement and enforce best practices for data engineering, ensuring data quality, security, and compliance with industry standards.Stay abreast of industry trends and advancements in data engineering, bringing innovative ideas to improve processes and solutions.Background:3+ Years of extensive experience with Microsoft Azure, Azure Data Pipelines, PySpark, and various database technologies.Proven experience in a lead or managerial position, with a focus on data engineering.Strong hands-on development skills, with the ability to contribute to coding and implementation efforts.Excellent leadership and team management capabilities, with the ability to mentor and guide a team of data engineers.Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a keen attention to detail.Effective communication skills, with the ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.Additional Information:This is a remote position with flexible working arrangements.Relocation packages are available for qualified candidates willing to relocate to one of our office locations.The project is conducted in English, so fluency in English (spoken and written) is required.The role offers a competitive salary ranging from €80,000 to €95,000 per annum, depending on experience and qualifications.How to Apply:Should you find this opportunity compelling and believe your qualifications align with the position, we invite you to kindly forward your CV. Alternatively, you may choose to establish contact with me through LinkedIn or by email at Oliver.Wright@select-tech.co.uk.

title: Machine Learning Developer | Fabory Nederland
description: Wil jij machine learning en AI op de kaart zetten binnen Fabory? In deze functie ga jij voorspellende modellen bouwen op basis van historische gegevens en prognoses. Welke modellen meerwaarde bieden en hoe we dit binnen Fabory moeten opzetten, wordt jouw verantwoordelijkheid.De vacatureSamen met onze System Analist gegevensbronnen ontdekken, welke informatie deze bevatten en hoe we daar waarde uit kunnen halen. Selecteren van de juiste machine learning tools en modellen. Je maakt daarbij gebruik van cloudoplossingen (Azure) zodat de output geautomatiseerd in productie kan worden gebruikt. Verwerken, opschonen en valideren van de gegevens die je voor analyse gebruikt. Analyseren van grote hoeveelheden informatie zodat je patronen en oplossingen ontdekt. Begrijpelijk presenteren van de voortgang en resultaten aan business stakeholders. Ondersteuning bieden aan het team om machine learning modellen in productie te nemen. Bovenstaande proces implementeren, operationeel ondersteunen, onderhouden en documenteren en natuurlijk doelstellingen evalueren. BI/data collega's ondersteunen in datamodellering en rapportages. Je deelt best practises rondom data productie, data integratie en data gebruik. Hier gaan we vanuitAfgeronde HBO-/WO-opleiding richting Data Science, Econometrie, Business Analytics of een andere opleiding gericht op data. Je hebt een aantal jaar gewerkt in een vergelijkbare functie en bent toe aan meer verantwoordelijkheid. Je hebt een analytisch en ondernemend karakter. Je bent sterk in kwantitatieve vakgebieden zoals statistiek, techniek, operationeel onderzoek en economie of logistiek. Je hebt meer dan vijf jaar ervaring in analytics, data mining, statistische modellering of machine learning. Je bent in staat om cross-functionele teams op zowel zakelijke als technische discussies te sturen. Je bent in staat om complexe problemen op te lossen door grote hoeveelheden gegevens te analyseren en te verwerken. Je bent zelfsturend, flexibel en werkt zelfstandig. Je kunt goed overweg met analytische tools (bijv. Python/PySpark) voor statistische modellering, clustering, classificatie, machine learning en data mining. Je hebt een goede beheersing, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk, van de Nederlandse en Engelse taal. Ervaring met het leiden van een data science team is een pré. ArbeidsvoorwaardenEen enthousiast team dat nieuwe dingen wil bouwen! €4.500 - €5.500 bruto per maand (afhankelijk van je kennis en ervaring) 40-urige werkweek met veel flexibiliteit 28 vakantiedagen Laptop + telefoon die ook privé gebruikt mogen worden Over Fabory Nederland:At Fabory, we are committed to developing safe and reliable connections. We supply high-quality fasteners and innovative logistics solutions aimed at creating peace of mind for our customers. With more than 75 years of experience in fastening technology, Fabory is known for its unrivalled assortment and in-depth market knowledge. Headquartered in Tilburg, we have grown to become market leader in the Benelux with 100.000+ customers in 11 countries and 1.000 passionate employees.Opgericht in 1947Werkzaam in de Computersoftware.Werkzaam in 1 kantoor.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description: We supply the sustainable and innovative paints and coatings that our customers, communities – and the environment – are increasingly relying on. Our world class portfolio of brands – including Dulux, International, Sikkens and Interpon – is trusted by customers around the globe. We’re active in more than 150 countries and have set our sights on becoming the global industry leader. It’s what you’d expect from a pioneering paints company that’s committed to science-based targets and is taking genuine action to address globally relevant challenges and protect future generations.For more information please visit www.akzonobel.com.© 2023 Akzo Nobel N.V. All rights reserved.In ShortJoin AkzoNobel, a global leader in paint and coatings, and become a part of our high-performing Data Science team within the Center of Excellence for Integrated Business Planning (CoE IBP). We're looking for experienced data scientists who will help us optimize our planning cycle and end-to-end supply chain through robust data infrastructure and innovative solutions.Key ResponsibilitiesAs a senior data scientist, you will:Identify business needs and translate them into technical requirements.Collaborate closely with Data Engineers to establish a robust data infrastructure.Undertake data cleansing, standardization, and exploration.Implement statistical models, machine learning, predictive models, optimization, simulation models, and ad hoc analysis in a big data environment.Participate in A/B Testing and follow DevOps/ Agile WoW. What Do You Bring?We're seeking candidates with:A master's degree in operations research, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or any quantitative field.Experience implementing statistical models, machine learning, predictive models, and analysis in a big data environment.Proficiency in programming languages: Scala, Python, PySpark, SQL.Excellent communication skills, a team player mentality, and a curious mind. Preferred QualificationsFamiliarity with Azure Data Factory, Databricks, Alteryx.Experience with A/B testing.Experience in supply chain.Familiarity with Agile. Become Part Of An Outstanding CompanyAkzoNobel is consistently rated as one of the top employers in The Netherlands. You will join a company that is committed to achieving real sustainability. At a personal level you will also benefit from:A competitive salary with an above-average number of annual holidays.Participation in the AkzoNobel pension plan;Travel expenses to and from workOpportunities for education that will help you to grow beyond this role More Information And How To ApplyWe welcome your online application via https://www.akzonobel.com/en/careers . Only online applications including resume and cover letter will be considered. If applicable, it is essential that you have a visa that allows you to work in the Netherlands. If you have any questions, please contact our Talent Acquisition Partner Joost Smies. E-mail TalentResourcing.NL@akzonobel.com .The recruitment process includes a selection of the best applications received through the system, interview rounds and further steps. An online assessment might be part of the selection process.An employment screening may be part of the selection process.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability.

An online assessment might be part of the selection process.An employment screening may be part of the selection process.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability.

title: Senior Data Scientist
description: At a glanceABN is looking for a Senior Data Scientist to improve our customers experience providing a more personalized touch in their day-to-day banking.Your jobThe candidate is expected to fulfil the following responsibilities fully independent and with great ownership. Design the analysis: explicitly plan the analysis, anticipate and address competing explanation, determine the best way to evaluate the intended results. Conduct analysis: wrangle and explore the data appropriately, visualize and present the exploration results; develop/apply and devise appropriate algorithms; work as a thought data and algorithms lead; identify and integrate new datasets that can be leveraged through the product capabilities; work closely with the data engineering team to strategize and execute the development of data products; help solve various problems and make a true impact across various business units and domains. Business implementation: Discover the needs of the business/user; package technical work for diverse audiences; navigate the business organization structure; build a business network ; communicate analytic solutions to stakeholders and implement improvements as needed to operational systems. Engineering integration: Develop data pipelines from and to different (cloud and no-cloud) locations; make work compatible with the operationalisation stack; apply hands-on knowledge of the MLOps practices; co-create solution architectures; bring analytical models into production by collaborating with the engineers, co-create solution architectures. Way of working (WoW): Shape and enforce the WoW of the team and align it with other teams; work independently; collaborate with others; continuous improvement mindset; Lead complex use case: Lead complex projects, particularly XFN (cross-functional) projects; helping and influencing the grids (tribes) in the business line and the business units to prioritize their roadmap for more data driven solutions. Build the profession: Present in internal meetings and knowledge sharing sessions, as well as external conferences, meetups, workshops, encourage the team and staff; able to mentor and lead other data scientists.Working environmentThe CoE is a comprehensive data & analytics team part of Customer and Digital Experience (CDE) in ABN AMRO. Within Customer & Digital Experience the online platforms are being created and built that offer all the digital products of ABN AMRO. All these developments and products are powered by the data & analytics of our CoE.We strongly believe that online banking should be easier, faster, more delightful, and more personal to create sustainable long-term relationships with our customers. To do so, we develop suitable solutions that give our customers greater financial control. With a vast amount of data at hand, together with our unique usability lab as test-station we build digital services in an agile way that surprise customers and help them move forward. At Customer & Digital Experience you get the freedom and responsibility to improve our products & services. In other words, we encourage you to release your creativity and put it into practice. The environment is similar to a start-up atmosphere - feel free to wear your sneakers.Your profileThe ideal candidate is expected to: Have a master’s degree in computer science, engineering, mathematics, statistics; econometrics or related field; 5+ years of relevant industry experience Be able to analyse problems and strategize for better solutions Be comfortable in both a leadership and team-player role Be a creative problem solver who thrives when presented with a challenge Be goal-oriented, organized team player Good interpersonal skills and communication Expert in a wide arsenal of statistical, machine learning, deep learning and operation research techniques to help solve different classes of problems; having a deep knowledge of the models, their pitfall, knowing what types of transformations work best with them, being able to recommend, coach and convince other data scientists on the right technical approach, being able to balance between the model quality and the speed of delivery; Experience in network science and customer journey analysis; Comfort working in a dynamic environment with several ongoing concurrent projects; able to prioritize, and manage time effectively Experience with coaching and mentoring junior data scientists Up-to-date on the latest industry trends; able to articulate trends and potentials clearly and confidently Proficiency in using SQL, Python and PySpark. Knowledge of at least one of the cloud platforms (Azure, AWS, GCP) Experience in Banking and/or e-Commerce is a plus.We are offeringWe offer you a challenging position in a professional environment in which you get the opportunity to be the best version of yourself. You will be able to gain a lot of knowledge of the financial field and further develop your data science skills. We also offer the possibility to follow general and (specific) data science trainings. We offer you excellent terms of employment and benefits: A good monthly salary based on a 40-hour working week A position that offers a lot of opportunities for professional development The ability to work flexibly We help you to stay fit & vital An additional benefit budget of 11%, with which you can buy flexible terms of employment A personal development budget of € 1,000 per year An annual public transport ticket for unlimited travel A good pension scheme A great organization with a great work culture Interesting work and challenging projects A team that likes to help, supplement and strengthen each otherInterested?Are you interested? Please respond to this vacancy now. For more information about the role, please contact Valerio Ciotti, Team Lead Data Science (valerio.ciotti@nl.abnamro.com). For more information about the recruitment process, please contact Nicay Hertogs (nicay.hertogs@nl.abnamro.com).The interview processFirst interview (1 hour): we will get to know each other during the first interview. Aim of the interview is to assess the level of seniority and the fit with the team. We will also spend some time explaining what we are working on.Second interview (1 hour): There is a take home assignment. This is a modelling/data analysis, machine learning assignment designed to take a couple of hours to complete. Based on the outcome of the use case, we will invite you to present your results and test your technical knowledge on ML and statistics.Third interview (45 min): Cultural fit and your interest in working in ABN.Equal opportunities for allThe success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.Disclaimer external recruitment agenciesExternal recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.Wij vragen Goede communicatie vaardigheden Wij bieden Analytische skills

title: Machine Learning Ops Engineer
description: Are you the experienced ML Ops Engineer and are you looking for your next challenge and make impact on whole international communities while being challenged? Then read the vacancy and don’t hesitate to apply!Hi,we are Ahold Delhaize, a global family of caring brands helping people eat well, save time, and live better. That is what Ahold Delhaize (60m weekly customers, 413k colleagues) stands for. As one of the world’s largest and most forward-thinking food retail groups, our global family of local brands creates inspiring shopping experiences. Whether people shop at brick-and-mortars, prefer quick pick-ups, or opt for the convenience of ordering online, Ahold Delhaize delivers!We are growing our business quickly but responsibly. We advocate and accelerate sustainable retailing, responsible sourcing, supporting local communities, and helping customers make healthier choices in a world in transition. That requires the courage and wholeheartedness to have convictions and stand up for what we believe in. It also takes a growth-hacking mindset: tomorrow’s opportunities call for tomorrow’s skills. But most of all, it requires us to be there for the people and communities we serve. #daretocareJob ObjectiveAs a ML Ops Engineer your job is twofold:Improving MLOps frameworks/boilerplate that are used by data scientists and ML engineers and allows to speed up the deployment across the projectsImproving the deployment of existing ML projects (such as cross-sell, demand forecast, personalised offers)bridging gap between data scientists, data- and software engineers, improving data scientists code into production ready state. Work on designing and developing new- generation machine learning tooling and technologies to offer AD data science community products that enable more efficient and stable coding environmentsDay-to-day responsibilities include:Collaborate with data scientists to build ML-enhanced software productsDefine and implement retraining strategies for ML systemsConvert data science prototypes to production-ready systemsEnsure team’s code is modularized, reusable, tested, and properly versionedDefining governance around ML, post-deployment monitoringHandle model and data versioningAlong with unit and integration test, build and maintain model validation frameworkWork with scrum teams to implement predictive modelsOur ideal candidate would look like this:>4 years experience in Machine Learning roleHands-on experience in building ML models and deploying them to production solid understanding of MLOps principles and ML conceptsexperience with cloud service provider ML ecosystem such as AWS SageMaker, Azure ML, Databricks.experience working with orchestration tools such as Airflow, Mage.experience working with machine learning libraries such as Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch, etc.strong Python experience, pySpark is a plusexperience with API design, DevOps and CI/CD experience with creating architectural designs for machine learning projects using cloud frameworks like AWS, Azure or GCPhands on experience with Docker and Kubernetesexperience with both SQL and NoSQLcollaborative mindset and “can do” attitudeThis Is How You Keep GrowingAhold Delhaize is growing enthusiastically, but sustainably. If we can grow while having a more positive impact on people or our planet, we’re going for it. We encourage all of our 413,000 colleagues to share this attitude on a personal level, so opportunities to master new skills and expand your capabilities are a given. And because we’re a global family of brands, finding your next challenge comes (almost) as naturally as calling an actual relative. We #daretocare for our people at all levels. What that translates to in this role?a gross annual salary up to €90k / year incl. holiday allowance and excl. bonusan excellent pension plan with an employee contribution of 4.7%twenty vacation days and a personal budget for you to decide whether to spend it on twelve and a half extra vacation days, discounts or a payoutFlexible working hours: We foster a vibrant culture by balancing in-person connections and cross-functional collaborationreimbursement for travel expenses to and from Zaandamattractive discounts on various insurance policiesa laptop and a phonea 10%-discount on your groceries at our Albert Heijn stores up to €300 per yearMembership in a diverse community that wholeheartedly embraces courage, inspires growth, and dares to care Dare to care and grow with us? We look forward to teaming up! Virtually and at your home away from home: our vibrant HQ, right next to Zaandam station.At Ahold Delhaize and our local brands we define diversity broadly, seeing it as inclusive of thoughts and skills, generational differences, LGBTQ+, gender, race and ethnicity, disabilities, nationalities and more, and we accept all people for who they are.ApplyWant to know more before you hit the Apply button? For questions you can contact Peter Dirks via peter.dirks@ah.nl

title: Data Engineer
description: We’ve been pioneering a world of possibilities to bring surfaces to life for well over 200 years. As experts in making coatings, there’s a good chance you’re only ever a few meters away from one of our products. Our world class portfolio of brands – including Dulux, International, Sikkens and Interpon – is trusted by customers around the globe. We’re active in more than 150 countries and have set our sights on becoming the global industry leader. It’s what you’d expect from the most sustainable paints company, which has been inventing the future for more than two centuries.Purpose of the jobIntegrated Business PlanningThe Data Science team is positioned within the CoE IBP (Center of Excellence for Integrated Business Planning). IBP is the management process through which we run the company. It is a process of structured collaboration which aligns all layers and functions around one set of data, one plan, and joint decisions. In the CoE IBP, we standardize and optimize the planning cycle and E2E supply chain, as an end goal to optimize service level, cost, and inventory. This enables the company to achieve the best possible performance for our customers, employees, and shareholders.The Data Science team serves as the brain of the CoE IBP where insights are generated, processes are automated, and solutions are built. We are looking for (senior) data engineers to join our high performing team. We aim to attract and further develop the best Data Science & Supply Chain talent. You can find an impression of our team and some of the topics we work on in this testimonial of prior interns: Click here!Key Responsibilities:Collect business requirements from the various stakeholders (Data Scientists, Data Visualizers, Product Managers, IM) Translate business requirements into technical requirements, systems, and solutionsDesign, develop and document the technical solution: creation of data pipelines for data transfer between different storage servicesMaintenance of the solution: Actively monitor and manage the system/ solutions performance in close contact with the solution architectDevOps/ Agile WoWWhat do you bring? Basic QualificationsBSc in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or any quantitative fieldExperience in designing and building advanced ETL pipelines in a big data environmentBig data frameworks: Apache Hadoop, Apache Spark, RapidMiner, Cloudera Programming languages: Scala, Python, PySpark, SQLSound communication skillsTeam playerCurious mindPreferred QualificationsMSc in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics, or any quantitative fieldPlatform: Azure Data Factory, Databricks, AlteryxExperience in supply chainFamiliar with AgileBecome Part Of An Outstanding CompanyAkzoNobel is consistently rated as one of the top employers in The Netherlands. You will join a company that is committed to achieving real sustainability. At a personal level you will also benefit from:a competitive salary with an above average number of annual holidays;participation in the AkzoNobel pension plan; travel expenses to and from work;opportunities for education that will help you to grow beyond this role;Fixed Bonus.Part-time: 32-40 hours workweekTraining: APICS, Microsoft Certification, Language Courses, Agile CoursesWe welcome your online application via https://www.akzonobel.com/en/careers. Only online applications including resume and a cover letter will be considered.The recruitment process includes a selection of the best applications received through the system, interview rounds and further steps. An online assessment might be part of the selection process.An employment screening may be part of the selection process.All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or veteran status.Requisition ID: 30975

title: DATA ENGINEER ( SQL , UML, ETL, NL /EN )
description: You will create, maintain and support data pipelines; You will take care of the design and maintenance of data models, together with the team; You’ll architect data solutions and develop a roadmap for the data & analytics landscape; You will create and/or improve our reporting standards; You’ll provide the data analytics team the right tools and framework. To gather all necessary details and define requirements for the business, you will collaborate closely with data engineers, data scientist and report developers; You will be working cross departmental on various data driven projects and enable our business, together with the team to create value by using data; You will be working with on-premises as well as cloud-based data architecture and technology and help shaping this modern data landscape.You will create, maintain and support data pipelines;You will take care of the design and maintenance of data models, together with the team;You’ll architect data solutions and develop a roadmap for the data & analytics landscape;You will create and/or improve our reporting standards;You’ll provide the data analytics team the right tools and framework.To gather all necessary details and define requirements for the business, you will collaborate closely with data engineers, data scientist and report developers;You will be working cross departmental on various data driven projects and enable our business, together with the team to create value by using data;You will be working with on-premises as well as cloud-based data architecture and technology and help shaping this modern data landscape.You have a result-driven and hands-on mindset and prefer to work in an agile environment.You are a team player and good communicator.You have experience with SQL or other data-oriented development languages (Python, Scala, PySpark etc. .. ).You have experience with UML modelling and ER modellingYou are familiar with the concept of data pipelines and have some development experience on them.You have a master or bachelor‘s degree in the field of engineering or computer scienceYou like to iterate quickly and try out new thingsIdeally, you have experience with a wide variety of data tools & data like geospatial, time series, structured & unstructured, etc. ..Experience on Microsoft Azure is a plusExperience with machine learning and AI is a plusExperience with reporting tools is a plus (Grafana, Power bi, Tableau)Having a healthy appetite and open mind for new technologies is a plus

title: Power BI Developer / Engineer (HR)
description: At a glanceAre you passionate about working with HR data, do you have hands-on experience with data engineering techniques, and do you want to help us increase the happiness and effectiveness of our employees? Then we believe we have a great opportunity for you.We are looking for a Power BI Engineer to join our HR Analytics team. HR Analytics is a team of 14 professionals who support fact-based HR via dashboards, workforce planning, surveys and statistical (machine learning) analyses. Together with you we want to deliver high quality Power BI insights and bring our data management to a higher level, by migrating our local data model to ABN AMROs Azure platform (Databricks). We need the help of an experienced data solutions expert to support this migration, and help us develop new data pipelines on which we can re-build our statistical models and dashboards.Your jobWe are looking for a liaison person between the Power BI front-end developers and the IT data supplier. You are responsible for the monthly data runs in order to refresh all of our Power BI dashboards as well as the maintenance of the Power BI workspaces, data pipelines and data flows. In a short period of time you are able to obtain extensive knowledge of our large and complex data model to be able to make the necessary future changes to support production or to support new requirements.Additionally, you can help existing data engineers in refactoring our current local Python data pipelines onto Databricks by using PySpark and SQL, based on business requirements from the dashboard team and data science team.Your ability and willingness to work with others is crucial for your success in this role. You are naturally someone who takes initiative, structures and organises work well and is keen to work with others to deliver tangible results. You are practical, have an analytical approach and good communication skills. You are a strong team player and you take responsibility for your work. In the dynamic environment in which you operate, you have the ability to get all stakeholders on board.Working environmentYou will be working as a Power BI Engineer within the human resource domain in a dynamic, energetic team of professionals who all are critical thinkers and share the same passion: helping HR become more evidence-based. In this job, you focus on high-impact cases on top of our business agenda. You will join a team recognized inside and outside the bank as a front runner in people analytics. We are ambitious and learning every day. We offer an exciting and dynamic work environment with many opportunities for innovation. We provide personal development opportunities and encourage co-working on other HR analytics products like survey management, advanced analytics, organizational design, and strategic workforce planning.As a business data modeler you work closely with the HR Analytics and the IT department. You represent the business in the delivery and therefore hierarchically you report to the team lead of HR Analytics.Your profileYou are up to date with the latest developments in Power BI and data. The job requires excellent analytical skills and an eye for detail.You have an affinity with HRStrong analytic skills and affinity with Power BI development, data analytics, (pre)processing, and data handling;Experience in Power BI Platform, in particular: DAX, M/PowerQuery, Tabular Editor (c#), DAX Studio is a mustExpertise in Python, Notebooks and Pandas is a mustExpertise in Azure Databricks, Python, PySpark, SQL Experience handling structured and unstructured datasets (must)Experience in data modelling and Kimball methodology (must)Experience in stakeholder management / alignment with IT as data supplierExperience in migration of data backendsExperience with batch, streaming and APIExperience with data management, data governance, DQ, and meta dataPro-active attitude and an excellent team player. We are offeringWe are offering a role within a global leading people analytics team in a challenging environment. Additionally we offer you:The opportunity to develop yourself on hard as well as soft skills. A good work-life balanceThe opportunity to be the best you can be, work flexible hours and lots of room to grow both personally and professionallyA hybrid way of workingA salary based on your experience*A supplementary benefit budget of 11%, which you can spend on additional fringe benefitsA personal development budget of EUR 1.000 per yearAn annual public transportation pass A solid pension planInterested?If you find this vacancy interesting and it fits your expectations and qualifications, you can apply online. If you have questions, please contact jaap.veldkamp@nl.abnamro.com (Lead HR Analytics) or marc.henselmans@nl.abnamro.com (PO HR Reporting and surveys).Equal opportunities for allThe success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.Disclaimer external recruitment agenciesExternal recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.Wij vragen Een creatief brein Wij bieden Analytische skills

title: Data Engineer
description: You will get the opportunity to work in beating heart of data within the Rabobank. You will work together with people who have an insatiable curiosity in technology, data, and self-development. You will heavily invest in your career. You will make memories.As a Data Engineer you can make a differenceWithin the Tribe Data & Analytics you will work in the centre of the data driven enterprise. The tribe contains 6 area’s:Global Data PlatformAnalytics PlatformData & Factory ServicesData ScienceBusiness IntelligenceCustomer AnalyticsFor about 40 squads are divided over these areas. In all areas we data engineers play an important role. We need your help to design, build and run ground breaking solutions that are as valuable to our 7 million customersYou will be responsible forAs a Data Engineer you will your main purpose is to make sure that data can be used for operational and analytical purposes.ExperienceAbove all we are looking for new colleagues with an insatiable curiosity in data, technology and self-development on a medior/senior level. You get excited by building and deploying big data pipelines in the cloud. In the Squad you work on Azure, where you use cloud native components and value the separation between storage and computing. Data frames are not a new concept to you and you write code in either PySpark or use Azure Data Flow for your ETL needs. Your deployments are automated and you are able to quickly prototype your solutions.You have a couple of years of experience in using the concepts/components in a production environment:As a Data Engineer within the tribe D&A it would be great if you have experience with the following technologies (if you don’t thick all of the boxes we still would love to meet you):Azure Data Factory Azure Databricks using Python/SQL Data modelling and SQL Airflow Azure Synapse API Development on Azure (preferably with python) Scripting either PowerShell or bash Azure DevOpsAzure Data Lake Storage Azure Functions Build and deploy with Azure DevOps Set up data quality and monitoring Develop unit tests (TDD) The competences we would like you to have:Eager to learn new techniques Enjoy to teach and share knowledge Good communication skills Strong collaboration with other roles in the Scrum team Drive to continuously improve Take ownership of the build, run and change process CuriosityWhat do we offer?We would love to help you achieve this by focusing firmly on your growth, development, and investing in an environment where you keep learning every day. We give you the space to innovate and initiate. In this way, we offer you numerous opportunities to grow and help you exceed your expectations, to do the right thing exceptionally well, and to therefore grow as a professional. In addition, with us (on the basis of a 36-or 40 hour working week), you can also expect:Based on your experience: up to € 5655,- gross per month (scale 9) or up to €6741,- gross per month (scale 10)Thirteenth month's salary and 8% holiday allowancean extra budget of 11% of your gross salary to be used at your discretion. Buy extra holiday hours, add more to your pension savings or ask for part of the extra budget to be paid out.a budget of € 750- to set up your home working space and a monthly home working allowance of up to € 40-a personal development budget of € 1,400-a combination of working from home and at the office100% reimbursement of commuting costs if you travel by public transportA pension scheme to which you contribute 3.5%151.2 hours holiday per year + 1 Diversity Day per yearThis is a selection of the terms of employment for a Data Engineer based on a 36-hour working week. You can find all terms of employment on rabobank.jobs/en/conditions-of-employment.You and the job application processReply to the vacancy for Data Engineer at Rabobank.Any questions about working at Rabobank and the process? Oscar van Dijk, IT Recruiter, oscar.van.dijk@rabobank.nlWe will hold the interviews through a video call.You can find answers to the most frequently asked questions on rabobank.jobs/nl/veelgestelde-vragen.A security check is part of the process.We respect your privacy.Growing a better world togetherYou are already aware that Rabobank is a financial services provider for millions of customers in 40 countries. But did you know that we aim to contribute to real change with our “Growing a better world together” mission? We do so in countless ways, such as:A third of all the food we purchase is thrown away. Together with Nature & Environment, we’re working to increase awareness among consumers of how to reduce food waste.As part of a project with Humanitas, we are helping people who are experiencing financial difficulties to get their household finances in order.Together with Vluchtelingenwerk Nederland (the Dutch Council for Refugees), we are helping 1,500 refugees find a suitable job.Interested? Please contact us.

title: Data Analyst Internship
description: Welcome to SkillLabAt SkillLab, we envision a world where everyone has equal career opportunities. We enable and lead a radical change - a focus on skills instead of titles and degrees. Our AI-driven technology creates more inclusive and efficient labor markets. SkillLab is working with employment and career services in 25+ countries and seeks to transform labor and education markets globally.Your opportunityYou will experience the culture of a technology start-up company with a social missionYou will work in an international team with team members from +25 countries and clients across the globeYou will work closely with the the data science team to provide data-driven insights to every part of SkillLab and its clients. Your teamYou will work closely with Rihab is one of our Data Scientists at SkillLab. Rihab is specialised in taxonomies. Her responsibilities include developing and maintaining our taxonomies' data structures, as well as training and evaluating NLP models.Aaron leads the data science team and has many years of experience in multiple industries in data science and AI. Anna is a data scientist specialised in recommendation systems.We are proud of the people we work with and excited to work in a company with a social mission. We hope you will be too!What You Will DoYou will support our monitoring and reporting processes like finalising their delivery method and expanding the indicators for monitoring and automating reporting pipelinesYou will work with our Solution Delivery team on impact trackingYou will assist our data scientists in user & project segmentation and experimentationYou will cooperate with the developers and the UX team to improve data visualisations and insights in the productRequirementsIs this you?You studied in a field with quantitative analytical skills such as data science, statistics, physics, computational social science, computer science, etcYou are comfortable using SQL to retrieve and manipulate dataYou are comfortable in Python for performing data analysisYou have knowledge of essential statistics and data visualisationsYou are eligible to work in the Netherlands. We don’t support visa applications for applicants from outside the EUYou are currently enrolled as a student in your final year or graduated within the last 12 monthsYou are able to commit to a six month internshipExtra awesomeKnowledge of statistical tests (for example, hypothesis tests, factor analysis)Experience using PowerBI and integrating with cloud data warehousesStrong knowledge of Python and visualisation tools like StreamlitComfortable using a cliCompensation, start-date & locationThis is a paid internship. If you live in Amsterdam or relocate to Amsterdam during your internship, then the monthly reimbursement is will be 1.000 EURYou can do the internship by living in another city in the Netherlands and commuting to the office 1-2 days per week. If you do the internship remotely, then the monthly reimbursement will be 700 EUR. SkillLab covers your train commuting expenses to AmsterdamWe accept applications on rolling basis and we envision a start date in January/February 2024BenefitsYou will have a personal learning budget to invest in your professional developmentYou will have access to mentors & coaches (SkillLab is part of the Google for Startups SDG accelerator)You will have access to a monthly flexible budget of benefits via Yourcampus app. You can spend this budget on a large selection of providers, ranging from gym memberships to bike subscriptions and online storesYou will join our bi-annual company offsite retreats in different locations like Belgium, Germany etcOur selection procedureYou apply for the role and we review your profileWe will invite you for a short screening callWe will invite you for a 60min interview if we find that you are a good fit. The interview will involve a live coding testWe will offer you the internship and discuss logistics, if we think that you are the ideal candidate for the roleWhat else to know?This job description is intended to provide a general overview of the internship position and may be subject to change based on the organization's requirements and prioritiesIf this job is not for you, perhaps you have a friend who might be a good fit. Send them this job posting! Get 3 tips for your application: https://skilllab.io/en-us/news/skilllabjobapplication SkillLab is committed to diversity, equality, and inclusion at the workplace. We welcome applications of candidates from all backgrounds

title: Power BI Developer
description: Job Overview:As a Power BI Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining data visualizations and reports using Power BI. Your primary focus will be on creating data-driven solutions that empower decision-makers and enhance business performance, with a particular emphasis on the semiconductor industry. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 8 years of experience in data analysis and visualization, with a strong understanding of Power BI and excellent communication skills.Key Responsibilities:Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and translate them into effective Power BI solutions.Develop and maintain interactive dashboards, reports, and data models using Power BI.Optimize and streamline data sources for efficient data retrieval and analysis.Implement data security and access control to protect sensitive information.Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business decision-making.Troubleshoot and resolve any technical issues related to Power BI reports and dashboards.Keep up-to-date with the latest developments and best practices in Power BI and data visualization.Communicate effectively with clients and internal stakeholders, presenting data insights and recommendations.Requirements:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent work experience).8+ years of experience in data analysis, business intelligence, and data visualization.Strong proficiency in Power BI, including DAX (Data Analysis Expressions) and M Query.Experience working with semiconductor clients is a significant plus.Excellent communication skills in English, both written and spoken, for effective client interactions and team collaboration.Proven ability to work independently and as part of a team, with strong problem-solving skills.Strong analytical thinking and attention to detail.Project management skills and the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously.Powered by JazzHRcd1mowl9WY
